loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old divorced woman. She has three children aged between 16 and 22. She describes herself as hardworking. 
Jane operates a clothes retail store. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in Nairobi central. Jane describes her biggest business challenge to be the low purchasing power of her customers. She will use her loan of 40,000 KES to buy more clothes for resale and to renovate her business stall. Her business goal is to run a boutique within five years.

loans.use: to renovate her store and add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is 41 years old and married with four children between the ages of 5 and 12. All of the children are in school. She sells cassava in a store she has run for 25 years. Jean would like a loan to buy more cassava and new products such as rice, sugar, sorghum, and cooking oil. Any profits will be used to create savings for her family. She hopes to diversify the items in her store in the future.

loans.use: to buy cassava, sugar, rice, and cooking oil for sale.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús de 54 años, es una mujer buena y amable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo que ya es mayor e independiente a quien educo y alimento como solo una madre de carácter como el de ella lo puede hacer, vive en su casa junto a su conviviente con quien comparte sus días entre trabajo y momentos de alegría juntos. El trabajo de Jesús consiste en la siembra y cosecha de diversos productos regionales, ella todas las semanas se va vía fluvial a través del río Ucayali a una comunidad muy alejada llamada Cunchuri, ahí es donde tiene una chacra y siembra plátano, maíz, frejol y otros productos que le permite plantar la buena tierra que posee, lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años y recibe la ayuda de su conviviente.
Cuando empezó a hacer este trabajo le era un poco complicado ya que no tenía los conocimientos necesarios para poder ser una buena agricultora, pero en base a muchas capacitaciones y deseos de superarse pudo lograrlo y ahora su tierra le produce productos de buena calidad y muy solicitados en la ciudad, a parte de tener un buen ingreso también le gusta mucho poder estar entre la naturaleza y ver crecer a sus plantaciones, espera que le siga yendo todo bien y mas adelante poder sembrar en mayor cantidad. Este será el crédito numero 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior que tuvo, además está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios. Con el monto solicitado 2000 soles, comprará semillas para poder sembrar en mayor cantidad, además de guardar algo para poder usar como gastos de movilidad cuando trae sus productos a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Jesús is a friendly 54-year-old woman. She lives with her common-law husband with whom she has a boy who is already grown up and independent.  She fed him and provided for his education as only a mother of good character like her can do.  She spends her days with her common-law husband, working together and sharing moments of joy.

Her work consists of planting and harvesting different types of regional produce.  Every week she travels via the river Ucayali to a community that is very far away called Cunchuri.  This is where she has a pond and plants bananas, corn, beans and other crops on the good land that she has.  She has been doing this work for ten years and receives help in this from her common-law husband.
When she started this work it was a little difficult for her since she did not have the knowledge necessary to become a good farmer.  However, with a lot of training and determination to improve her situation, she was able to learn the necessary skills, and now her land produces crops of good quality that are highly sought-after in the city.

Apart from having a good income, she enjoys very much being able to be out in nature and see her crops grow.  She hopes that everything keeps going well and that further down the road she will be able to plant a larger quantity.

This will be her second loan with MFP, and she hopes that their collaboration will continue to help her meet her objectives.  She has also promised to repay her loans as she did with the first loan.  Further, she is very happy to belong to her communal bank as all the members are very responsible, and they have a lot of solidarity.

With this loan she is seeking 2000 soles, with which she will buy seeds to enable her to plant greater quantities, and to save some of the money for travel expenses when she brings her crops to the city.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Aura Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Aura Cecilia trabaja como empleada doméstica realizando aseo y limpieza a casas de familia, debido a que en esta actividad recibe pocos ingresos, se vio en la necesidad de generar una nueva fuente de ingresos que le permita tener los recursos suficientes para su sostenimiento y el de su familia; es así como la señora Aura Cecilia desea comprar un carro para preparar comidas rápidas los fines de semana como hamburguesas y perros calientes. El sueño de la señora Aura Cecilia es mejorar su calidad de vida y poder suplir sus necesidades básicas.
texts.en: Aura Cecilia works as a housekeeper cleaning family homes.  Because this job doesn't earn her much money, she needed to come up with a new source of income so she would have enough income to support her family.  This is why Aura Cecilia wants to buy a car; to prepare fast foods, such as hamburgers and hot dogs, on the weekends.  Aura Cecilia's dream is to improve her quality of life and be able to meet her basic needs.

loans.use: to buy a car to prepare fast foods and to buy ingredients

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a personal products selling business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from a sari-sari store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy more perfumes, body lotion, deodorant and other personal products to sell to customers. Mary Grace hopes to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, body lotion and other personal products.

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children.
 
Marifel has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for three years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Marifel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marifel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Azarious

texts.en: Azarious is a married man living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children and to build a permanent house. He has been a farmer for the last thirty years, and his major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, and inadequate capital to purchase equipment. However, he has a vision of diversifying his farm and expanding it to new areas. Azarious needs the requested loan to buy seeds for planting.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting.

loans.name: Shaka Group

texts.fr:
Jean   fait partie du groupe  Shaka  et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 53 ans et est marie à Euphrasie, une cultivatrice. 

Il fait  de planche  depuis 15 ans. 

Il  est s à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup de  planches  à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Jean is part of the Shaka group and lives in Gitega. He is 53 years old and married to Euphrasie, a farmer. He has been making boards for 15 years. He is on his fifth Turame loan. With the Kiva loan he will receive, he will increase his capital and buy a lot of boards to resell and earn more.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy many boards to resell and earn more.

loans.name: Hudoyor

texts.ru:
Худоер молодой мужчина 41 года. Он женат и имеет 6 детей. Живет Худоер со своей семьей в сельской местности. У него собственный частный дом.
Худоер торгует на рынке медом. Он покупает мед оптом и продает в розницу. Для этого арендует магазин. У него мед хорошего качества и поэтому хорошая торговля. От данного дела Худоер получает хороший доход.
В данный момент Худоер хочет расширить свой бизнес, для этого ему понадобились деньги. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом.  
Он заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.

loans.use: for business expansion

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: A 34 years old woman, married with 4 children lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learnt her business for 5 years before she started her business in the year 1992. According to her, the said amount $400 will boost her business if it comes to her.

loans.use: Purchase of more goods for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She would like to pay part of the school fees for her children

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 29 years old and married with two children. One of them is in school. He has an electric materials shop in the Kirkuk market.

This is his first loan. He wants to get $1000 to buy electric materials from another city and bring them to Kirkuk. He is looking to develop his shop and bring more goods. He is working 10 hours per day without any rest. His brother works with him in the same shop, and he wants to hire two jobless people to work with him.

He said, "I was born into a poor family, and I'm not ready now to return to poverty. I will work and earn money."

Note: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, etc.).

loans.use: Buy electric materials

loans.name: Ana Leticia

texts.en:
Ana Leticia J., 19, who lived in San Felipe, has a tiny food and convenience store where she sells sugar, tamales, fruit, potatoes, and beans. The little store has been operating for seven years, but only in the last year (using Friendship Bridge credit) did they acquire a refrigerator so they can offer cold drinks. The refrigerator is now paid off completely.

Ana Leticia is on her 5th loan, having grown her credit to where she can ask for 2500 Guatemalan Quetzals, which will be used for inventory for the store. Eventually she hopes to open a larger store. It is her hope to prosper so that she can provide for her two children. Her group of women is called "Barrio La Llovizna".

During this time of year (the rainy season) the children are particularly susceptible to illness, especially diarrhea, so there are more expenses for medical care and more fear for the children's health. One of Ana Leticia's hopes is to have enough resources to cover the family's health needs during this season.

loans.use: Inventory for Ana Leticia's food store

loans.name: Odinahon

texts.ru:
Odinahon is 31 years old and has 3 children. Her husband is earning money in Russia. In order to supplement the family budget Odinahon raises cattle at home. This brings good profits. After getting a loan from MicroInvest she purchased a bull. After feeding it for a while she sold it and used the resulting profits for family expenditures. Today Odinahon plans to get a new loan which she plans to use for the purchase of another bull.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Îäèíàõîí 31 ãîä, ó íåå 3 äåòåé. Åå ìóæ íàõîäèòñÿ íà çàðàáîòêàõ â Ðîññèè. ×òîáû äîïîëíèòü ñåìåéíûé áþäæåò Îäèíàõîí çàíèìàåòñÿ îòêîðìîì ñêîòà ó ñåáÿ äîìà. Ýòî ïðèíîñèò õîðîøèé äîõîä. Ïîëó÷èâ çàéì â Ìèêðîèíâåñò îíà ïðèîáðåëà áû÷êà. Íåìíîãî îòêîðìèâ åãî îíà ïðîäàëà è ïîëó÷åííûé äîõîä ïîòðàòèëà íà ñåìåéíûå ðàñõîäû. Ñåé÷àñ îíà ñîáèðàåòñÿ ïîëó÷èòü íîâûé çàéì, êîòîðûé îíà ïîòðàòèò íà ïðèîáðåòåíèå åùå îäíîãî áû÷êà.

loans.use: to buy 1 bull

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Before joining TYM fund, 33 years old Nguyễn Thị Hiền and her family could only depend on the crop from their small piece of land. After consulting with her husband, she applied for a loan from TYM fund to buy machinery to husk rice. It was a good move on her part as the rice husking business brings in 125 USD a month. She's requesting a new loan of 325 USD to buy more machinery and expand her business. Her family had raised above poverty and they are an example for other entrepreneurs.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Khi chưa tham gia vào quỹ thì cả gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Hiền, 33 tuổi, chỉ trông chờ vài sào ruộng nhưng sau đó chị đă bàn bạc với chồng và mạnh dạn vay vốn của Quỹ về đầu tư mua máy hoạt động rất hiệu quả với mức thu nhập 125 USD/tháng dự định chị xin vay 325 USD để mua thêm máy móc để mở rộng cơ sở xay xát đến nay gia đình chị đã thực sự thoát nghèo và là tấm gương điển hình của quỹ về việc làm ăn kinh tế giỏi.

loans.use: Buy machinery to husk rice.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Mrs. Sonia belongs to the communal bank “Las Fresitas.” She lives at Jr. Iparia Mz. 35 Lot 8 in the city of Yarina Cocha in the state of Ucayali, Peru. She is 49 years old and the mother of 3 adult children. They are very appreciative of all the effort she has made to ensure that they never went without and are very proud of her. Mrs. Sonia is married and her husband is a chauffer. His income, however, is not enough to cover the family’s living expenses. With her first loan borrowed from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 300 ‘soles’ ($ 100) she decided to invest in the sale of used clothes to the homes surrounding the Ucayali River, much like she has already been doing. Her business is currently growing due to high demand for used clothes. She wakes up very early to complete her household duties and then goes out to purchase the merchandise she will later sell. She visits the area surrounding the Ucayali River weekly to sell her merchandise. Mrs. Sonia has recently requested a loan from Manuela Ramos in the amount of 2,000 ‘soles’ (approx. $669), which will be repaid within 6 months, she plans to purchase 2 bales of clothes, 30 pairs of shoes and 10 pairs of slippers, along with other articles of clothing per personal use. Sonia is very happy to have her children healthy and professionals. They are her pride and joy. Thanks her efforts and dedication, she is achieving all her desires.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Fresitas”, vive en el Jr. Iparia Mz. 35 Lt. 8, distrito de Yarina Cocha D. departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 49 años y es madre de 3 hijos, todos mayores de edad. Están muy agradecidos con ella por todo el esfuerzo que hizo para nunca hacerles faltar nada y están orgullosos de ella. La señora Sonia está casada, su esposo es chofer, pero el ingreso que tiene no alcanza para cubrir los gastos D. hogar. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 (US$ 100.00) decide invertir en la venta de ropa usada, la misma que lleva a vender por los caseríos aledaños al rió Ucayali. En la actualidad su negocio ha crecido debido a la gran demanda de sus clientes. Se levanta muy temprano para hacer los quehaceres de la casa y de ahí sale a comprar las prendas de vestir que llevará a vender. Ella realiza sus viajes semanalmente. Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 669.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará 2 fardos de ropas, 30 pares de zapatos y 10 pares de zapatillas, así como otros productos de uso personal. Sonia se siente muy contenta de tener a sus 3 hijos sanos y profesionales, ellos son su orgullo. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación, está cumpliendo todos sus anhelos.

loans.use:
Purchase of used clothing in bulk. Purchase of shoes and other products of personal use.

Compra de ropa usada al por mayor. Compra de calzado y otros productos de uso personal.

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en: Florence owns a retail shop. She would like to buy building materials for her house with the extra profits.

loans.use: To add stock in her retail shop and to start a market stall

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C.,39, runs a stand near selling roast beef and duck eggs to the people in her area, making on average around $3 each day in income. Her husband works breeding pigs and driving a motor-taxi making about $3 per day. Two of their children work buying and selling recycling items and the rest are students. Mrs. Srey C. is humbly requests a loan to purchase a motorcycle so one of her children can operate a motor-taxi like her husband. She strongly believes this will help raise her income.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for one of her children so he can operate a motor-taxi

loans.name: Santa

texts.en:
Santa is a middle-aged woman who lives with her four children and one grandson in a community on the outskirts of the capital of Santo Domingo. She has struggled for a long time to provide for her children, and ever since she and her husband separated, she has essentially been their sole provider.

Santa currently has a small business where she collects glass soda and beer bottles from restaurants and the streets, and then sells them back to their respective companies. Typically she gets paid a flat rate per pound for her bottles; however, with the help of this loan, two very important things will happen. First, she will be able to begin buying bottles from some of the local colmados (corner stores) at a very low rate so that she can turn a higher profit each week. After a few months of the increased profits, she will have enough money saved so that she can submit her paperwork to obtain a legal ID number in the Dominican Republic. Consequently this will help her further, because recognized and legal Dominican residents get paid a higher rate, per pound, for recycled glass material.

Santa is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to make this loan happen. And on behalf of everyone here at Esperanza International, we too are thankful for your interest and support!

loans.use: Purchase glass bottles to resell

loans.name: María Julia

texts.es:
Our client, María Julia V., is a shopkeeper in the town of San Antonio in San Ignacio Misiones district. She is married and has a 20-year old daughter currently studying medicine in Cuba. Her daughter was awarded a full scholarship by the government of Misiones because of her excellent grades.

Sra. María owns a butcher’s shop in her own home, which is run by both her and her husband Sr. Paulo Cabrera. The shop has been operating for more than 16 years.

She is asking for a loan from our institution to buy two young bulls to slaughter and then sell in the butcher’s shop.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer.

La Cliente Sra. Maria Julia V., comerciante de la ciudad de San Antonio distrito de San Ignacio Misiones, es casada y madre de 1 hija de 20 años de edad que actualmente se encuentra en Cuba estudiando medicina ya que obtuvo una beca de estudios completa que le fue otorgada por la Gobernación de Misiones debido a sus excelentes calificaciones.

La Sra. María posee una carnicería en su domicilio particular, la cual es atendido por la misma y su esposo el Sr. Paulo Cabrera, su carnicería la abrieron hace más de 16 años.

Solicita el préstamo en nuestra institución para la compra de 2 novillos para faenamiento y posterior venta en su carnicería.

loans.use: Purchase of young bulls to slaughter and sell the meat

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thirty five years old and the mother of four children. All of her children are in school. She sells groceries, such as vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, canned fish, and pasta, in the community market. She wants to use her loan to buy more products to increase her inventory and to avoid price hikes.

Janet is a member of the group called “Agyenkwa Nyame” (meaning "The Soul-Saving God"). Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products like canned fish, vegetable oil, canned tomatoes, and spices

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married with two children. She used to hawk and sell saucepans but has now decided to add cosmetics to her goods, because they sell faster than the saucepans. Mercy wants to use the loan to buy more cartons of cosmetics to enable her to increase her income to support her family.

She is a member of the group called Sons of God. Members agree to guarantee for each other to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy cartons of cosmetics.

loans.name: Muazamkhon

texts.en:
Muazamkhon L., 40, is married with four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Muazamkhon and her husband work hard to ensure the best future for their children. Muazamkhon has been running her own small business for seven years already. She has a place near a store named “Tuhfaho” for selling ice cream. She works from 8:00 a.m. till 5:00 p.m. Her daughter helps her in the store, registering the stock and serving the customers. The business is stable which allows her to improve living conditions for her family.

This year Muazamkhon’s daughter is finishing school and dreaming of entering the university. In order to make her daughter’s dream come true, however, Muazamkhon needs to expand her business. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of US$ 600. Muazamkhon is planning to spend the loan to purchase an extra deep-freezer so as to increase the range of goods she sells. She promises to repay the loan within 12 months and thanks everybody who decides to support her.

Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to help her make her daughter’s dream become reality. With your help, this will be possible.

loans.use: Purchasing a deep-freezer to expand her business

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en:
Fatma is 36 years old, married, and has 8 children. She own and runs a bakery, which she started in 1998. She works every day, earning a monthly profit of about US$155 from the sales.

Fatma is now asking for a loan to buy more food items for her business.

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Chhum

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhum S. is a 47-year-old widow with a child who is attending school. Mrs. S. is asking for a second loan to improve her business. Previously, Mrs. Chhum S. obtained a loan to buy sticky rice to make cakes and she has paid it back.

Mrs. Chhum S. is a Khmer cake maker in Yok Bath Village in Kandal Province, Cambodia. She now faces a small problem because she does not have the milling tool that mills flour for the cakes. To improve her business, Mrs. Chhum S. is asking for a loan to buy the milling tool.

loans.use: To buy powder milling to make more cakes for her customers

loans.name: Mul

texts.en:
Mrs. Mul H. is a villager in Kraing Sromor Village in Kampong Chhnang Province.  She has a plot of land to grow vegetables. 

On this plantation, Mrs. Mul H. faces a small problem because her field is covered by grass on which she cannot cultivate vegetables.  In order to solve this problem, Mrs. Mul H. decided to ask for a loan to hire laborers to chop the grass so that she will be able to cultivate the land. 

Her husband, Mr. Kheiv Bich, is a breeder who raises two cows and two pigs.  Mrs. Mul H. is 54 years old and the mother of two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To hire laborers to chop the grass so that she will be able to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Iskandar

texts.ru: Бобиев Искандар проживает в районе Файзабад.Работает фермером . Имеет фруктовый сад. Выращивает яблоки. Урожай продает на рынке. Имеет бычков и участок земли , где выращивает пшеницу. Планирует получить кредит  для того , чтобы закупить дополнительный товар , фрукты другого вида. Это принесет ему дополнительный доход. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Iskandar B. lives in the Fayzabad region. He works as the farmer. He has an orchard. He grows apples. He sells his crop in the market. He has calves and a plot of land where he grows wheat. He wants to take out a loan to buy additional goods, different kinds of fruit. It will bring in additional income. He can pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying goods

loans.name: Nurulo

texts.ru: Джутов Нуруло проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 46 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. 12 лет занимается фермерской деятельностью. Сеет пшницу  на своем участке земли. Во время посевного сезона планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить семена пшениц. Кроме того , для посева необходимо нанимать трактор , за который нужно платить .Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nurulo J. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 46 years old, married, and has six children. For the past 12 years he has worked as a farmer, sowing wheat on his land plot. He plans to use a loan for purchase of seed wheat during the planting season. In addition, he must pay to rent a tractor for planting. The loan can be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grain for wheat planting

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Surviving in a difficult area like San Mariano is somehow an achievement. Sometimes the obstacle to a better life is not the conflict between the New Peoples Army and the Military, but the poverty that afflicts the country.

Juanita A. is 59 years old, married to Carlos A. Sr. and luckily, blessed with a son named Carlos A. Jr.  However, due to lack of financial resources, they were not able to send their child to school and he only reached the second year of high school. He is now 30 years old, already married, and works as a farmer to support his own family.  

“For eight years, I have been managing my sari-sari store (a community based store) business. I am now dreaming to expand my enterprise to increase my income and to assist my husband in providing financial support in our farm so that we can avoid asking credits from traders,” Juanita said.

Therefore, she would like to obtain a loan to purchase a variety of stock for her store. Aside from this, Juanita also hopes to maintain her good relationship with her customers and neighbors in the village for she believes that “no man is an island”. She also hopes that this attitude will somehow be adopted by her son and family so that they will have a good future.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of products for her store

location.town: Old San Mariano, San Mariano Isabela

loans.name: Alfonso

texts.es: La casa del señor Alfonso
texts.en: Mr. Alfonso

loans.use: To put a concrete floor on the front patio

loans.name: Yemalin Marie

texts.fr:
La signification d’ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique d’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux a 0% d’intérêt aux gens très vulnérables et il est dans un groupe qui lancent bientôt un programme de la microassurance santé. 
 
H. Yemalin Marie  a 42 ans et elle s’est mariée avec BOSSOU Euphrem. Ils ont  quatre enfants – Stefane, Patrick, Mathias et Cherita. Elle vend les savons et les fruits depuis 25 ans ; et ils les achètent au Marche Dantokpa, le marche central de l’Afrique d’Ouest. Avec les revenus de son activité, elle a pu épargner et aider son mari dans les charges du foyer. Dans l’avenir elle voudrait vendre les divers.
texts.en:
Yemalin Marie H., 42, is married to Euphrem Bossou. They have 4 children, Stefane, Patrick, Mathias, and Cherita. She has been selling soap and fruit for 25 years, buying her products at Marché Dantokpa, the central market of West Africa. With the income from her business, she has been able to put aside some savings and help her husband support the household. In future, she would like to be able to sell diverse merchandise. The loan she is requesting is through Kiva field partner, Alidé.

The meaning of Alidé in the local language of Benin, Fon, is "another path always exists for the most poor". Benin is a small country in West Africa beside Nigeria, where the GNP per capita is US$ 1,500. Alidé offers special 0% interest loans to very vulnerable clients and it is in a group which will soon be beginning a micro health insurance program.


Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fruit and soap for re-sale

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 45 years old, married, and has 5 children. He sells loaves of bread. He has been in this business for a long time. He needs a loan of N150,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell. He says "thanks" to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase bread

loans.name: Bean

texts.en:
Bean L., 31, is a widowed farmer who resides in the Kampong Chhnang province. She raises pigs, grows rice and makes fermented fish. Every day, she earns approximately $10 of profit. She has three school-aged children.

To expand her business, she would like to take out a loan to purchase rice to sell and food for her pigs.

loans.use: To purchase rice to sell and food for her pigs

loans.name: Letty

texts.en: Letty A., 26, is married and has one child. She has two years experience running a plantation, and sells her produce to the public two days per week. This is her first loan from SPBD.  She expects the weekly net cash flow from her business to be about $145. SPBD loans are Letty’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from a traditional bank. She plans to use her loan to buy tools  to plant her crops and also fund various home improvements.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, sprays and other items used on her plantation.

loans.name: Catherine Birungi 's Group

texts.en: Catherine is twenty-five years old and married with one nine-year-old child. She rents a one-room house with her family. She doesn’t have access to electricity or piped water. She always gets three meals a day. Catherine has a stall, and that is how she makes a living. She rents her stall at $9.25 a month and gets about twenty customers a day. She buys her produce from Nakawa market and works seven days a week. She has worked at this business for three years now. Prior to this she was frying edibles. This is her seventh loan since she joined MCDT, a Kiva field partner, and has been with them for four years, working with the same group members. Catherine wants to use this loan to buy boxes of tomatoes and also to start buying directly from farmers. She hopes to build a house from her savings.

loans.use: To buy boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Femmes Commercantes 9 Group

texts.fr: Les 5 femmes membres du groupe sont unies par le bon voisinage depuis longtemps. Elles sont dans un groupe fédéral de toutes les femmes de la commune de Thiès. C'est le groupement qui a été subdivisé en groupe de 5 pour faciliter la gestion. Les groupes sont créés par affinité par les femmes elles-mêmes. Elles mènent diverses activités génératrices de revenus et soutiennent leurs maris dans la prise en charges de leur famille respective. Le groupe s'autofinançait par une tontine interne mais avec le crédit de l'IMCEC il trouve des moyens plus importants et un délai court pour le financement de leurs activités. La plupart d’entre elles ont des étalages au marché central de Thiès commune ou elles vendent légumes, poisson, bijoux, tissus, etc.
texts.en:
The five women of this group have been good neighbors for a long time. They are in a federation of all the women of the town of Thies. This larger group has been subdivided into groups of 5 to facilitate management.

The groups were created based on the affinity of the women themselves. They are engaged in various money-earning activities and help their husbands support their respective families. The group is auto-financed through an internal dues system, but with the loans from IMCEC, they can obtain larger sums and and obtain financing for their businesses quickly. Most of the women have stands in the central market of the town of Thies where they sell vegetables, fish, jewelry, cloth, etc.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of local produce in the rural weekly markets and fishing zones for resale in town

loans.name: Muharram

texts.ru: Мансурова Мухаррам 50 летняя женщина , которая работает в фирме «Дусти Амирхон» , которая производит напитки. Она там работает поваром, но из-за нехватки её дохода на проживание, она занимается продажей детской одежды. Товар привозит из Истаравшана раз в месяц. Для закупа летнего ассортимента она хочет подать заявку и получить кредит . Мухаррам довольна всеми условиями фонда.
texts.en:
Muharram M. is a 50-year-old woman, who works at the Dusti Amirhon beverage company. She is a cook there, but because her salary is very small, she is involved in sales of children’s clothing. Muharram brings her merchandise from the city of Istaravshan once per month. She wants to obtain this loan to purchase summer goods assortment. Muharram is satisfied with all of the fund’s conditions.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase summer goods assortment

loans.name: Joyeux Lutins Plus Group

texts.fr: Kilolo M. est vraiment passionnée du commerce. C’est depuis 1985, qu’elle est entrée dans le monde de micro-entreprise à l’âge de 15 ans. Elle avait commencé son affaire avec un capital initial de $50 qui lui avaient permis d’acheter des poissons salés à revendre. Son affaire a connu la prospérité jusqu’en 1990. Les instabilités politiques et économiques des années quatre-vingt dix ont perturbé l’activité causant ainsi sa baisse. En 2000 an, Kilolo relance la vente d’habits usagers qu’elle diversifie quelques années plus tard en y ajoutant des épices qu’elle vend jusqu’aujourd’hui. Elle décide d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Joyeux Lutins » en 2008, dans le but d’ouvrir un jour un magasin d’habillement. Elle est une cliente fidèle qui a reçu des crédits de Hope RDC qu’elle a totalement remboursés à temps. Le dernier prêt qu’elle a obtenu, lui a servi d’acheter 10 plateaux d’œufs ainsi que d’épices à revendre pour accroitre le revenu. Kilolo est divorcée, mère de 4 enfants dont leurs âges varient de 6 à 17 ans. Trois d’entre eux étudient. Un au secondaire et deux à l’école primaire. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $100. Son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $48 par semaine.
texts.en:
Kilolo M. really has a passion for commerce. In 1985 at the age of 15, she got involved in the world of micro-enterprises. She had started her business with $50 in initial capital, which had enabled her to buy salted fish to sell. Her business prospered through 1990. The political and economic instabilities of the 90’s disrupted her work leading to a drop in business. In 2000, Kilolo started up again selling used clothing, and she diversified a few years later by including the sale of spices, which she sells today. Kilolo decided to join a HOPE RDC group named “Joyeux Lutins” in 2008, with the goal of opening a clothing store one day. She is a loyal client who has received HOPE RDC loans and who has totally repaid them on time. The last loan she had was used to buy ten trays of eggs, as well as spices to sell in order to grow her revenues. Kilolo is divorced and is the mother of four children, ranging in age from 6 to 17. Three of them are students. One is in secondary school, and two are in primary school. Currently, her capital amounts to $100. Her business generates for her a profit of $48 each week.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten trays of eggs and some spices to sell

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 51 years old and married to Juanito, who operates a motorcycle as the primary means of family livelihood. The motorcycle requires important maintenance for the safety of Juanito's customers, so Merlita has requested a loan amounting to PHP 4,000.

To supplement the income from her husband's tricycle operation, Merlita sells charcoal in their village.

She and her husband are blessed with seven children, five of whom are married. Judith, 22 years old, is single and a student, and Joe Mae, 11 years old, is still in school.

Merlita hopes that her loan will be granted for the sake of the welfare of her family.

loans.use: Maintenance of the motorcycle that serves as the family's primary business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 46 años, es madre de 5 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que adquirió algunos años atrás y donde pasa momentos gratos con sus seres queridos. Desde joven aprendió a elaborar deliciosos pasteles, los cuales vende en los diferentes eventos sociales donde solicitan sus servicios, pues la mayoría de personas de su localidad la conocen y saben del excelente trabajo que realiza y la creatividad que pone en cada trabajo. Esta confianza es una ventaja para el incremento de sus ingresos y le permite renovar los utensilios y máquinas que utiliza para la preparación de sus deliciosos bocaditos. Ahora, Rosa espera instalar en su domicilio un espacio con todos los materiales indispensables para trabajar con comodidad e incrementar su producción para distribuir tortas en algunas tiendas de su distrito. Ella nos comenta, que la cooperación y el optimismo son las características que mantienen su grupo de compañeras con las que trabaja en su banco comunal, el cual cada vez va mejorando en sus ingresos, pues ya llevan nueve créditos con Microfinanzas PRISMA. Los 2000 soles que solicita le permitirán realizar la compra de utensilios y un horno adicional para aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Rosa, 46, has five children. They live in a house that she got a few years ago, where they have great times with their loved ones. As a young girl she learned how to make delicious cakes. She sells them for different social events that ask for her services. Most of the people in her area know her. They know the excellent work she does and the creativity she puts into each job. This confidence is an advantage in increasing her income. It allows her to update the utensils and machines that she uses to make her delicious snacks. Now, Rosa hopes to install in her house a space equipped with all of her indispensable working materials. She wants to do this to work comfortably and increase her production in order to distribute cakes to some of the stores in her district. Cooperation and optimism are the characteristics that describe the colleagues she works with in her community bank. They have had nine loans with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and each time they improve their incomes. The 2,000 PEN that she is asking for is to buy utensils and another oven to increase her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baking utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sale of dried peppers

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en: Lucita D. V. is from RS Tan Village, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 42 years old, is married, and has five adult children. Lucita owns and operates a motorcycle transport business, providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Lucita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Lucita is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a new motorcycle to improve her business. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle to improve her business

loans.name: Etuwere

texts.en: Etuwere is married with five children and she is 35 years old. She has a grocery store where she sells soap, drinks, etc. she has been in this business for a long time. She requests a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more groceries to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Upendo

texts.en: Upendo L. is a Tanzanian an entrepreneur business married woman. She runs a business of making and selling traditional clothes (baticks) to customers at Kigamboni ward in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the manufacturing materials from the baticks materials shop from the whole sales and retails. It is made by boiling together clothes sheets and different color s in ratios according to the market demand. Its demand is internally and externally and used to make different types of clothes designs. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more business materials.

loans.use: To buy more business goods to capitalize the business

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience is 35 years old and married with five children. She sells Garri and provisions very close to her house. She hopes for a loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma, 58 years old, is running a hog raising business. Her business is located in the village of Quezon, San Isidro. She is married to Leonardo who works as a farmer. Whenever Leonardo is not busy in their farm, he sometimes works as a carpenter in their village.

Wanting to purchase sacks of feed for her hogs, Wilma decided to request a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to Php5,000. She said that she will be very thankful if the loan is granted. She hopes that through the loan and with her patience and hard work, she will succeed in her journey because she really dreams of a better future for her seven children.

loans.use: additional capital for buying feed for her hogs

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
This is Romana A., a 42-year-old entrepreneur from Maricaban, Pasay City.  She currently lives with her three children. Two of her children are in college and the eldest is already working.  Her husband Rene, 56, is a seafarer so he is always out of the country.

Romana has been managing their pedicab (rickshaw) transport business for four years now, along with selling frozen meat products (sausages, hotdogs, hams, etc.) she gets from a prominent dealer.  However, her refrigerator was damaged by the recent flood that hit the entire Manila area, so she has to stop her frozen meat products business for a while because she has nowhere to store her products.  Then she got a loan from the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in the amount of P17,000.00, which she used to start a small sari-sari (general) store.  She now earns more than P10,000.00 a month from the combined earnings of her new business and her earnings from the rickshaw.

She is working hard to be able to get back her former sources of income.  When her children finish their college education and are able to get decent jobs, Romana wants to go back to the province and stay there for good.  Currently, Romana has requested a new loan from CCT in the amount of P20, 000.00 to infuse more capital into her new general store. 

  

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for general store

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra M. is from the village of Seti, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and is married with four adult-aged children. Alejandra is a farmer who grows corn for sale. Alejandra has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2008, Alejandra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Alejandra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alejandra is requesting a second loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the additional revenues generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings, and young crops

loans.name: Nyamjav

texts.en:
Nyamjav is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Both of his daughters, aged 13 and 8, attend a local secondary school while his wife helps him with the family business.

Nyamjav manages a clothing retail business which he began in 1992. When he first began his business he rented a stall in the local market but was able to move into his own shop in 2008 after many years of successful operation. He would like to eventually begin a shoe business which would utilize his wife’s knowledge of making shoes.

Nyamjav is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrug loan in order to import a large amount of clothes from China for his business.

loans.use: To import a large amount of clothes from China

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan García Cárdenas  es un señor que ha demostrado ser buen cliente y cumplidor en sus pagos. Los préstamos anteriores eran para mejorar su vivienda donde anteriormente vivía y que pasó a una de sus hijas, el construyo el cuarto de madera, lamina y cartón con dinero propio pero ahora quiere construir su casa con block para que este mejor reforzada y no sufra alguna enfermedad en estos cambios climatológicos.
texts.en:
Juan García Cárdenas is a man who has proven to be a good client and compliant with his payments. The previous loans were to improve his home, where he used to live and has now passed to one of his daughters. He constructed a room of wood, laminate and cardboard with his own money but now wants to construct his house with concrete blocks so it can be better reinforced and so that he doesn't suffer any illness during these climate changes.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el caserío Narihualá, del distrito de Catacaos, provincia de Piura en la Región Piura, ubicada a 3 horas y 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos llevó a ella y a su esposo a trabajar en la venta de algarrobina (jalea hecha a base del fruto del algarrobo) y miel de abeja, ambos ofrecen esta mercadería de manera ambulante en los terminales terrestres de la ciudad de Piura. La algarrobina es preparada por ellos en sus casas y la miel de abeja la adquieren de los apicultores de la zona. Ambos productos son embotellados para luego ofrecerlos al público.

Eulalia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más miel de abeja para empezar a ofrecerla en otros distritos. Por ello se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el logro de su objetivo.

Ella es una madre que dia a dia da todo de si para seguir adelante y progresar junto a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener su propia marca de productos naturales y empezar a distribuirlos.
texts.en:
Eulalia is 42 years old, married, and lives with her husband and two children in Narihualá, a settlement in the district of Catacaos, in Piura Province in the Piura Region, three hours away from the city of Chiclayo. With the hope of helping their children get ahead, she and her husband started to sell 'algarrobina', jelly made from the fruit of the algarrobo tree, and honey. They both sell these items as street vendors at the bus terminals in the city of Piura. They make the algarrobina themselves at home, and buy the honey from beekeepers in the area. Both products are bottled for sale. Eulalia would like expand her business by buying larger quantities of honey and selling it in other districts. She has asked for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 600 new soles, which she will use to achieve this goal. As a mother, she gives of herself everyday to improve her family's situation and prospects for the future. Her greatest wish is to eventually be able to sell natural products under her own trademark.

Translated from Spanish by Montserrat Zuckerman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy honey in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Eddy Pablo

texts.es:
En el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Eddy A. es propietario de su propio negocio de fotocopiadoras que atiende a diario a los clientes que le visitan con el fin de obtener los ingresos para el sustento de su hogar. Es de importancia destacar que el señor Eddy ha logrado levantar dicho negocio a raíz de multiples esfuerzos sabiendo que puede llegar a adquirir muchos clientes.
Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo a lo inmediato en la compra de una fotocopiadora más moderna para ponerla en uso y así mejorar el servicio brindado a sus clientes porque realizará las copias más rápidamente sin hacer esperar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In Chinandega Department, Mr. Eddy A. is the owner of his own photocopying business. He serves his customers every day so that he can earn enough to support his household. It is important to note that Mr. Eddy has managed to lift up said business as a result of multiple efforts, knowing that he would eventually acquire a lot of customers. He is requesting a loan in order to immediately invest in the purchase of a more modern photocopier, which he would start using right away and thereby improve the service that he offers his customers. It will make the copies more quickly without his customers having to wait.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a photocopier

loans.name: Boimahmad

texts.en:
Y. Boimahmad is 35 years old, married with four children. He was born into a simple, rural family and has worked with livestock for 16 years. He is very experienced and has special skills in livestock care that helps him to develop his business. He raises and sells livestock as well as meat and milk. Boimahmad is requesting a loan of 6000 Somoni to enable him purchase more cows. This will enable him to increase milk production. The income will enable Boimahmad to provide for his family, take good care of his cows, and supply his neighbors with quality milk.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of cattle for expanding the business.

loans.name: Saretap-E- Sabz Group

texts.en: Roya is the group leader of Saretap-e- Sabz. She lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. She lives in a family of six members including her husband who has a retail cart. He works there to support his family members and make a living. Roya wants to take a loan for him to purchase more stock and to expand his business. He hopes by the loan he will develop his business and will have a shop instead of a cart.

loans.use: To buy more stock

loans.name: Yi

texts.en: Yi L. is married and resides with her children in Takeo province, Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in the business of selling Cambodian traditional silk products, earning an income of USD 6.60 per day to help cover the family expenses. The family is also assisted by her husband who is a cameraman, earning an income of USD 4.30 per day. Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses. L. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase more supplies for the camera and video business of her husband. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva. L.'s husband is pictured here.

loans.use: To buy supplies for the camera and video business

loans.name: Da Dwene Group

texts.en:
Agnes is a baker. She is married and has given birth to one child who is three years old. She lives with her husband, a farmer, and the little child in a rented apartment in their community. She is fifty. 

Agnes is a hard-working woman. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers in her community. She has been in the baking business for twenty years and is well experienced. The working materials Agnes needs to keep her business booming are bags of flour, margarine, sugar and other ingredients. It is her dream to acquire a bigger oven to expand her business. She also aspires to own a house to accommodate her family. 

Agnes is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Da Dwene’ which literally means worry. There are six members of this group and they are mainly into trading. The group requests the loan to procure goods in bulk to scale up their businesses.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour and other ingredients for baking

loans.name: Doris Felicitas

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. FELICITAS, ella tiene 64 años D. edad es casada y tiene 5 hijos D. 42, 38, 36, 29, 22 años D. edad, nuestra socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene una ferretería en su casa propia y atienD. desD. hace 15 años atrás, ahora le ayuda su esposo a atender el negocio él es jubilado y ella estudió una carrera técnica pero no lo concluyó debido a que se hizo cargo D. sus hijos desD. jovencita, su ferretería se llama Don Bosco. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales e implementar la ferretería.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Felicitas, belongs to the community bank "CRISTO MORENO” and lives in the city of Cusco. She is 64 years old, married, and has five children, aged 42, 38, 36, 29, and 22 years old. She is in the retail business, and has a hardware store in her own house. She has been serving for fifteen years, and now her husband helps her attend the business. He is retired and she studied a technical career, but she didn't finish it because she was in charge of the children since she was a young women. Her hardware store is called Don Bosco. She is requesting the loan to buy materials and to set up the hardware store.

Sra. Felicitas is grateful and values the support offered through these means, and she commits to complete the payment of her debt in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She is requesting the loan to buy materials and set up the hardware store.

loans.name: Dora Argentina

texts.es:
la sra. Dora Argentina C. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la aldea los Prados en la ciudad de Choluteca, Dora se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para dama y caballero como ser camisas tipo polo, camisetas, blusas, vestidos, ropa interior, ropa para cama.
esta actividad es su unica fuente de ingresos, su producto lo vende de contado y credito pero cuando sus clientes le compran varias piezas les vende al credito, en estos momentos necesita tener mas inventario de ropa ya que sus ventas estan creciendo y por falta de capital no puede abastecerse mas de prodcuto.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas ropa.
Dora nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo y teniendo ganancias y esto le permite cubrir con los gastos del hogar y tambien tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dora Argentina Cárcamo, 31, lives in the village of Prados in the city of Choluteca. She sells assorted new clothes for men and women such as: polo-type shirts, t-shirts, blouses, dresses, underwear and sleepwear. This activity is her sole source of income. She sells for cash and on credit but, when customers buy several pieces at once, she sells on credit. She currently needs to have more stock available because her sales are growing but lack of funds prevents her from stocking up on more product. She will use the funds to buy more clothes. Dora commented that she is very happy because her business is growing and she has had profits that permit her to meet her household expenses and have a better quality of life for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts, t-shirts, underwear, blouses, skirts, pants, dresses and sleepwear.

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en: Nuth S., 32, is married and lives with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed as a garment factory worker and earns an income of about USD 2 per day. Her husband is a farmer and grows rice, earning an income of USD 2.50 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of USD 600 to purchase ducks to raise for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support the children’s schooling.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: Buy ducks to raise for resale

loans.name: Buena Amistad Group

texts.es:
Monica L. de 25 años, es integrante de la Asociación Comunal Buena Amistad que a su vez pertenece al Centro Focal Cascada, ella es vecina de la  ciudad de El Alto, zona Mercedarios y vive hace 7 meses.
Monica tiene el negocio de venta de comida  hace 5 años aproximadamente, cuenta con un lugar de venta fijo que esta ubicada en la zona 12 de Octubre. Monica necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos y seguir operando en su negocio.

Las demás integrantes de la Asociación Comunal Buena Amistad tienen variados negocios como: venta de queso, tejido de prendas de vestir, venta de detergente, atención de tienda de barrio y venta de golosinas.
texts.en:
Monica L. is 25 years old. She is a member of the Buena Amistad Community Association, which belongs to the Cascada Center. She is a resident of the city of El Alto, in the Mercedarios area, and she has lived there for 7 months. Monica has had a business selling food for around 5 years. She has a locale located in the12 de Octubre area. Monica needs the loan to buy ingredients and keep operating her business. The other members of the Buena Amistad Communal Association have varios businesses, such as: selling cheese, weaving clothing, selling detergent, running a store and selling snacks.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Money Tree Group

texts.en:
Marie C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Money Tree. She is 27 years old, married and has two children who are 4 and 6 years old. She was only able to attend school through 2nd grade due to lack of financial support. 

For seven years, she has been selling cassava (also called manioc, the root is similar to a potato) and oil in VOA Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 7,000 LRD portion of this 35,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of cassava and gallons of oil. 

She describes herself as respectful. Her goal is to grow her business and educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cassava and gallons of oil

loans.name: Hermisa

texts.en:
Hermisa S. is from the village of  Gingoog City. She is 45 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Hermisa owns & operates a food business, making & selling snacks & other delicacies to the local community. Hermisa has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Hermisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Hermisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Mrs. Sem O., 48 years old, owns a small shop located along the village road where she sells porridge. She typically makes around $3 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She is married and blessed with seven children, some of whom are employed in a garment factory.

Sem O. has a life partner in her husband, who appears in the photo. A provider of taxi services, he currently earns little income because his vehicle is often broken. Sem O. is therefore requesting a Kiva loan to replace the broken taxi.

loans.use: To replace the broken taxi.

loans.name: Ignacio Juana

texts.es:
Ignacio de 51 años, ella tiene un puesto de venta de batidos y frutas en la calle del Suburbio porque aun no tiene un local para su negocio. 

Desde el momento que se divorcio ella tuvo que conseguir dinero para poder mantener a sus dos hijos, con esfuerzo y dedicación pudo comprar frutas para hacer batidos y venderlos en las calles, trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 16h00pm. 

Ella quiere compara frutas para hacer batidos de duraznos, frutillas, moras etc. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa, y tener un negocio de batidos y desayunos.
texts.en:
Ignacio, 51, has a stand where she sells blended fruit drinks and fruit in a street in Suburbio because she doesn’t yet have a locale for her business. From the moment she was divorced she had to earn money to support her two children. With effort and dedication she managed to buy fruit to make blended drinks to sell in the streets. She works from 6am until 4pm She wants to buy fruit to make peach, blackberry, strawberry, etc. drinks. In the future, she’d like to finish building her house and have a business selling blended fruit drinks and breakfasts.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Frutas

loans.name: José Elías

texts.es:
El señor José Elías M.    tiene 5 años de dedicarse al desarrollo de ternero pero a partir del año 2008 se dedica a compra y venta de frijoles en la comarca de sálales   El Sauce. Además que tiene un negocio ya estable de 2 molino donde ofrece su servicio a la población en general.
EL está solicitando este crédito para la compra y venta de frijoles  lo que  venderá a un mejor precio  así obtener  mayores ingreso y  abastecer la necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
José Elías M. has 5 years of experience raising calves. However, starting in 2008, he has worked buying and selling beans in the district of Sálales, in El Sauce. He also has a steady business with 2 mills, where he offers his services to the general population. He is requesting this loan to buy beans to sell. He will sell them at a better price and thus obtain more income so he can cover the needs of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying 22 quintals of beans

loans.name: Daniel Changwony

texts.en: Daniel, who has been practicing livestock farming for six years now, is 32 years old, married to Nancy Chepkemoi, and the father of three children.   Introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, he is now requesting his first loan with which he plans to buy more cows and sheep which he will rear and later sell at a profit.  Daniel hopes to own a big animal farm in the future and become a major supplier of animal products in Naivasha town and the surrounding area.

loans.use: To buy sheep and cows which he will rear and later sell

loans.name: Ramira's Group

texts.en:
Ramira J. is from the village of Salimpuno, Sapang Dalaga. She is 49 years old. Ramira is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ramira is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ramira owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector particularly in planting assorted crops to sell. Ramira has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ramira joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ramira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for the business. Ramira is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used for corn production. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Ramira from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of the her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for corn production

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy D. is from the village of Jampason, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 37 years old, married and has 1 adult child. Juvy owns & operates a food production/sales business, making and selling homemade honey in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Juvy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Hin's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of seventeen members located in Kaoh Kaev Kraom village in Kandal province. Mrs. Hin C. has been married for a year and is the village bank president having been selected by the members of this village loan.

Mrs. Hin C. is a beautician who owns a small shop. She earns some profit by selling beauty supplies to support the family. In order to increase income to improve the family condition, she would like to ask for a loan to buy more beauty supplies to expand her business activities. Her husband, Mr. Kong Sophea, is 40 years old and works as a construction foreman. Both occupations help to improve their family living condition. This couple has six children: one is waiter in a restaurant and the others are students in the local school and also help their mother’s business.

loans.use: To buy more beauty supplies to expand business activities

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos is a thirty-five-year-old married man with six children living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda and his family dream is to build his own house. He is a taxi driver and has been in the transport business for twenty years, first as a conductor and now a driver.  His dream is to have at least five taxis. Amos intends to use the loan proceeds to add to what he has to buy a taxi for his transport business.

loans.use: Buying a taxi for transport business

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 36 year old resident of Kitale Town in Western Kenya. He is married with five children between five and twelve years old. For the past five years, Abdallah has been a dairy farmer, producing and selling milk, eggs and vegetables in the local market. Animal diseases are a threat to his dairy business. 

Abdullah has applied for a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He believes this loan will improve his family’s living standard since he will be able to provide for his children to be educated in good schools. In the next five years, Abdullah wishes to have five dairy cows.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mariluz Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora  Mariluz del Socorro, es madre soltera de 38 años de edad que tiene 2 hijos adolecentes, que estudian la escuela primaria, ella se dedica a vender ropa y zapatos, hace unos meses su madre se enfermo y tuvo que cubrir unos gastos hospitalarios, y descuido las ventas de su tienda por lo cual entro en una crisis económica, es ahora para su negocio solicita un préstamo para la compra de mayor mercadería de ropa y zapatos para dama, que favorezcan las ventas sobretodo en esta temporada navideña que se incrementan los volúmenes de ingresos, espera le brinden un apoyo económico en pro de las condiciones de toda su familia.
texts.en: Ms. Mariluz del Socorro is a single mother of 38 and has 2 adolescent children who study in primary school. She sells clothes and shoes. A few months ago her mother got sick and she had to cover some hospital costs. She neglected her store and for this reason she entered into an economic crisis. She is now requesting a loan for her business to buy more merchandise of ladies clothing and shoes, which favour sales especially in the Christmas season and increase income volumes. She hopes they bring her economic support to improve the conditions of her entire family.

loans.use: Purchase clothes and shoes for her store

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.en: Eugenia C. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Jolomaynon, Dalaguete, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a vegetable-farming business. Her husband, Magno, who is 53 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have five children who are from 19 to 30 years old. Eugenia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eugenia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000, which she intends to use for additional capital for the vegetable farm so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Eugenia C. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her vegetable plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase materials for clothesmaking and two packs of used clothing to increase sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, zippers and lotions

loans.name: Florence Nayelel

texts.en:
Florence Nayelel R. is a  27-year-old lady. She is married and is the mother of four children. They live in Napetet in the outskirts of Lodwar town. She sells fish in the same area and has been in this business for eight years now. She makes a monthly income of KES 8,500.


This is her first loan from  KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy fish for resale and, with the income, she plans to open a retail shop. In the future she wants to become a big businesswoman in Lodwar.

loans.use: To buy fish for resale

loans.name: 'faithful Women #2' Group

texts.en:
Hellen K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Faithful Women #2'.  She is 50 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 9 and 31 years old. She was not able to attend school due to financial constraints. 

Hellen has been selling children's clothes in St. Paul Bridge Community, outside of Monrovia, Liberia, for 20 years. She plans to use her 15,000 LRD portion of this 75,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of children's clothes to resell. She describes herself as a determined woman whose goals are to improve her business and continue to educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Lorme is inset at the lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: to buy more children's clothes

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma V. V., tiene 26 años y tiene tres hijos en edades escolares, su esposo trabaja como albañil en diferentes obras en construcción en la ciudad, su vivienda y producción de leche está ubicada a 8 kilometros de la ciudad, está en una ladera de cerro.

La  Señora Zulma se dedica al cuidado  de su ganado vacuno día a día Zulma lleva a pastorear a su  ganado, en las mañanas de forma manual ordeña a su ganado, no los trabajos pecuarios que realiza son de forma manual, solo usan tachos plásticos.
 
Zulma nos cuenta que con el crédito comprará una vaca lechera para aumentar su producción y al contar con un mejor ingreso tratar de mejorar sus condiciones de vida que son precarias en cuanto a  servicios y vivienda.
texts.en:
Zulma V. V. is 26 years old and she has three school-aged children. Her husband is a construction worker at various construction projects around the city. Their house and their dairy farm are located 8 kilometers from the city and it is located at the foot of a hill. 

Zulma takes care of her cattle every day. Zulma shepherds her cattle and she milks them by hand in the mornings. She carries out her farm work by hand, using only plastic barrels.

Zulma tells us that with her loan she will purchase a dairy cow in order to increase production.  She will have a better income and she will improve her quality of life which is precarious with respect to services and their house.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Mayra Jacqueline

texts.es:
En la parroquia Eloy Alfaro de la ciudad de  Manta cada 15 días se reúne el Banco Comunal Mujeres Con Esperanza.  Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, es uno de los puertos más importantes del país y de América  y está situado a orillas del Océano Pacifico.
