Elles gagnent chacune 10.000 FCFA dans la vente de la boisson par semaine. La grande vente se fait les jours de foire pendant lesquels affluent les villageois environnants.    
Cette activité permet aux femmes du groupe Sabougnouma de réaliser en   moyenne une marge bénéficiaire mensuelle de 40.000FCFA. Ce qui leur permet de rembourser l’échéance du prêt et de faire face à certains besoins du foyer (santé, éducation, habillement…etc.
texts.en:
The women of the group Sabougnouma are married mothers 25 to 55 years old who have four children on average. They live in traditional extended families in the Ganabougou district of Yanfolila (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women have been partners of Soro Yiriwaso for two years and are on their fourth solidarity loan after having correctly repaid the three preceding ones. With this new loan, the women buy each week: one sack of big millet (sorghum), some leavening, firewood, and other supplies for making the local beer. The women help one another in this work, which demands a sizable quantity of firewood, water, and a lot of attention, so as to produce a quality beverage.

They each earn 10,000 francs CFA in selling the beverage each week. The biggest sales are made on market days, during which villagers from surrounding areas abound. This business enables the women of the group to realize an average monthly profit margin of 40,000 francs allowing them to make loan payments and to address certain household needs (health, education, clothing… etc.).

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making the local beer

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: Candida Rosa Z. D. tiene 43 años, esta acompañada. Tiene 6 hijos. Y Todos sus hijos trabajan. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería en la que vende los productos de pan, golosinas, refrescos y gaseosa. Hace más de siete años que se dedica a este oficio. Los propósitos para su negocio incrementar su pulpería y solo podrá realizarlo con la ayuda de los financiamientos. El financiamiento será utilizado para la compra de más productos que son necesarios para el uso diario. Los sueños para su negocio son de poseer otra pulpería y obtener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 12.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Candida Rosa Z. D. is 43 years old, has six children and lives with her partner. All of her children work. Candida has a local convenience shop where she sells bread, sweets and soft drinks. She has been doing this for seven years. Candida's plans for her business are to grow her shop and she can do this only with financial support. This loan will be used for the purchase of additional products necessary for daily use. Candida's dreams for her business are to own a second shop and have another source of income for her family. The amount requested is 12,000 córdobas [about US $600], which will be paid back in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Adama Mama

texts.fr:
Monsieur Adama Mama D. est un âgé de 33 ans et vit avec sa femme et son enfant  chez son père dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Adama a tenté plusieurs activités génératrices sans réussite notamment l’achat et la vente d’habits,  de chaussures, a même fait le chauffeur d’un particulier. Il  finit par opter pour la vente des boissons de fabrication industrielle depuis maintenant deux ans. Il  a entrepris ce créneau commercial (vente de boissons) par l’entremise de son oncle. Les fêtes religieuses et les grandes cérémonies (baptême, mariages) sont les occasions pendant lesquelles les ventes de boissons sont  considérables, sans oublier ces temps ci, période d’intense chaleur.
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires il décida de faire recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt individuel.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des dépositaires agrées pour venir revendre à Bougouni à une clientèle composée de  boutiquiers, de restaurateurs et des détenteurs de bar. 
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Adama Mama D. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA.
 Dans les années à venir il envisage être un dépositaire de boissons à Bougouni.
texts.en:
Mr. Adama Mama D., 33, lives with his wife and child in his father's household in the Hérémakono Centre district of the town of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Adama tried out several money-earning activities without success, notably buying and selling clothing and shoes, and he even tried out being a chauffeur for a private citizen. He ended up deciding to sell industrially-produced drinks and has been at this business for the last two years. He got into this commercial niche selling drinks with the help of his uncle. Religious holidays and important ceremonies (baptism, marriage) are occasions where a lot of drinks are sold, as is this season of the year where the weather is so very hot.

In his search for complementary financial resources, he decided to turn to Soro Yiriwaso with whom he is on his first individual loan.

He buys his merchandise in Bamako (capital of the Republic of Mali) from official depots and then sells it in Bougouni to a clientele composed of shopkeepers and restaurant and bar owners. With this loan Mr. Adama Mama D. expects to make a monthly profit of 40,000 F CFA. In the coming years, he hopes to have his own drinks depot in Bougouni.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of alcoholic and non-alcoholic (fizzy) drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Ayichatou

texts.fr:
A. Ayichatou est née vers 1947 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du BENIN. Ayichatou est veuve depuis vingt et un (21) ans; mais, Ayichatou n'a plus d'enfant à sa charge. Ayichatou est dans le commerce de divers(produits cosmétiques, pâtes alimentaires, boîtes de conserves, papiers hygiéniques, etc.)depuis son adolescence. Ayichatou a pu élever le niveau de son activité grâce aux deux prêts antérieurs qu'elle a eu de ALIDé. Ayichatou est satisfaite des services de ALIDé. Ayichatou a pour projet de continuer de développer son activité; c'est pourquoi elle sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Ayichatou A. was born around 1947 in Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of Benin. Ayichatou has been a widow for 21 years; however, she is no longer raising any children. Ayichatou has been selling general merchandise (cosmetics, pasta, tinned foods, toilet paper, etc.) since her adolescence.

Ayichatou has been able to raise the level of her business thanks to two prior loans that she has received through ALIDé. Ayichatou is satisfied with the services of ALIDé. Her plan is to continue to develop her business; that is why she has requested a third loan from ALIDé. The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria; its GDP per inhabitant is US$ 1,500. ALIDé offers special loans at 0% interest to very vulnerable persons and it is in a group that will soon begin to offer a micro-insurance program (health insurance) for the beneficiaries of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cases of: soap, sweet biscuits, pasta, and sugar; packages of toilet paper; tinned sardines

loans.name: Esperanza Janeth

texts.es:
Su esposo y ella pasaron por un momento muy duro economicamente, ella tenia que salir a trabajar fuera de la cuidad, para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

pero descuidaba mucho a su hijos, asi que comenzo con el negocio en casa, ya tiene 6 años desde que empezo vendiendo sus tacos a personal de las fabricas , bodegas, talleres , oficinas y vecinos de su colonia.

ella pide el apoyo para ampliar su negocio, construir una techo, para la temporada de lluvias, una plancha mas grande, asi poder hacer mas tacos, todo para brindar un mejor servicio a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Esperanza’s husband and she are on hard times financially. She had to work outside the city limits, to help her husband with the household expenses. This caused her to neglect her children much, so she started a business from home and it has been 6-years since she started selling tacos at factories, corner stores, to tellers, offices and to residents of her colony.

She needs the assistance to grow her business, to construct a roof in time for the rainy season. She also needs a large grill to make more tacos and also to provide the best service to her loyal customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jenson Abraham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To extend the business

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi G. est un acheteur de produits café-cacao. Il opère dans ce secteur depuis 7 ans et connaît tous les rouages du métier. Son activité consiste à acheter des ces produits auprès des agriculteurs et les revend aux exportateurs internationaux. Pour redonner de l’espoir à son activité, Koffi souhaite avec ce nouveau acheter des marchandises pour la revente. Cette aubaine lui permettra de donner mieux entretenir sa famille. Il faut noter que la photo est prise dans son salon.
texts.en:
Koffi G. is a coffee and cocoa buyer. He has been working in this sector for 7 years and knows all the tricks of the trade. His business consists in buying these products from the farmers and selling them to international exporters. To put some hope back into his business, Koffi hopes to use this new loan to buy these products for resale. This chance will allow him to do better by his family. Please note that his photo was taken in his living-room.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cocoa and coffee for resale

loans.name: Tashbubi

texts.ru: Ташбуви женщина 48 лет. Замужем и имеет 3-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота вместе с мужем. Ташбуви откармливает скот дома, и когда скот будет готов, муж Ташбуви продает их на скотном рынке. Ташбуви кредитуется в нашей организации 1 год. Она успешно закончила предыдущий займ, и теперь хочет взять очередной займ. Ташбуви планирует увеличить количество своего скота и тем увеличить прибыль своей семьи. Ташбуви очень нравится условия нашего кредитования, и она рада, что есть такие организации, поддерживающие общество.
texts.en:
Tashbubi is a 48-year-old woman. She is married with three children. She and her husband work fattening and selling cattle. Tashbubi fattens the cattle at home, and when the cattle is ready, her husband sells them in the cattle market. Tashbubi has financed her business through our organization for a year. She successfully paid off the previous loan, and now wishes to take out another loan. Tashbubi plans to increase the quantity of the cattle she sells and thereby increase the family's profit. Tashbubi really appreciates our credit terms, and she is glad that there are organizations like this supporting society.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fattening and selling livestock

loans.name: Valdemar

texts.en:
Valdemar and his family live in Drogobych, Western Ukraine. Valdemar sells men’s and women’s clothing in his home town. He launched his business 15 years ago. Ever since his business has flourished and grown to be a sustainable and profitable venture.

Today Valdemar is seeking a 12,000 Grivnya loan to re-stock his merchandise. He is hoping to increase assorted clothing merchandise he offers for sale in his kiosk and boost his sales as a result. Valdemar has proved to be a responsible borrower who has repaid all his previous loans without delinquencies.

loans.use: to re-stock his merchandise.

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra is 56 and is a single mother of three children. She lives with her childen in Runyenjes. She is a committed member of the Runyenjes CBD group and her community. She is known for her humility and hard work. She has received and paid back three previous KMET loans which have helped her improve her community pharmacy. She currently requires a loan to enable her to purchase more drug supplies.

loans.use: Buy drugs for pharmacy

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
36-year-old Mely M. owns a 2-hectare farm in their village. She has five children and a loving husband, Abeniden M., who helps her manage their business. The farm is really a big help especially in providing for education and the other needs of her children.

She would like to ask for a loan worth Php 10,000. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and chemical to ensure that she will have an abundant harvest on her farm.

Now, she actively involves herself in CEVI cluster meetings. She receives not just loans but training and insurance as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and chemicals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For making and selling food

loans.name: Aulelia

texts.en:
Aulelia is a member of the Dodoma road borrower group in Khesa,Iringa,she is 24 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children,Her children are aged 5 and 1 years.

Aulelia started her own business selling food 2 years ago,she works 10 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Aulelia`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 150,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her food business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Aulelia hopes to save money,pay school fees,get more food for family and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more rice,cooking oil,,sugar,beans

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 38 años, es una madre de familia muy amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Damián de 38 y sus 2 hijas; Liliana de 14 y Mildred de 10 años, a quienes desea dar una buena vida. Su librería está ubicada en uno de los barrios principales de la ciudad de Juliaca, la cual es muy concurrida por sus vecinos, ya que en ella pueden encontrar todo lo que necesitan. La atención que brinda Vilma es muy cordial y siempre está muy atenta a satisfacer todos los pedidos de sus clientes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede distribuir su tiempo entre la librería y sus labores del hogar, ya que su negocio funciona en su casa. Lleva 2 años con esta librería y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer muchas horas en ella, ya que abre desde muy temprano y cierra tarde. Para el futuro espera hacer crecer su negocio y tener mejores ingresos económicos.
Este es el segundo préstamo de Vilma con MFP y espera poder pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere perjudicar a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida, por la alegría que les da a sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su librería.
texts.en:
Vilma , age 38, is a mother in a very loving family. She lives in her own house with her husband Damián, 38, and her two daughters, Lilana, age 14, and Mildred, age 10. She wants to give her family a good life.

Her bookstore is located in one of the principal neighborhoods of the city of Juliaca and is very popular with her neighbors since she is able to meet all their needs. Vilma offers service that is very cordial and always aimed at satisfying all the requests of her customers. What she likes most about her work is that, since her business operates in her house, she is able to split her time between the bookstore and her household duties. She has had this bookstore for 2 years and believes that the most difficult thing is having to spend many hours in it since it is open from very early and closes late. For the future, she hopes to increase her business and have better income.

This is Vilma’s second loan with MFP, and she hopes to be able to pay all her payments on time, for she doesn’t want to harm the members of her community bank, where she is highly appreciated because of the happiness that she gives her colleagues. With the 500 new soles applied for she will buy more merchandise in order to better establish her bookshop.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in inventory

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
En el mercado central del departamento de Chinandega, la señora Juana N. T. se dedica a atender su propio negocio de venta de ropa cuya propietaria es ella misma ofreciendo todo tipo de ropa a sus clientes tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

La razón por la que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito debido a que una vez mas requiere invertir en la compra de la ropa para ofrecerla a sus clientes y así mejorar sus condiciones de venta y por ende mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de la ropa

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel M. is a married 43-year-old businessman. He operates a transport business, transporting primary-school children to and from home. He has been in the business for a period of two years. He gets a profit of about 14,500 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

M. was introduced to KADET by a group member and has never borrowed elsewhere. He wants to use the loan to improve his car for better service and to build and stock a small retail shop (kiosk) for his wife. He hopes to buy a new van for school transport to increase carrying capacity to over 100 children, from the current 30 children. He also wishes to open a good business for his wife.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions for micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To improve his car for transport and build and stock a small retail shop (kiosk) for his spouse

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen M. is currently in the business of retailing in her shop by selling beans, rice, sugar, etc., and is requesting a loan to buy more goods such as: cups, plates, jerrycans, etc. Hellen is 25 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a new shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her store

loans.name: Pampilo

texts.en:
This is Pampilo I., who is 59 years old.  He is married to Lydia, 48. They have three children: one is in college, the eldest is working and the other stays home.

Pampilo owns and manages a home-based manufacturing business. He makes snack items like banana chips, sweetened puffed corn and fish crackers. He hires an assistant in the work yard.  He earns close to 30,000 Philippine pesos a month. He is happy that one of his children has already finished college and another one is working his way towards graduation. He was also able to purchase property in the province. All these are fruits of his labor.    

Pampilo became an active member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 and has since been enjoying many benefits from the cooperative. He is currently in need of additional capital for the continuity of his business. He applied for a P30,000 loan with CCT to augment his business needs.

He wishes for his small manufacturing station to become a factory soon.  He’s working double time nowadays because he still has two children to get through college.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for the production of chips and crackers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase retail stock such as sugar, salt, maize flour, beans, ground nuts, drinks, etc

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita E. is from the village of Balanlinao, Plaridel Mis. Occ. She is 60 years old. Benita is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Benita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, vinegar, soy sauce, sugar & toothpaste in the local community. Benita has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Benita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Benita is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Benita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional daily-use products to sell

loans.name: Norminia

texts.es:
La señora Norminia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Siempre Unidas”, Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia de San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 33 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Norminia, lleva 08 años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, ya que teniendo conocimiento en este tipo de actividad, no dudo en implementar su propio taller de costura, ubicada en su misma casa, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, donde diariamente atiende a sus clientes fijos, que ya la conocen y necesitan el servicio. Trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y siempre regalando una sonrisa y con amabilidad sus clientes se sienten muy contentos y satisfechos. En la actualidad, esta muy contenta y orgullosa por lo logrado. 

Con el préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes grande y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Norminia is a member of the “Siempre Unidas” (“Always United”) Communal Bank in the Tarapoto district of the province of San Martin. She is 33 years old, has 2 dependent children, and lives with her partner.

For 8 years, Norminia has been a seamstress. She has her own sewing studio in a very well-appointed area of her home. Every day she attends to her regular customers, who know her well and need her services. She takes orders for garments in advance and her customers always smile happily upon their delivery, very satisfied with her work. She is currently very pleased with and proud of what she has achieved.

She will use this loan for 3,000 Peruvian nuevos soles to purchase lengths of fabric in a variety of styles and colors as well as sewing supplies, including scissors, spools of thread in a variety of colors, needles, pins, and buttons.

Today, Norminia feels very fulfilled, and really wants to get ahead and realize the rest of her dreams. She is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her begin her business and for helping other women who want to be entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sewing supplies

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie C. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old, is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Elvie owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Elvie has been engaged in her business for over 26 years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elvie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the eleventh loan which Elvie has taken out from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in north-western Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Andres

texts.es:
Andrés G. D. L. R. es un joven que acaba D. adquirir su vivienda D. interés social y desea ir haciéndole mejoras para vivir cómodamente. El con ahorros puso unos barrotes que es lo que sostendrá el techo que quiere poner, pero para terminarlo le falto capital para comprar las laminas y así el patio D. su casa estar techado, como cuando su esposa lava L. ropa con las lluvias se le moja L. ropa y así es mas difícil que L. ropa se seque y tienen que meter L. ropa adentro D. L. casa y ocupa mucho espacio.
Es por eso que Andrés ve lo que batalL. su esposa y es por ello que quiere terminar su proyecto para darle mejor calidad D. vida a su esposa.
texts.en:
Andrés G. D. L. R. is a young man that just got his house through social services. He wants to make improvements on it to live comfortably. He used savings to install some cross pieces, which will support the roof that he wants to install. He does not have the money to purchase the metal sheets to finish it in order have a roof on the patio of his house. When his wife washes the clothes, they get wet with the rains, and it is more difficult for the clothes to dry. They have to put the clothes insiD. the house, and it takes up a lot of space. Andrés sees what his wife struggles with, and that is why he wants to finish his project to give his wife a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a roof

loans.name: Herbette

texts.fr: A. Herbette est née le 2 septembre 1970 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin.  Il y a cinq ans que Herbette habite à Agblangandan dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji.  Herbette vit là-bas avec son mari, MITOMBAOU Félix, un chauffeur, et ses deux enfants.  Herbette n’a jamais fréquenté l’école, mais tous les enfants de Herbette sont scolarisés.  Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille.  Herbette vend des produits divers (riz, savon, lait, sardines) à son domicile. Herbette vend également de la nourriture à la devanture de sa maison. Herbette exerce cette activité depuis cinq ans et s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin.  Herbette est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé.  Herbette a bien remboursé les deux premiers crédits et sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer surtout son activité de divers.
texts.en:
Herbette A. was born September 2, 1970, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Bénin. Herbette has lived in Agblangandan, in the township of Sèmè-Podji, for five years. Herbette lives there with her husband, Félix Mitombaou, a driver, and her two children. Herbette did not attend school, but both of her children attend school now. The couple shares the family responsibilities. Herbette sells various products (rice, soap, milk, sardines) from her home. She also sells food from a walk-up window at her home. Herbette has been doing this type of work for five years and gets her supplies in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. She is on her third loan with ALIDé. She fully repaid the first two loans and is requesting a third loan to further build up her business.

Translated from French by Shannon Arnold, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase various products

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe Benkadi sont majoritairement des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Noumousso  un des quartiers de la ville de Kadiolo,  Sikasso (3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali). 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur quatrième  prêt solidaire. Tous les trois  prêts précédents se sont bien dénoués. 
Elles font l’achat et la vente du beurre de karité, des habits  pour enfants, des condiments alimentaires etc.
 Avec leur nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter,  70 kg de beurre de karité, 3 douzaines d’habits  pour enfants et 5 paquets de condiments alimentaires. 
Elles s’approvisionnent au grand marché de Kadiolo ville et dans les villages avoisinants.  Elles revendent à Kadiolo ville, au marché, de façon fixe les jours de foires et de façon ambulante, au comptant souvent à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
 Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 17.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour l’épargne et les besoins de la famille, l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elles ambitionnent demander des prêts plus importants pour mieux satisfaire leurs clientèles et  pouvoir devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
The seven members of the Benkadi group are for the most part married, and average 35 years of age with three children. Most live in polygamous families in Noumousso, one of the neighborhoods of Kadiolo, in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They joined the Soro Yiriwaso MFI to satisfy their customers' needs, and are now requesting a fourth group loan. All three preceding loans were well handled. They buy and sell shea butter, children’s clothing, food condiments, etc. With their new loan, they will buy: 70 kilos of shea butter, three dozen sets of children’s clothes and five packages of food condiments. They get their supplies from the main market in Kadiolo and from villages in the surrounding area. They resell in fixed locations on market fair days at the Kadiolo market, and also as itinerant vendors, for cash but often for credit, to a customer base of both men and women. They expect to reach average monthly earnings of 17,500 FCFA each, of which part will go into savings and meeting family needs, and the remainder will be reinvested in the business activities. Their ambition is to request more significant loans to improve customer satisfaction and eventually become wholesalers.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Mrs. T., 57, is a person on a low income who lives in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where she sells food to earn a living. She buys ingredients at the market and produces the food in her home. She starts selling food in the early evening and her buyers are people in her village. She was married, but her husband died. She has two daughters: one is a garment factory worker and the other assists her in selling food.

Mrs. T. has been trying to save up money in order to build a new house but her savings are still not enough to start the construction process. Therefore, she decided to request a loan to add to her savings in order to build a new house.

loans.use: To build a new house

loans.name: G.s. Quinta Rosa Group

texts.es: El grupo Solidario Quinta Rosa está conformado por Elizabeth Del Carmen y Maria De Los Ángeles ambas se dedican a diferentes actividades económicas. En el caso de Elizabeth ella se dedica a una pulpería, hace mas de 3 años, por lo que anteriormente no tenía un medio de ingreso para mantener a sus 2 hijos, fue por la necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos alimentación, vestimenta y estudios. Maria De Los Ángeles se dedica a la venta de comida hace mas de 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad, ella inicio por su abuela quien le asigno este negocio. es por eso que deciden unirse para solicitar este financiamiento para realizar las compras de sus productos que cada uno de sus negocios necesitan.
texts.en:
The Quinta Rosa communal bank is composed of Elizabeth Del Carmen and Maria De Los Ángeles; each is involved in a different commercial activity. Elizabeth has had a grocery store for the last 3 years; prior to this she did not have a reliable source of income to support her children and she needed to feed, clothe and educate them. Maria De Los Ángeles has sold prepared meals for over 2 years; she’s in this business because her grandmother started her out in it. They decided to join together to seek funding to buy the merchandise each needs for her respective business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: La sra. Gladys A. R. de  22 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 1 hijo menor. Vive en casa de de sus cuñados ubicada en el Caserio Casablanca. Trabaja como obrera de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Gladys A. R., age 22, is in a common law marriage and has one minor child. She lives in her brother-in-law’s house in the rural community of Casablanca. She is a field worker for agro-industrial businesses. She is a hard-working person, and thanks to her determination she was able to get her assets. She needs the loan to finish building her house. Her dream is to finish building her whole house in order to achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support we are able to offer through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her house

loans.name: Agusta Renee

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “MILAGROSA VIRGEN DEL CARMEN II”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Renne,  ella tiene 55 años de edad es divorciada y tiene 1 hijo, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, ella tiene un bar snack en su casa en el primer piso, Nuestra socia trabaja aún para ayudar en los estudios superiores de su hijo, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en el bar e implementarlo y decorarlo.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the “Milagrosa Virgen del Carmen II” communal bank. Our member lives in the district of Huanchac in the province of Cusco, department of Cusco. Our member is Renee. She is 55 years old, divorced, and has one child, a son. Our member alternates her household activities with her retail business. She has a snack bar on the ground floor of her house. Our member works so that she can help her son with his higher education. Our member is requesting the loan so that she can invest in her snack bar by restocking it and decorating it. Our member is very grateful for the support she is being given through this loan, and she agrees to complete her payments according to the terms of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investing in her snack bar by restocking it and decorating it.

loans.name: Jannette

texts.en:
Jannette B. is from the village of Gosi Sur, Tuguegarao City. She is 42 years old and married. To make a living, Jannette owns and operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Jannette has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
Jannette joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Jannette is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Rosa Magdalena A. C. tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

Rosa es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Rosa trabaja en el negocio de legumbres y estudia al mismo tiempo. Compra en los mercados de Riobamba (a más de 3 horas de distancia) y vende en Chillanes (a más de una hora de distancia). 
 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y algo para los estudios. El crédito le ayudara a aumentar el negocio. Su meta es terminar sus estudios y seguir con el negocio. Enfrenta desafíos como la competencia y los productos que están muy caros. 

Le gustan fiestas del mercado en Chillanes y jugar fútbol.
texts.en:
Rosa Magdalena A. C. is 19 years old, and she is single. She lives with her parents in the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province. Rosa is a member of the Santiagopamba Communal Bank, which is a half hour from the town of San Miguel. The communal bank is mostly made up of people who devote themselves to agriculture as the main source of income for their families. Rosa works in the vegetable business, and she goes to school at the same time. She buys in the Riobamba markets (over three hours away), and she sells in Chillanes (over one hour away). She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She will use some of it for her education. The loan will help her increase her business. Her goal is to finish her studies and to continue with the business. The challenges that face her are the competition and that the products are very expensive. She likes the festivals in the Chillanes market, and she likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business, and part of the loan for her education

loans.name: Blanca Esthela

texts.es: Blanca Estela, tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, las cuales son menores de edad y le ayudan a trabajar en el negocio. La señora tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería en general, Ella ya tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este negocio, empezó en ese tiempo debido a que su compañero de vida era quien le apoyaba a que siguiera adelante con su actividad, pues ha sido importante para sufragar los gastos del hogar.  Ella está solicitando este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de materia prima. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a establecer un restaurante grande ubicado en un local muy bonito y que pueda expandirse más su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca Estela is 28 years old, she is married and has 3 young children who help her working in the shop. She has a general store and she has been dedicating herself to this activity for 3 years. She started back then because her partner suggested she kept her activity running as it was important to provide for the house expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy core products. She has always dreamed of opening a big restaurant in a very nice location and for her activity to grow even more.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy core products

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline S. is from the village of Poblacion Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Evangeline sells daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, candies, bread, mineral water and soft drinks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $180 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 2nd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en: Là Nguyễn Thị is a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Tỉnh Bắc Ninh. She is married and has two school-age children. To making a living, Là owns and operates a general store selling both food and daily use products in her community. Là has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 4.000.000 dong (VND) a month. In 2009, Là joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Là has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.152.000 VND from SEDA which was used to purchase products to sell. Là is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her second loan from SEDA. Là plans to use the additional revenue to financially support immediate members of her family. No. 20211020031. About SEDA: The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. Là Nguyễn Thị (20211020031) là 34 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh. Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học. Để kiếm sống, Là Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh. Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa. Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán cả hai loại thức ăn & các nhu yếu phẩm trong cộng đồng địa phương. Là thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Là kiếm được khoảng 4.000.000 VND một tháng. Vào 2009, Là đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Là đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND. Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh. Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Là dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh hỗ trợ tài chính cho các thành viên gần gũi trong gia đình của người vay. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Virgen De Fátima Group

texts.es:
El Comité Virgen de Fátima es un excelente  comité conformado en fecha 29 de Enero del 2009, integrado por 19  mujeres. 
Este grupo se formó  gracias a que la Sra. María Pabla L. quien se acercó a la asesora en una reunión de renovación de crédito que la misma tenía en la zona para averiguar acerca del Programa del Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, la  misma quedó muy entusiasmada y muy ansiosa de poder trabajar con este programa y ahora ya se encuentran trabajando muy contentas en el 6° ciclo del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Las integrantes de este grupo destinan su crédito a diferentes actividades. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la venta de bebidas y comidas en su casa.
Esta actividad lo realiza con su hija ya que requiere de mucha mano de obra para elaboración de comidas y la atención de los clientes. 
La señora Maria comenta que se encuentra muy satisfecha con su comité y que desea seguir trabajando por el bien común de todas. 
Solicta el préstamo para la compra de verduras, carnes, harinas, aceites, condimentos para comidas, bebidas.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fátima committee is an excellent committee founded on January 29, 2009 with 19 members. The group organized thanks to Mrs. María Pabla L. who approached the consultant during a loan renewal meeting she was having in the area to ask about the Enterprising Women Committee’s Program. She became very encouraged and anxious to be able to work with this program and they are now very happy being part of the Enterprising Women Committee’s Program’s 6th cycle. The members of the group will use the funds for a variety of different purposes. One of the members, María, sells beverages and prepared meals in her home. Her daughter helps her with this work because she needs a lot of help with the labor involved in preparing the meals and taking care of customers. María tells us that she is very satisfied with her committee and wants to continue working toward the common good of all of them. She is asking for funds to buy vegetables, meats, flours, cooking oil, food condiments and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meats, flours, cooking oils, food condiments, beverages.

loans.name: Verónica

texts.es: La Sra. Verónica G. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como profesora de primaria en el colegio Simeón Pereira de dicho municipio donde tiene 27 años de laborar. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde le han otorgado dos créditos para mejora de vivienda. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de zinc, puerta y pago de mano de obra.
texts.en:
Verónica G. is a native of the municipality of El Sauce. She works as an elementary school teacher at the Simeón Pereira school in El Sauce, where she has been working for 27 years. She has been working with CEPRODEL for two years where they have granted her two loans for housing improvements. The loan requested is for the purchase of zinc, a door, and payment for man labor.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc, a door, and payment for man labor.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice N. is 24 years old. She is single and has one child aged seven years old. Her business is located in Juja, a residential area in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for production of pineapples. Eunice sells fruits and vegetables to retail traders and other local people. She has been in this business for the last four years and has managed to get two employees. She says that this business is profitable and her major challenge is lack of finances. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

Eunice is using her loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more melons which she can supply wholesale. In the future, she hopes to be able to supply fruits and vegetables to other markets. She also hopes to purchase her own plot of land and build rental houses. She describes herself as social, honest and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy melons

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
Virgilia R. is from the village of Pan-ay, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Virgilia is a widow and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Virgilia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately $350 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Virgilia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Virgilia is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Asela

texts.en:
Asela E. is from the village of Mahayahay, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Asela is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Asela owns & operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. Asela has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Asela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Asela is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Asela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

location.town: Mahayahay, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Tupo Juu Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is in her mid-forties and is married with two children. She will share this loan with her loan group, Tupo Juu, which totals nineteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. Elizabeth has been running a charcoal business since 2008. The business is open between 7:00 a.m. and 8:00 p.m. and earns Elizabeth a low monthly profit.

A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Elizabeth used her previous loan to increase her stock in charcoal. This loan has now been successfully repaid. This will be Elizabeth's second Mothisha loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Elizabeth aims to use this loan to once again increase her stock in charcoal in order to meet rising demand.

In the photograph, Elizabeth can be seen in the first row, second from the left.

loans.use: To increase her stock of charcoal

loans.name: Josephine Muthamba

texts.en:
Josephine is 34 years old, married to Benson, and they have three children. They also support two other relatives from the extended family. Josephine normally works on their family farm. She sells the produce to her neighbors and other vegetable traders. She and her husband have been in the farming business for two years now, with an income of 5,000 KES a month.

Josephine is borrowing her second loan with KADET to buy water pipes for pumping water to their farm. She hopes to produce better quality cabbages to distribute on a large scale in this current season.

loans.use: To buy water pipes for watering the farm

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su hijo de 19 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside en San Miguel, departamento de San Miguel, vende tamales y confecciona ropa, por las mañanas está dedicada a la costura y por las tardes a preparar tamales para la venta.
Ella solicita un préstamo para cubrir los gastos de graduación de su hijo pues está terminando sus estudios de bachiller, lo demás lo invertirá en materiales para preparar los tamales como maíz, pollo y condimentos.
Su sueño es crecer con sus ventas y lograr estabilidad para poder seguir apoyando a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 43 years old.  She lives with her 19-year-old son.  She is a single mother living in San Miguel in the district of San Miguel.  She sells tamales and handmade clothing.  She spends her mornings sewing and her afternoons preparing tamales to sell.  She is requesting a loan to cover her son’s school fees.  He is finishing high school.  In addition, she will invest in ingredients for her tamales like corn, chicken, and condiments. 

Her dream is to increase her sales and achieve some stability so that she can continue providing for her son.

loans.use: To purchase corn, chicken, and condiments and pay school fees.

loans.name: David Allen

texts.es:
David tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de planchado y pintado de vehículos para lo cual cuenta con un taller instalado en la zona donde reside. Su negocio es bastante conocido en la zona y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fiel que siempre hace uso de sus servicios. El negocio le permite solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar al desarrollo económico de su familia.

David desea adquirir materiales para poder seguir brindando un buen servicio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
David is 22 years old.  He is single and lives with his family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with regular commercial activity which is located more than one hour and forty-five minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

David provides bodywork and painting services for vehicles.  He has a workshop in the area where he lives.  His business is quite well known in the area and he currently has a number of loyal customers who always use his services.  His business allows him to cover his personal expenses and support his family's financial development.

David would like to acquire materials so that he can continue providing a good service.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help him to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand his vehicle repair business

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor D. was born in 1960 in Ijevan city, where he now lives. He is married and has 3 children: two sons and a daughter. Grigor’s daughter is a student, while Grigor, his wife and their sons are engaging in a fruits and vegetable business, which they have run since 1993. 

During these years, thanks to his business income, Grigor was able to buy a van which he uses for fruits and vegetables delivery from various villages to the Ijevan market where he carries out his business. He uses his car as a stall from which he sells his merchandise. 

With his business incomes Grigor is able to meet his family needs and pay for his daughter’s education.  

Grigor is seeking an 800.000 AMD loan to increase his trading assortment: he intends to buy citruses which are in popular demand before New Year along with other fruits and vegetable. 

Grigor has received loans from Nor Horizon 3 times and he has never missed a loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy citrus and other fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Tania Jessenia

texts.es:
En el sector conocido como el Cadí de  la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Juntas Creceremos, este lugar es muy hermoso y las personas muy agradables.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Tania, ella tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos chicas de 14, 13 años y el último que es varón siete meses  de  edad, las dos mayores estudian en colegio. Su esposo es supervisor en una camaronera en Guayaquil.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta y  también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja todos días en la semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la compra en Portoviejo y con este crédito quiere viajar a Guayaquil a comprar mercadería para la temporada.

Este crédito es para comprar  ropa de temporada como bermudas, camisetas, trajes de baño, gorras, entre otras prendas. Estuvo en el inicio del  Banco comunal pero se retiro por un ciclo y ahora este es su segundo ciclo, le gusta porque los créditos le ayudan mucho. Sus sueños son tener una boutique bien surtida.
texts.en:
In the Cadí section of the city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, known for many years as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the Juntas Creceremos (Together We Will Grow) communal bank meet every two weeks.  This is a very beautiful place and the people are very likeable.

We met Tania, 31, here.  She’s married and has three children: two girls who are 13 and 14 and a son who is 7 months old; the two oldest are in school.  Her husband is a Supervisor at a Guayaquil shrimp processing plant.

She sells clothing by catalogue door to door and also from home where she has a small store.  She tells us that customers place orders from her.  She works every day of the week granting her customers credit that she collects on every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo and wants to use this loan to travel to Guayaquil to buy merchandise for the season.

This loan will be used buy seasonal clothes like: Bermuda shorts, t-shirts, bathing suits and caps, among other items.  She was a member of the bank at its inception but dropped out for a cycle.  Now she’s back in her second cycle.  She likes it because the loans help her a lot.  Her dream is to have a well stocked boutique.

loans.use: To buy Bermuda shorts, t-shirts, bathing suits, caps, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 40 años vive con sus 5 hijos en casa de su mama. Ella es una mujer comerciante, realiza diversos trabajos, desde la elaboración de bordados, así como la venta de zapatos y la expensa de comida. Sus hijas la ayudan en la tarea del bordado. Le agrada desarrollar estos negocios porque le ayuda a ser independiente, además puede distribuir su tiempo y de las ganancias que percibe le permite sostener a su familia. Se siente muy satisfecha por lo rentable que es negocio, sobre todo en los bordados y es por eso que tiene planes de incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más material como hilos y lana,  para realizar más bordados.
texts.en:
Delia is 40 years old and lives in her mother's home with her five children.  She is a business woman and has many jobs that include embroidery, shoe sales and food sales.  Her daughters help her with the embroidery work which she enjoys because it allows her to be independent and able to distribute her time.  Her earnings are used to support her family.

She is very satisfied with how profitable her business is, especially because of her embroidery products.  She therefore wants to increase her working capital.  This is the fourth loan she has received from MFP.  She is grateful for the financial support and has always made her payments on time.

She is happy to be a part of the communal bank because all the members are committed and supportive.  She thanks all the lenders who are helping her business grow.  She plans to use the loan to buy more thread and yarn for her embroidery.

loans.use: To buy thread and yarn

loans.name: Mary Jeptanui

texts.en:
Mary Jeptanui S. is 40 years old and is married to Charles S.. They have seven children and live in Moi's bridge in the outskirts of Kitale. Mary does dairy farming in the same area and also sells milk. She has been in this business for ten years now and makes a monthly income of KES.15,000.


This will be Mary's third loan from KADET LTD. She has paid all her previous loans well and in good time. With this loan she is going to buy a dairy cow. She will use the income she is going to get to expand her business. 


In the future, Mary wants to be a large scale dairy farmer and to educate her children in good schools.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Magda

texts.es:
La señora Magda Auxiliadora A. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien tiene un pequeño caramanchel donde vende de todo un poco desde hace 10 años dijo mientras se sonrojaba. Ella comercializa arroz, azúcar, dulces, chiverías (meneíto, tortillitas, galletas, tortas, fresquito etc.) etc. 
Esta señora de 63 años es viuda y tiene tres hijos los cuales son mayores.
texts.en: Mrs. Magda Auxiliadora A. is a hard working, dedicated, enterprising woman.  She blushingly told us that she has a small lean-to where she has sold a bit of everything for 10 years.  She sells rice, sugar, candy, snacks (corn puffs, tortilla chips, cookies, cakes, frozen treats, etc.)  She is 63 years old, widowed and has three adult children.

loans.use: In products like basic grains and snacks.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Martha del Socorro se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, esta no es la primera vez que ha solicitado financiamiento ya que se siente muy contenta de realizar este medio de vida. Es una persona muy responsable que disfruta de su medio de vida y de compartir con sus clientes los diferentes productos que le solicitan como es cremas, tratamientos, pinturas de uñas, pintura de labios, perfumes, entre otras cosas. Sueña desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Martha del Socorro's business is selling cosmetics.  This is not the first time that she has requested a loan and she feels happy in her line of work.  Martha is a very responsible woman who enjoys her work and enjoys sharing with her customers the different products that they request such as creams, treatments, nail polish, lipsticks, perfumes, etc.  She dreams of expanding her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy creams, treatments, nail polish, lipsticks and perfumes

loans.name: Mavy

texts.en:
Mavy C. is from the village of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mavy owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising cows for sale. Mavy has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2011, Mavy joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Carmen Elodia

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación, este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Carmen, ella tiene 55 años de edad, hace varios años mantuvo una relación de unión libre de la cual tuvo 8 hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, en su casa viven cuatro de sus nietos que ella los tiene desde pequeños y que ahora  tienen 12, 11, 10 y 8 años, todos están en escuela.
 
Es una mujer muy luchadora que para salir adelante se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, su forma de venta es recorriendo con sus productos por toda la localidad, trabaja todos los días desde las 5h00 hasta las 15h00, sus nietos le ayudan cuando ellos no tienen clases. El pescado lo compra a pescadores en Los Arenales, los cuales le dejan a buen precio y un muy buen pescado, lleva 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella también realiza trabajos de limpieza y fileteada de pescado por lo que le pagan un sueldo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar pescado y llevarlo a vender. Lleva 8 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de parte de la fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es ver que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
In the Crucita parish of the Portoviejo Canton we find a place known as "Los Arenales". Here, every two weeks, the members of the "Nueva Generación" communal bank conduct their meeting. This location is known for its beautiful beaches, gastronomy and warmth of its people.

Here we meet Mrs. Carmen who is 55 years old.  Several years ago she had a common-law partner with whom she had 8 children who are all adults and independent.  Four of her grandchildren have lived with her since they were little and now they are 12, 11, 10 and 8 and in school.

She is a hard worker who, in order to get ahead, buys and sells fish door-to-door throughout the town.  She works every day from 5:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. and her grandchildren help out when they are not in school.  She buys fresh fish in Los Arenales at a very good price and has been in the business for 15 years.  She also cleans and filets fish for a wage.

This loan will be used to buy fish and sell it.  She has been in the communal bank for 8 years and enjoys the benefits she receives from the Espoir Foundation.

Her dream to is to see her children become professionals.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Bikira

texts.en: Bikira is a 42-year-old married man with six children. He owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. Bikira has been dealing in produce for ten years and with the income generated he has been able to pay his children's school fees. His hardship is price fluctuation. His vision is a big coffee store and construction of a commercial building in town. Bikira needs the loan to buy coffee to sell.

loans.use: To buy coffee.

loans.name: Miljury

texts.en:
Miljury is 38 years old and is married with 6 children.

She has a vegetable farm in the Philippines. Miljury is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies.

She has been farming vegetables for 6 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening and fruit vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides and other farm supplies

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN JOSE DE URUBAMBA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen; ella tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, galletas entre otros productos, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor para vender en la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Carmen belongs to the "San José de Urubamba" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Carmen is 38 years old, single, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her grocery store business.  Carmen sells essential household products such as rice, sugar, noodles, cookies, etc.  She works from 6.00am to 10.00pm.  Through her business, she gets her children ahead in life.  Carmen would like to expand her grocery store business.  She is requesting this loan to buy products wholesale to sell in her store.

Carmen is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy products wholesale to sell in her grocery store

loans.name: Felicita

texts.es: Felicita, de 44 años de edad, convive con Edgardo, de 50 años. Ambos tuvieron 3 hijos: Joel, de 20, Wilder, de 18 y Gisela de 16 años. Todos en unión familiar, viven en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad Puente Paucartambo (selva central peruana). La dedicación que le brida a su trabajo es muy importante para Felicita. Pues gracias al tiempo que pasa en sus cultivos, puede tener una buena cosecha en cada campaña agrícola. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo son las horas que pasa en la limpieza y quitar la maleza que crece entre sus frutos. Ya tiene 15 años consagrándose en el noble oficio de la agricultura, y en todo esté tiempo adquirió muchos conocimientos, y se siente feliz por ello. Sus principales cultivos constan de café y plátano; los cuales los vende en su misma localidad, donde después de cada cosecha encajona (una forma de envasar sus frutos), y vende a los comerciantes mayoristas que llegan los días martes y jueves. Ella se siente muy satisfecha por los resultados que está obteniendo; su principal anhelo es cultivar más productos agrícolas oriundos de la zona. Y ya dio el primer paso con la siembra de palta y cítricos, teniendo como resultado una un buen cultivo que está creciendo sin mayores dificultades y ya muy pronto darán sus primeros frutos. Por ello pide el apoyo de cada uno de ustedes para que se intensifique en esta actividad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Luz del Futuro”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Felicita, de adquirir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos entre sus cultivos de café, plátanos y palta.
texts.en:
Felicita, age 44, lives with 50 year old Edgardo.  They have three children.  Joel is 20, Wilder is 18, and Gisela is 16.  They live together in their own house in the Puente Paucartambo community  (central Peruvian forest).

The dedication that she applies to her work is very important to Felicita.  Thanks to the time she spends on her crops, she is able to have a good harvest during each farming season.  What she likes most about her work are the hours she spends clearing the fields and getting rid of the weeds that grow around her plants.  She has spent 15 years devoting herself to the noble business of farming.  During this time she has acquired much knowledge, and she happy about that.

Her main crops are coffee and bananas.  She sells them in her own area.  After each harvest she boxes them (a way of canning her fruits).  She then sells them to the wholesale merchants who arrive on Tuesdays and Thursdays.  She is very satisfied with the results that she is getting.

Her primary desire is to grow more agricultural products that are native to the area.  She has already taken the first step by planting avocadoes and citrus fruits.  The result of this is a good crop that is growing without any significant difficulty.  They will produce their first fruits soon.

That is why she is asking for the support from each one of you so that she can step up this business activity.

She belongs to the “Luz del Futuro” (Light of the Future) Communal Bank.  This is her sixth loan with MFP, where she hopes to get your collaboration so that she is able to finalize her plans.  She pledges, once again, to make her payments as she has done with the previous loans she has had.  It pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive people.

Upon receiving your support, Felicita will use the requested money to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer to spread among her coffee, banana, and avocado crops.

loans.use: to buy various sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: 52.thieu Long. Thieu Hoa Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chung works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Chung is 41 years old and she is married with two children. Chung is the group leader of the 52. Thieu Long solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.
