In 2005, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chung has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Chung has been involved in this business for more than 10 years, but the lack of capital is still the main hardship that Chung faces in her business.

With her business profit, Chung hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids and to extend her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding animals and cattle-feed.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Concepción D. 38 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su compañero D. vida y tres hijas que se encuentran estudiando. Ella es una mujer ejemplar la cual trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su querida familia. Hace muchos años y gracias a muchos esfuerzos ha logrado establecer una  pequeña tienda en la cual ofrece todo tipo D. producto D. primera necesidad como: granos básicos, detergente, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. Además posee un molino eléctrico en el que muele variedad D. productos como: maíz, frijoles, arroz, etc. Muchas personas la buscan ya que en el mismo lugar pueden hacer sus compras y al mismo tiempo moler su maíz para hacer sus ricas tortillas. Concepción es una mujer emprendedora y gracias a su creatividad  ha logrado mantener activo su negocio. Ella no se rinD.,  quiere mejorar su servicio y hacer que su negocio crezca cada día más. Es por esta razón que ha tomado la decisión D. solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para cumplir su sueño y mejorar el servicio que ofrece y al mismo tiempo mejorar su condición D. vida y la D. su familia. Con el crédito espera comprar variedad D. artículos D. tienda como: arroz, maíz, frijoles, azúcar, pan dulce, golosinas, etc. y seguir dando mantenimiento a su molino que por años les ha generado una gran parte D. sus ingresos.
texts.en: Concepcion is 38 years old and she live sin her own home together with her life partner and three daughters, who are all in school. She is an exemplary woman who works hard to proviD. for her beloved family. Many years ago, and thanks to great efforts, she managed to establish a small store from where she sells all types of essential products, such as: basic grains, detergents, snacks, pastries, etc. In addition, she also has an electric mill and she grinds a variety of products, including: corn, beans, rice, etc. Many people look to her because in the same place where they do their shopping they can also have their corn ground to make delicious tortillas. Concepcion is an enterprising woman and thanks to her creativity she has managed to keep her business active. She will not give up and she wants to improve her service and to keep her business growing more each day. She has maD. the decision to request a loan from Integral (Kiva Field Partner) to accomplish her dream and to improve the service that she offers. She also wants to improve the quality of her life and that of her family. With the loan she hopes to purchase a variety of store merchandise, such as: rice, corn, beans, sugar, pastries, snacks, etc. She also wants to proviD. maintenance to her mill. For years it has generated a large part of her income.

loans.use: to purchase rice, corn, beans, pastries, snacks, etc, and to carry out maintenance on her mill.

loans.name: Jorgita

texts.en:
Jorgita is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. She has a retail shop that sells canned goods, detergents and snacks. She has had this business for one year. 

She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy beverages and canned goods. Jorgita is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages and canned goods.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario has been a farmer for almost 23 years, planting rice and vegetables. He is also engaged in raising fish for sale to earn additional income for his children's college education. He earns a monthly income of PHP 28,000 to use for their food consumption and the daily allowances for their children.

He is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy feed and fingerlings to raise in his fishpond. He believes that being a patient and hard working farmer would lead him to improve their status of living and attainment of his children's college degrees.

loans.use: to buy feed and fingerlings to raise in his fishpond

loans.name: Nolmy Araceli

texts.es: Nolmy Aracely tiene 35 años de edad, y su familia esta integrada por su esposo que se dedica a las actividades de agricultura y por su hija mujer y su hijo varon, ambos estan estudiando. Nolmy es una persona muy simpatica y esforzada en todo lo que hace. Ella esta muy feliz por la familia que tiene y se siente muy contenta porque cada dia Dios le provee su sustento diario. Nolmy a parte de ser una trabajadora asalariada tambien desde hace aproximadamente 3 años se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos. En su tiempo libre realiza sus ventas de casa en casa por toda la comunidad donde reside pero su mejor clientela son sus compañeros y compañeras de trabajo ya que ella les vende al credito y cuando les cancelan la quincena en el trabajo ellos le pagan. El prestamo que solicita lo necesita para comprar todo tipo de cosmeticos para que las mujeres se embellezcan y luzcan radiantes, tambien comprará perfumes para damas y caballeros. Con el apoyo del prestamo podra surtir su negocio y realizará mas ventas, y eso le permitirá obtener ganancias y con estas podra ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y con los pagos de los estudios de sus hijos. Las metas de Nolmy son tener un negocio propio para no depender tanto de un sueldo asi pasar mas tiempo con su familia, tambien ver a sus hijos realizarse profesionalmente. Nolmy ya tiene dos ciclos en FAMA y ha demostrado puntualidad en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Nolmy Aracely is 35 years old and her family is made up of her husband, involved in agricultural activities, and their daughter and son. They both attend school. Nolmy is a very likeable person who works hard in everything she does. She is very happy for the family that she has and she is very happy that every day God provides her with a daily sustenance. Nolmy has been a salaried employee for approximately 3 years and she also sells cosmetics. She carries out her sales in her spare time, traveling from door to door throughout the entire community where she lives. But her best clientele are her work colleagues. She completes her sales in credit and when they are paid every two weeks she gets paid. The loan which she requests will be used to purchase all types of cosmetics so that ladies can beautify themselves and become radiant. She will also purchase perfumes for ladies and gentlemen. With the support of the loan she will be able to supply her business and she will be able to increase her sales. She will be able to achieve greater earnings and in turn she will be able to help her husband with the household expenses and with their children's schooling costs. Nolmy's goal is to have a business of her own and to not have to depend so much on her salary so that she will be able to spend more time with her family. Her goal is also to see her children earn a career. Nolmy already has had two loan cycles with FAMA (Kiva Field Partner) and she has demonstrated punctuality with her loan payments.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Gomiti

texts.en: Gomiti is a hardworking and visionary, 26-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with two children aged 3 years and 8 months. To make a living he has been running a school. He wants, in the next 5 years, to have expanded his institution and opened up another school. His dream is to see his school grow into an institution of higher learning. He is requesting a loan of 35000 Kenya shillings to renovate the classrooms. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has developed the culture of saving.

loans.use: to renovate classrooms

loans.name: Usaha Jaya 5 Group

texts.en:
Maryati is 43 years old. She is married with one son. In the picture she is the one wearing the white headscarf. A year ago she began selling "krupuk" (Indonesian crackers) in front of her house and through her neighbors' stalls. Now she needs a loan to buy more "krupuk" to expand the business from one kilogram to two kilograms per day. 

The income from her "krupuk" business supplements what her husband makes. She hopes that someday she and her husband will have enough savings to buy a home because they currently rent. She also hopes that having more income in the family will help her son someday obtain a commercial driving license so he can have a job.

loans.use: to pay for "krupuk" (Indonesian crackers) to resell in food stalls.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es socia del  Banco Comunal “Central Vaquería”, ubicado en la parcialidad D. Vaquería,  distrito D. Ilave, provincia El Collao, departamento D. Puno, tiene 67 años D. edad, está  casada y tiene 8 hijos independientes.  Estudió hasta 2do D. educación primaria.
Su primer préstamo fue por la suma D. S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio D. compra y venta D. animales. Trabaja desD. hace un año con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos.
Con éste nuevo préstamo D. S/.  500.00 nuevo soles, comprará cuatro ovinos para su engorD. por tres meses.  Nos cuenta que trabaja junto con su esposo en el negocio, también se dedican a la chacra, al sembrío D. papa, cebada, avena, habas, etc.
La señora desea seguir con el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Communal Bank "Central Vaquería," located in Vaquería, district of Ilave, in the province of El Collao, in the department of Puno. She is 67 years old, married, and has 8 independent children. She studied through second graD. in primary school. 

His first loan was for the sum of 500.00 soles, and she invested the money in her business of buying and selling animals. She has been a member of the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.

With this new loan of 500.00 soles, she will buy four sheep for fattening for three months. She tells us that she works together with her husband in this business. 

She also works in the fields growing potatoes, barley, oats, beans, among others. 

She wants to continue on with the business and increase her earnings. What she likes about the communal bank is the favorable loan conditions.

loans.use: to buy four sheep for fattening

loans.name: Evonnie

texts.en: Evonnie is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Evonnie has operated a retail shop for 5 years, selling clothing and beauty products from AVON and NATASHA. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock from AVON and NATASHA. Evonnie is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Evonnie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from AVON and NATASHA

loans.name: Kutfiddin

texts.ru: Кутфиддин вдовец и ответственный отец 4 детей. Он сам обеспечить своих детей и воспитывает их. Кутфиддин занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур более 20 лет и у него очень богатый опыт в данной сфере деятельности. В основном он выращивает картошку и пшеницу. Кроме этого он занимается откормом скота. Кутфиддин хотел бы получить займ для покупки двух голов бычка с целью расширения своего бизнеса и получения прибыли. Полученную прибыль он потратить для ремонта своего дома и улучшение свое жилищное условие.
texts.en: Kutfiddin is a widower and a responsible father of four children.  He provides for and raises his children by himself.  Kutfiddin has been involved in growing agricultural crops for over 20 years and has a very rich experience in this type of business.  He primarily grows potatoes and wheat.  Besides this, he is involved in fattening up livestock.  Kutfiddin wants to obtain this loan to purchase two heads of bulls in order to expand his business and make a profit.  He will spend the resulting profit to make repairs to his house and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two bulls in order to expand his business

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 33 years old; he is divorced from his wife and has a five-year-old child. He has been selling vehicle spare parts for the past five years. He has a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses for his child’s needs.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Raphael will use the loan to buy wrenches, oil and wheels to add to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to open a car wash business and expand the spare part selling business, which will help him improve his child's living standards.

loans.use: To buy wrenches, oil, and wheels to add to his business

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 30 años de edad, es casado con cuatro hijos.

Él vive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Desde los 14 años de edad aprendió a manejar en la escuela donde estudiaba. Después de casarse su vida ha sido de mucho esfuerzo, para sacar a su familia adelante, se levanta a las 4:30 de la mañana a prepararse y salir a recoger a los niños de su colonia, que lleva a la escuela en su microbús escolar, luego a la mediodía pasa a recoger a los niños de la escuela para llevarlos a sus hogares. Los fines de semana los dedica a la toma de fotografías y videos que él mismo edita en eventos como boda, cumpleaños, graduaciones, etc. Él solo desea brindarle lo mejor a su familia.

José solicita un préstamo, para invertirlo en la compra de otro motor, para su vehiculo, pues el que tiene es de seis pistones y le consume mucho combustible. Él desea comprar uno de cuatro pistones y de diesel. De esta manera ahorrara en combustible y ofrecerá un buen servicio a sus clientes con mejor precio, lo que le generara mayores ingresos, para su familia. 

José ahorrara lo más que pueda, para comprar un microbús más grande, pues cada día hay más niños en su colonia que viajan a la escuela. Además sueña con que sus hijas se gradúen y sean profesionales, pues es la herencia que les dejara.
texts.en:
Señor José is 30 years old, married and has 4 children. He lives with his wife and 4 children. When he was 14 years old he learned how drive at the school he attended. Since getting married his life has been a constant struggle to take care of his family. He gets up at 4:30 in the morning and goes to collect the children in his neighbourhood in his school minibus. Later, at midday, he goes and collects the children at school to take them home. The weekends are spent taking photos and videos at events such as weddings, birthdays, graduations, etc., which he edits himself. He only wants to give his family the best.

José is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of another engine for his vehicle as the one he has has 6 pistons and uses too much petrol. He wants to buy a 4 cylinder diesel engine. In this way he will save on petrol and offer his customers a good service, at a better price which will generate a better income for his family.

José saves as much as he can to buy a bigger minibus as there are more children every day in his neighbourhood that travel to school. He also dreams of his daughters graduating and becoming professionals as this will the inheritance he leaves them.

loans.use: to buy a 4 cylinder diesel engine for his school minibus.

loans.name: Sebastien

texts.fr:
Mr  SEBASTIEN est marié et Père de 01 enfant. Il a 02ans et personne ne va à l’école. Il a 03 personnes en charge.

Mr est  gérant d’une boutique de pièces détachées d’engin à deux roux  depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne au  yaar du théâtre populaire et au secteur 15 en ville. Ses clients sont les femmes, les hommes et les enfants.

Il veut  s’acheter  18 pneus pour moto,30 pneus pour vélo et 25 pistons

Mr  utilise ses bénéfices pour  agrandir sa boutique. Il  ambitionne  améliorer son commerce et construire un logement.
texts.en:
Sebastien is married and has a two-year-old child who does not go to school yet.  He also supports three additional persons.  

For 10 years now, Sebastien has managed a retail shop that sells spare motorcycle and bicycle parts.  He buys his products at the "yaar" (street market) in the neighborhood of the People's Theater, as well as in district 15 of the city.  His customers are women, men and children.

He would like to buy 18 motorcycle tires, 30 bicycle tires and 25 pistons.  Sebastien uses his profits to increase the size of his shop.  His goal is to improve his business and to build a house.

loans.use: To buy 18 motorcycle tires, 30 bicycle tires and 25 pistons.

loans.name: Marlin Betania

texts.es: Marlín Betania se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general y una pulpería. Ella inicio con fondos propios, pues anteriormente trabajaba de domestica y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida fue que logro establecer su negocio en su vivienda en donde ciertos clientes llegan a comprar sus productos. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, granos básicos, pan, detergentes, jugos entre otros.
texts.en: Marlín Betania sells general merchandise in a small grocery store.  She began with her own funds, since previously she worked as a maid.  With the help of her life partner, she was able to establish her business in her residence where certain customers come to buy her products.  The reason for the loan is to buy candies, sodas, basic grains, bread, detergents, juices, and other things.

loans.use: to buy candies, sodas, basic grains, bread, detergents, and juices, among other things.

loans.name: Phang

texts.en:
Phang is 56 years old and his wife, Soum, is 53 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for nearly 10 years and have one son who is in school.  

Phang and his wife are farmers; they grow beans and cauliflower on their farmland in the village where they live. Additionally, Phang’s wife also buys fish from fisherman in her village and carries them by bicycle to sell at the local market. 

Phang is applying for a loan in the amount of $1,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his farm.

Note: In the photo, Phang and Soum are at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his farm.

loans.name: Rozina's Group

texts.en:
Rozina has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing and embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy an embroidery machine through which she will be able to finish the orders on time and increase her income.
She prepares hand embroidery on dresses which takes a lot of time and effort from her and she wasn’t able to meet the orders on time.  She is hopeful that her work will improve further by purchasing machine and she will be able to finish her orders earlier. 
Her husband works in a vegetable and fruit market and earns reasonable income by selling these products. 
Rozina has given birth to 3 sons and 3 daughters. 3 of them study while the remaining 3 stay at home. 
She has been operating her business for many years and is confident about her success.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine for sewing & embroidery business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 47 years old and a widower with four children. He has been running a retail shop for the past two years with a   monthly income of Kes 8,500 which he uses to cater for his basic needs.

He is applying for his first loan with KADET Ltd of Kes 47,748, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  Daniel will use the loan to buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: To buy a stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger is 49 years old, and owns and manages a sari-sari store and carinderia (mini-restaurant). He has been engaged in this kind of business for twenty-one years. He is requesting a loan amount of PHP 50,000 to buy meat, vegetables, soft drinks, grocery items, charcoal and as bigger capitalization. This is due to the high demand of his offered services.  As of now, he is still working hard to provide the needs of his family. He always thinks of and sees to the welfare of his loved ones. He just hopes that his requested loan will be provided.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, soft drinks, grocery items, charcoal and as bigger capitalization

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson started selling fruit as an assistant for his father-in-law. He and his wife have been working in this type of business for over 15 years. They currently have a tricycle cart that they use in order to sell their fresh produce to the local community. They are seeking a loan in order to purchase a new tricycle cart. This will allow Wilson and his wife to work independently and cover more ground selling.

Wilson and his family of 5 children live with his mother and his sister. While he and his wife are at work, Wilson’s sister looks after the younger children. The house this family lives in is made out of wood and is in poor conditions. Wilson hopes that with the increased revenue from having a second cart he can fix up his family’s home. This business is in the only source of income in this household.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Buy a cart for his wife to use

loans.name: Maira

texts.en: Maira is a happily married woman of sixty-two, with four children. She lives with her family in Tufuiopa. She operates a flea market business selling 20-30 different kinds of handicrafts, such as Samoan bags, printed lavalavas, necklaces, rings and some general goods. She earns $250-$300 a day. Maira was selected as center chief last year, and she helps instill within the other members the belief in the significant contribution of the program in their lives and in supporting our families with the different talents within each individual.

loans.use: To purchase rolls of material.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sacks of peanuts

loans.name: Manuela Cecilia

texts.en:
Manuela Cecila C. is 29 years old and has worked hard over the last 2 years to develop a well organized little store called Tienda Jimena, named after her only daughter. You could call her tienda the local "mom and pop" corner store. Manuela has grown her business from a small eatery, or comedor, into a store that has everything the neighbors need for their daily life, including milk, sugar, rice, beans, pasta, soap, and a small selection of candy. She recently expanded to taking orders for shoes and makeup from the two small catalogs that sit on her glass candy case.

The Mayan women of this area mainly speak their native language, Quiche. She is an exception to the norm as she also speaks Spanish and has a sixth grade education.

Her smile says it all. She works hard and is proud to have developed this business. She relies on loans to restock her inventory and grow little by little. Her big dream is to provide an education for her daughter and continue to grow a successful business, which someday will expand to the transportation of goods.

loans.use: Purchase increased inventory for the store.

loans.name: Kifayet

texts.en: Kifayet M. is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict from the Gubadli region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. She is 32 years old and the mother of two children. Kifayet began her business with $400 in 2005. At first she was selling industry goods and earning little money. She has been busy with the mobile industry goods trade for 6 years. This money has been enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She has had difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc. Kifayet wants to improve her business by increasing the number of her clients and income. She needs $700 to expand  her goods assortment. She thinks that this expansion will improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: Kifayet would like to expand her business selling mobile industry goods to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en: I am Nida B.. I was born and brought up in Karachi, but moved to Lahore after I got married. I embroider clothes for my neighborhood clients, whereas my husband is a scrap dealer. He buys second hand spare parts of various machines and sells them in different cities. Now he wants to open up a store and start selling these spare parts in it. In this way, he will earn more and will not have to travel to other cities to sell his products. I will save the extra profits for my child who has yet to come into this world. We need a loan .

loans.use: Buy used spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Abiba

texts.en: Abiba Seidu is divorced and has one child age 12.  She is a trader who deals in provisions and food supplies. She  She pays her child’s school fees from the profit from her sales. She is working very hard. In order to improve her living condition, she wants to expand her business to maximize her profit.  She is asking for $1,200 to buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, mineral water, provisions, and crates of soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, cooking oil, mineral water, provisions, and crates of soft drinks for her store.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Mrs. Stella O. is 38 years old, married with six children, and lives in Benin City. She runs a store where she sells bread.

At the moment, she is requesting a loan of $450 to buy additional bread to sell. She had learned the business from her friend and started her very own business in 1996. She is a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more bread for selling

loans.name: Yeyen

texts.en: Yeyen, 34, has three children. She runs a grocery store from her home, earning $18 a day. Her husband, T., operates a printing workshop at home, but his income is variable, depending on the size of orders. Yeyen is a member of MBK and would like a loan of $125 to restock her store and add new inventory. She hopes to earn enough to pay tuition for her children. She agrees to repay this loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her grocery store

loans.name: Colorina's Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Colorina A.. She is currently in the business of bread-baking and is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying ingredients. Colorina is 47 years old and is married. Her husband works as a bookkeeper in a government office. She has 3 children ranging from age 14 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Colorina makes approximately 160 Sudanese pounds in profits. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to spend more to educate her children.

Colorina is joined in her small group by Grace A., Lusiyer K., and Hestela S.. Grace A. has a business in bread-making and wants to start baking different types of bread. Lusiyer K. is currently operating a business selling vegetables in the market and wants a loan to construct a shop. Hestela S. operates a business selling drinks and wants to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi C. is 41 years old and joined TYM Fund in 2003. She lives with her husband and their 3 children, 2 of whom are students. Her main business is selling bran for animals (ducks, pigs, etc.). Her husband works as a builder.

Mrs. Nguyen Thi C. has applied for a loan of $625 to buy more animal feed and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a printer, film, ink, and photographic paper so that he may offer complete service including printing the photos in his photography business.

loans.name: Phearum

texts.en:
Mr. Phearum C., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sokheng Heng, 29, who live on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2003 and have two young sons. 

Mr. Phearum has been a fisherman since he was young. He fishes on the Mekong River and a lake behind his house, selling his catch around the village, while Mrs. Sokheng has been a silk weaver for three years.
 
Mr. Phearum is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Ha Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Ha Thi N. (SEDA ID: 020013) is 25 year old. She borrows 2,242,000 Vietnamese Dong to buy inventory wood for her plan of producing small wooden items. She has anticipated in 1 loan term and repaid the loan on time. Her family incomes are 100,000 Vietnamese Dong, approximately $6.3, per day

Translated from Vietnamese by Duc Tran, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Nguyễn Thị Hà (MS: 020013), năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị vay 2.242.000 VND để bổ xung vốn mua gỗ làm hàng đục gọt. Chị đã tham gia được một chu kỳ vay vốn và hoàn trả rất tốt. Mức thu nhập của gia đình chị là 100.000 VND/ngày.

loans.use: Produce small wooden items

loans.name: Ganna

texts.en:
Ganna is married with four grown kids, six grandkids and a greatgrandson. She is retired and runs her own small enterprise in the central wholesale market of Nadvirna where she is originally from. Ganna sells food products wholesale at affordable prices. She launched her venture 18 years ago. Presently, her monthly income is about $1200-1400. Ganna owns two vending facilities and one of her daughters helps her run this other vending kiosk.

Ganna works hard to provide for her family as this business is the only source of income for them. She is aware of some tricks of this industry as she had worked in the sphere of commerce for 35 years before she started her own business. Ganna has an orientation to excellence and desire to achieve outstanding results which attracts many customers to her business. Today she is requesting a loan of 3000 Grivnas to purchase mineral fertilizers and grain for further sale in her kiosk.

Note: this is a short-term "seasonal" loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: Ganna would like to purchase mineral fertilizers and grain.

loans.name: Chhin

texts.en:
Chhin S., 38, is a true entrepreneur who lives with three of her children in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. 

She has a business selling rice noodles, or what we call in Cambodia's language "Nom Banchok". It is one of the favorite foods among Cambodian people. Rice noodles are served with mint, banana blossoms, string beans, English cucumber, mung bean sprouts and other vegetables. Moreover, they are used in two types of soup: green and red soup. Green soup is cooked with boneless fish only and called in Cambodian "Nom Banchok Samlah Khmer". The other soup can be cooked with pork or chicken and is called "Nom Banchok Namya". On average, she makes $2.50 of profit per day. Her husband is a wedding chef and is able to make $2.50 as well.

Mrs. Chhin would like a loan from Kiva to raise pigs for additional profit to support her family. She sees this as a good opportunity to better her family's standard of living.

loans.use: She wants to raise pigs.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin A. is happily married with 2 children. She is 30 years old.  She sells clothes and kitchen utensils in her shop located in Okoko, Lagos State, Nigeria.  She opens her shop from 7am to 6pm from Monday to Saturday. She is a LAPO client. Toyin hopes to expand her business. She needs a loan of $850 to buy more kitchen utensils and clothes to sell. Toyin has been in this business for a long time. She says thank you to all who made this loan possible

loans.use: To buy more clothes and kitchen utensils to sell

loans.name: Rakia

texts.en: Rakia Z. is 59 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Two of her children are married and living in their matrimonial homes, while the other two are still in school. She has been a trader for fifteen years, and she is hard-working and enterprising. She sells food such as maize, plantains, beans, groundnuts, and gari in the neighborhood to her loyal customers. She treks to the northern part of Ghana to purchase her supplies. She says her business is very lucrative. Therefore, she wants to expand her inventory to generate enough additional income to rent a store room. Rakia is a member of the group called “Matit” ("God will provide") Trust Group. Members agree to guarantee for each other as social collateral and assist one another to repay the loan. Her picture was taken during their group meeting.

loans.use: To buy food to sell.

loans.name: David

texts.es: EL SR. DAVID PINTO B., SE DEDICA A LA PRODUCCION DE LIBROS EN PEQUEÑAS CANTIDADES, LABOR QUE REALIZA EN SU DOMICILIO CON UNA PEQUEÑA MAQUINA DE IMPRENTA CLIENTE QUE TIENE DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS, ESTA LABOR REPRESENTA SU ÚNICA FORMA DE SUSTENTO PARA ÉL Y SU FAMILIA, ES ASÍ QUE GRACIAS A ESTE TRAJO, PUEDE MANTENER A SU UNICA HIJA, CUBRIENDO SUS GASTOS DE ESTUDIO Y ALIMENTACIÓN PORQUE ES PADRE SOLTERO. SE DEDICA CON MUCHO AMOR A SU TRABAJO Y A SU HIJ, DANDO EN EL DÍA A DÍA MUCHO DE SI. SU SUEÑO ES TENER UNA IMPRENTA PROPIA Y QUE SU HIJA SALGA PROFESIONAL.
texts.en:
Mr. David P. B. prints small quantities of books for a living, using a small printing press, which he has had for several years, at home. This job is his sole source of income for his family. Thanks to this occupation, he is able to support his only daughter, covering her food and educational costs since he is a single dad. He is wholeheartedly dedicated to his work and his daughter, giving it his all on a daily basis. He dreams of both having his own printing works and of his daughter becoming a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine N. is a 45-year-old mother of two. She set up her business of selling plastics 9 years ago. Hardworking N. will use the loan to purchase more plastics for her shop and thus expand her business. She is the owner of a plot of land in Kampala and she hopes that the income from her increased business will enable her to construct rental houses, a stable source of income in the country.

loans.use: Purchase more plastics.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 43 year old Sophia M. from Mwanza. She is a widow with four children, between the ages of 11 and 23 years old. Sophia M. has been running a Duka business- She owns a small duka or neighborhood shop in the city where she has been selling common household and grocery items since 2004. Sophia's business is doing well. She works at the business for 13 hours per day, 7 days per week. Sophia currently earns about 350usd from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400usd in order to buy more stock of her shop like breads, soaps, sugar, biscuits, lotions, and tomato sauces. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Sophia thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA!
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of her shop like breads, soaps, sugar, biscuits, lotions, and tomato sauces

loans.name: Rejina

texts.en: Rejina D. is a hairdresser who owns a beauty salon at Nyankumasi Ahinkro near Cape Coast. Rejina has received junior high education.  She is a single parent and has 2 children. Rejina has been a hairdresser since 2004. She is responsible for paying the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses. Her loan will be used to buy different and varied hair products to meet the demand of her customers who come to the salon. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest for the expansion of  her beauty salon.

loans.use: buy different and varied hair products for her beauty salon

loans.name: Nargis Munawar Masih Group

texts.en:
Nargis baji is a 35-year-old married woman and a citizen of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 20 years. Nargis baji is the mother of five children: four daughters and one son. All of her children are getting an education from a school located near her house. Nargis baji is married to a man whose name is M. M. and he is a mason by profession. Nargis baji is a very supportive lady. She shares the financial burden with her husband by sewing clothes. She charges $2 per dress. She invests her income in a committee because her husband wants to start a milk selling business. She is applying for a loan of PKR 56000 to add to the committee pool to buy a buffalo. 

She is a group leader of more women in her area. Razia begum baji would like a loan to buy wood for her wood selling business. Hanifan baji would like a loan to buy fertilizer to sell. Khalida baji would like a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. Kosar baji would like a loan to buy iron to make iron rods to sell. Ameeran baji would like a loan to buy goats to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo for selling milk

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Хаитов Анвар житель Джилликульского района. Возраст 27 лет .Женат и имеет двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование . Занимается животноводством. Скупает бычков для откормки . Затем продает их на тех же рынках. Планирует получить кредит. Использовать деньги хочет для покупки бычка.Таким образом он увеличить поголовье скота. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Anvar H. lives in the area around Jilikul. He is 27 years old. He is married and has two children. He has a higher education. He works in animal husbandry. He buys calves for fattening. Then, he sells them in the same markets where he bought them. He plans to take out a loan. He wants to use the money to buy a calf. That way he can increase the number of cattle he has. He can pay off the loan in twelve months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase number of livestock

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo A. is 48 years old and married with 3 children. She sells wines and drinks. She hopes to expand this business. She is requesting the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more wines and drinks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more wines and drinks to sell

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza - Faith And Hope Group

texts.es: El grupo Fe y Esperanza , son mujeres que se llevan bien, sociables, vecinas y familiares. Ellas viven en la Col. Nueva Esperanza y Venezuela que estan muy cerca. Wendy, una mujer joven, trabajadora desde hace 1 año, ella tiene una pequeña caseta la cual empieza atender desde temprano de 7: am hasta la 1:00 mediodia y luego vuelve abrir a las 3:00 pm y cierra a las 6:00 pm. Su negocio esta ubicado muy estrategicamente frente al campo de futbol y a la par del Centro de Salud de la comunidad, vende golosinas como ser Papas fritas, enchiladas, tacos y ademas lo mas preferido por sus clientes Granitas de café y mora. Los dias sabados es cuando mas vende porque llega bastante gente al campo, es muy amable necesita el credito para poder comprar materia prima por mayor y asi poder obtener mayores ingresos, es casada y tiene 2 hijos los cuales estan estudiando.  Ana, su negocio es la venta de golosinas como ser, Tajaditas de platano, tacos, yuca, pollo y refrescos todos los dias ella comienza desde las 7:00 am hasta las 9: 00 pm, es una señora muy conocida en la zona por su amabilidad con los clientes cuenta con 19 años de tener su negocio, con esto ha logrado construir su casa que es muy grande, su esposo labora como Mecanico de aviones, el negocio cuenta con sillas y mesas para la comodidad de las personas que van a comer alli, ya tiene clientes fijos que les vende desayunos y almuerzos, esta bien ubicada ya que es en la calle principal de la Col. Nueva Esperanza y es muy transitado por los alumnos de la escuela y colegio que esta muy cerca. Ella necesita el credito para poder comprar productos al por mayor y lograr precios mas bajos. Delmy, es una mujer joven, trabajadora y con muchas ganas de superarse ya que hace un año se graduo como Enfermera, ella cuenta con un pequeño negocio de variedades para uso femenino como ser, lapiz labial, delineadores, colas, ganchos, sombras, cremas, calsetas, aritos, pulseras, asi mismo vende productos por catalogo como ser, cremas , lociones, shampoo, jabones, desodorantes, cuenta con muchas clientas ya que ella tiene una vitrina grande frente a su casa que esta ubicada en una de las calles de acceso a la colonia Venezuela y asi mismo sus amigas y compañeras del centro de salud de la comunidad, tiene quince años de tener su negocio, su esposo labora como mecanico, tienen cinco hijos de los cuales tres ya estan terminando la Universidad y dos estan en la escuela, necesita el dinero para comprar productos como ser vajillas, cremas, perfumes, sandalias, adornos ya que en el mes de mayo se celebra en nuestro pais el dia de la Madre y sus clientas ya le han hecho algunos encargos.
texts.en:
Faith and Hope is a group of women who get along well, sociable neighbors and relatives. They live in the Nueva Esperanza and Venezuela neighborhoods that are very near each other. Wendy, a young woman working for one year, has a small stand which she opens early, by 7:00 AM until midday at 1:00. She returns to open again at 3:00 PM and closes at 6:00 PM. Her business is located very strategically in front of the soccer field and near the Community Health Center. She sells snacks like potato chips, enchiladas, tacos and also the most preferred by customers - shaved ices of coffee and blackberry. On Saturdays she sells the most because a lot of people come to the field. She is very friendly and needs credit to buy ingredients wholesale and thus earn more income. She is married and has 2 children who are students. Ana's business is selling snacks like banana chips, tacos, yucca, chicken, and soft drinks. Every day she starts at 7:00 AM and works until 9:00 PM. She ia a very well known woman in the area for her friendly manner with her clients. She has had the business for 19 years, and has been able to build a large house. Her husband works as a airplane mechanic. The business has chairs and tables for the comfort of the people that go there to eat. She has regular clients to whom she sells breakfast and lunch. She is well located in the main street of Nueva Esperanza which is well travelled by the students of the nearby school and high school. She needs credit to be able to buy products wholesale at lower proices. Delmy is a young woman, hardworking and eager to progress since it is one year ago that she graduated as a nurse. She has a small business selling a variety of products for feminine use such as lipstick, eye liners, adhesives, hooks, shadows, creams, earrings, and bracelets. She also sells products by catalog such as creams, lotions, shampoo, soaps, and deodorants. She has many clients and she has a big window in the front of her house which is located on one of the streets providing access to the Venezuela neighborhood and likewise to her friends and the community health center. She has had this business for fifteen years. Her husband works as a mechanic. They have five children of whom three are now completing the University and two are still in school. She needs the money to buy products such as tableware, creams, perfumes, sandals, and ornaments since in the month of May Mother's Day is celebrated in our country and her clients already have already placed some orders..

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase green bananas, cabbage, salsa, chicken, meat, soft drinks, vegetables, condiments, cups, plates, ornaments, tableware, perfumes, creams

loans.name: Edita

texts.es:
La señora Edita pertenece al Banco Comunal “Rio Desaguadero”, del distrito de Desaguadero, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada,  tiene 2 hijos, y estudios de secundaria completa.
Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 09 años, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sogas de nylon, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cual invirtió en su negocio.  
Ella desea solicitar un nuevo préstamo de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles para poder adquirir mayor materia prima (nylon) y elaborar sogas en mayor volumen, los mismos que los comercializara en los diferentes mercados de la región; obteniendo ganancias que los destinará en la educación de sus hijos; se compromete a pagar puntualmente su préstamo
texts.en:
Edita belongs to the "Rio Desaguadero" Village Bank in Desaguadero District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. Edita is 37 years old and married with two children. She has a high school education. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the part nine years. She makes and sells Nylon ropes for a living. Her first loan was for 300 soles, and she invested the money in her business. She is requesting a loan of 2,500 soles to buy more raw material (Nylon) so that she can make more ropes. She sells her ropes in different regional markets, and will use her profits to pay for her children's education. She has pledged to repay her loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Nylon to make ropes

loans.name: Moshi

texts.en:
Moshi has been a sausage seller in the Kola neighborhood of Morogoro for 2 years. She belongs to Railway Corter group loan (Group code 2053).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more sausage for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to expand her business.  

Moshi is 39 years old, married, and has two  children: ages 14 and 10.

loans.use: To buy more sausage for resale, to expand her business.

loans.name: Sartawisa Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal “Alto Lima” se encuentra la Asociación Comunal “Sartawisa” que  tiene aproximadamente 14 años de vida, sus integrantes tienen diferentes negocios  como: venta de comida, tienda de barrio, venta de ropa, tejido de mantas, venta de cosméticos y atención de cabinas telefónicas. Todas aseguran  que utilizarán el préstamo para la compra de materia prima o mayor mercadería.

Juana G. es una de las más antiguas integrantes, ella recuerda haber ingresado a la Asociación hace 13 años, cuando su cuñada la invitó, además tenía la necesidad  de contar con un capital para emprender un negocio, en ese entonces, ella vendía comida pero con el pasar del tiempo decidió cambiar de negocio y hoy se dedica al tejido de mantas que le permite tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
In the Alto Lima Community Center you will find the Sartawisa Community Association, which has been in existence for approximately 14 years. Its members have different businesses like selling food, neighborhood store, clothing store, weaving blankets, cosmetic sales, and tending telephone booths. They all guarantee that they will use the loan to buy raw materials or more merchandise. Juana G. is one of the oldest members. She remembers joining the association 13 years ago when her sister-in-law invited her. She needed capital to start a business. She then started selling meals. With the passage of time, she decided to changes businesses. She now weaves blankets, which allows her to have greater income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material and or buy more merchandise

loans.name: Puits De Jacob Plus Group

texts.fr: Célestin S. est vice-président d’un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Puits de Jacob Plus » depuis 2008. Il gère sa propre boutique ainsi qu’une cabine téléphonique qu’il a commencées en 2002 avec un capital initial de $100. Sa clientèle est constituée en grande partie par des étudiants car, son activité se situe au campus universitaire. Depuis 2008, Célestin a reçu plusieurs prêts qui ont renforcé et stabilisé son affaire et qu’il a remboursé totalement à temps. Le crédit qu’il recevra ce cycle, lui permettra d’acheter du lait, du sucre, des savons, des cartes prépayées et d’autres articles divers à revendre dans le but d’augmenter le bénéfice. Après ses études universitaires en Médecine cette année, Célestin a une ambition d’ouvrir un Centre Médical. Il est célibataire âgé de 31 ans. Actuellement, son affaire lui génère un bénéfice de $150 par semaine. Son groupe a eu le privilège d’être visité par John qui est Kiva Fellow venu des USA.
texts.en:
Célestin S. has been vice president of one of the Hope RDC groups called “Puits de Jacob Plus” since 2008. He owns and runs a small store and telephone booth, which he started in 2002 with an initial capital of $100. His clientele consists mainly of students, since his business is located on the university campus. Since 2008 Céléstin has received several loans which have strengthened and stabilized his business and which he repaid in full and on time. The loan he will receive in this loan cycle will enable him to buy milk, sugar, soap, prepaid phone cards and various other items which he will sell in order to increase profits. After his university medical studies this year, Célestin aims to open a medical center. He is single and 31 years old. His business currently provides him with a weekly profit of $150. His group was privileged to receive a visit from John, a Kiva Fellow from the US.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk, soap, tinned food, prepaid phone cards and miscellaneous items to resell at a profit

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
When Antonio T. inherited a rice farm from his parents, he was happy and confident that he would be able to make the farm productive. Now, he is 51 years old and still single. He wants to save money because he is still planning to get married, hopefully this year. He needs additional capital for his business. He would like a loan of 7,000 PHP from CEVI. He will use this loan in buying rice seeds, fertilizers and other farm needs.

Antonio is actively participating in CEVI cluster meetings where he learns about business and savings. He also receives insurance coverage in addition to the loans that he is requesting.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Good Name Group

texts.en:
Adwoa is 37 years old. She is married and the mother of four children, and she has all her children in school. She sells food stuffs like rice, beans and plantains, etc., in the local market in her community. She has been selling for the past five years now, and she has lots of selling experience to win customers. She is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to strengthen her and the kids' education. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of rice, yams, beans, cooking oil and plantains to serve her customers. She would be grateful for that assistance. 

She is the leader of a trust bank group called ‘Good Name’. She is the one sitting second from left in the group photograph. Most of the members of this group are petty traders, food vendors and/or farmers. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access the loan and peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of cassava, plantains, maize, beans, gari, etc.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a member of the Dodoma Road borrower group in Kihesa,Iringa,she is 39 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child,Her child is aged 22 years.she also care for other 1 dependent.

Leah started her own business selling charcoal 3 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 160,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Leah`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 300,000 Tsh in order to buy more charcoal for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Leah hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase working tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: achat de la banane plantain

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 48 years old and is married with two children. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past fourteen years.

Margaret is requesting the loan of N30,000 to purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more seedlings to plant and to cultivate her farmland

loans.name: Chizoba

texts.en: Chizoba is 32 years old and married with three children. She sells cosmetics and supplies at retail prices to her customers. She lives in Asaba, Delta State, Nigeria. She is a hard working woman. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more cosmetics and supplies to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn S. lives in the village of Oro Culai, Balulang Cagayan De Oro City. She is 27 years old, married and has three young children. To make a living, she owns and operates a store where she sells a variety of products used daily by the people in her community. She has been in this business for more than four years, and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Roselyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and ability to engage in business. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, her first, to buy new items to sell to her custoemrs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by this loan to improve and expand her store. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rosa

texts.pt:
Rosa C. nasceu no Distrito de Namaacha, fronteira com a Suazilândia, Província de Maputo, tem 51 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 7 filhos de 30, 27, 23, 22 e 17 anos de idade, apenas o mais velho já não vai a escola. Fez somente 4ª classe e não continuou porque a mãe levou a ela para Republica da Africa do sul quando perdeu o pai. Vive na casa própria com seus filhos e sustenta um neto que vive com ela. 

Saiu de Namaacha para Boane em 2007 com os seus filhos, depois de ter comprado uma residência, porque onde vivia a casa era alugada. Tem um negocio próprio ha mais de 17 anos, não tem empregado, trabalha desde as 08 ate as 17h todos os dias. Vende mais refrescos e bebidas onde consegue um rendimento de cerca de 1.000.00mt por dia que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa cerca de 200.00mt através de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupança rotativa) numa base semanal.

Já teve empréstimos na Associação GueGue Gue (cooperativa de credito) mais tarde decidiu não continuar por motivos diversos.
Conheceu a Hluvuku através de vizinhos e este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, bebidas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria no seu estabelecimento e subir o seu rendimento nas vendas.
 
Futuramente pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para construir capoeiras para criação de frangos de corte e concluir a sua obra.
texts.en:
Rosa C. was born in the district of Namaacha, which is on the border with Swaziland, in the province of Maputo. She is 51 and is the single mother of 7 children who are 30, 27, 23, 23, and 17. Only the oldest one isn't in school. She only studied through 4th grade and didn't continue because her mother took her to South Africa when she lost her father. She lives in her own home with her children and supports a grandchild that lives with her.

She left Namaacha for Boane in 2007 with her children after having purchased a house because the one where she used to live was rented. She has had her own business for 17 years and has never had an employee. She works from 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day. She sells soft drinks and alcoholic beverages and makes a montly income of 1,000 meticais per day, which she applies to her home's expenses. She saves 200 meticais on a weekly basis through a traditional rotating savings system known as Xitique.

She has already had loans with the GueGue Gue Association (a credit cooperative) and later decided not to continue with them for various reasons. She became familiar with Hluvuku through neighbors. This is her first loan in the amount of 8,000 meticais, which she will use to purchase products (soft drinks, alcoholic drinks, etc.) to increase the quantity of her merchandise in her business to increase her sales.

In the future, she hopes to request more loans to construct coops to raise chickens to butcher and to finish building her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell products (soft drinks, beer, and other drinks)

loans.name: Annarose

texts.en:
Annarose S. is from the village of D'ban Calamba Mis. Occ. She is 26 years old. Annarose is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Annarose owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Annarose has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Annarose joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annarose has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from GDMPC. Annarose is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Annarose from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en:
Odgerel is 41 years old and lives with her husband and six children in Bayanhongor Province, Mongolia. Her oldest son operates a cell phone repair business to help with the family's living expenses. Odegerl and her family live in a "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian tent.

Odgerel operates a bakery and ice-cream business in her town with the help of her husband. Odgerel spends most of her time baking and her husband is responsible for making and selling ice cream. Odgerel and her husband started their businesses in 2001 and have steadily made progress over the years. Their earnings have enabled them to buy tools and equipment for the bakery. They have many plans for the future and hope, one day, to open their own store where they can sell their baked goods and produce ice cream.

In the future, she wants to have her own store, so she has already begun to build a stall in a local market. She says, "All I want is for my children to be well-educated." Odgerel is requseting a 3,200,000 tugrug (~$2250 USD) loan to purchase milk and flour for her ice cream business.

loans.use: To purchase milk and flour for her ice cream business

loans.name: Ryan Vennyl

texts.en:
Ryan Vennyl G. is from the village of Baybay, in Ozamis City. He is 31 years old and married. To earn a living, Ryan Vennyl owns and operates a business venture in the service sector. Specifically, his income is primary derived from providing motorcycle services to local community members. Ryan Vennyl has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP per month on account of these activities.

In 2009, Ryan Vennyl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. As a result, he was better able to engage in business activities and to improve his (and his wife's) standard of living. Notably, Ryan Vennyl already successfully repaid a prior loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Ryan Vennyl is now requesting another loan, this time in the amount of 15,000 PHP ($350), which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in his business. This loan would be the second loan taken out by Ryan Vennyl from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices which cover the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishermen/women, and entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To improve his business by making vehicle repairs

loans.name: Petronila Fátima

texts.es:
La Señora Petronila Fátima P., es soltera, tiene cuatro hijos, ninguno a depende de ella, se dedica a elaborar refrescos naturales, vende  hielo, gaseosas y pan en su misma casa de habitación.
La señora Fátima anteriormente le trabaja al estado, pero se retiro para dedicarse a  su propio negocio, llena tres años y medio de trabajar con Ceprodel, quien  a demostrada ser una persona emprendedora y responsable.
texts.en:
Petronila Fátima P. is single and has 4 children, none of whom are dependent upon her. She makes natural drinks, and sells ice, soft drinks and bread from her own house. Fátima used to work for the state but she retired in order to dedicate her time to her own business. She has worked with CEPRODEL for 3 ½ years, and has shown herself to be an enterprising and responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS TO USE IN MAKING NATURAL DRINKS

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 42 years of age, married with four children between 11 and 15 years of age.  Three go to school.  Her family rents a three roomed house where she stays with six people.  She takes care of additional family members.  The family has access to electricity and piped water at home.  They eat three meals a day.

Allen operates owns a stall selling bananas in Namungoona market one of the city suburbs  She receives about 20 customers a day and has been in business for over five years.  Her main challenges are transportation and the increasing prices of food.  She sells on retail basis only and has been with MCDT for over seven years servicing her fourteenth loan working with the same group mates.  She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas to sell.
.

loans.use: Buy more bananas.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Suon B. is 32 years old. She was married but divorced her husband when her children were very young. Currently, she looks after six children, three of whom are no longer in school and work for a hotel, providing their small incomes to support the family.
Suon B. owns farmland in the village where she farms different types of crops to sell. She lives in a small house which is not able to provide her and her family with a comfortable home. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of $600 USD in order to widen the size of her existing house.

loans.use: To widen the size of her existing house

loans.name: Luna Maria

texts.en:
Luna Maria U. is from the village of Estrella, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Luna Maria is married and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Luna Maria owns & operates a business planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Luna Maria has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Luna Maria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luna Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Luna Maria is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luna Maria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Amy

texts.en: Amy S. is a 51-year-old woman from the village of Nianing, Senegal. She is married and the mother of six children. In the two years that she has been a member of the "Banc Villageois" NIANING SANTHIE she has always paid back her loans on time. Madame S. sells fish and palm oil. She wants to use her loan to buy more of these two products. The revenues from reselling them allow her to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fish and palm oil

loans.name: Kon's Group

texts.en: This group loan has four people who live in Thmey village in Kandal province. Those members will use their loan for different purposes that will improve their living conditions. Mrs. Kon P. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. She is a pig breeder who can earn some money to support her family. In her business she has a problem: her pigs are too small to sell, but she does not have enough money to fatten them. Thus, Mrs. Kon P. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food. Her husband, Mr. Sran Sam, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice that supports his family. The couple has four children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory, while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: Regina's Group

texts.en:
Regina G. is from the village of Barucboc. She is 43 years old. Regina is the group leader of a 10-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Regina G.'s Group.

Regina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns & operates a general store. While not her only means of generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 21 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Regina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Regina is requesting a new loan of 40000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product selection. This will be the ninth loan Regina has taken out from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product selection

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo O. is from the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. He is 48 years old. Reynaldo is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Reynaldo owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store and also sells fish. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food, daily use products and a variety of fish in the local market. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Reynaldo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. Reynaldo is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Reynaldo's third loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Orbelina

texts.es: Blanca Orbelina C. D. M. D. 34 años D. edad, vive junto a sus cuatro hijos, los cuales todos son menores D. edad, y quienes dependen por completo D. Blanca. Residen en el municipio D. Ilopango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Blanca posee una panadería, la cual esta ubicada frente a la zona franca D. Ilopango, lugar en donD. existen diferentes tipos D. negocio, y diferentes fabricas, en donD. trabajan cientos D. personas tanto en el día como en la noche, lo cual es muy beneficioso para ella, ya que sus ventas son bastante estables. Ella se encarga D. elaborar el pan, junto a su hijo mayor D. 17 años D. edad, el cual posteriormente entregan a otras tiendas pequeñas, y así mismo venden con los empleados D. la zona franca. Blanca solicita un préstamo por medio del cual obtenga el dinero necesario para invertir en la panadería, comprando harina, azúcar, sal, levadura y otros productos más, todo esto con el deseo D. aumentar su producción y así mismo D. mejorar sus ventas, el mayor deseo D. Blanca es D. poder solventar todas las necesidades D. sus hijos, ya que ella es madre soltera, por lo cual lucho día con día por salir adelante y darles todo lo mejor a ellos.
texts.en:
Blanca Orbelina C. D. M., 34, lives with her four children who are all minors and who depend entirely on Blanca. They live in the town of Ilopango, located in the department of San Salvador. Blanca owns a bakery which is located across from the Export Processing Zone, a place where various types of businesses exist as well as a variety of factories where hundreds of people work day and night. This is very beneficial to her, since her sales are quite steady. Along with her 17-year-old son, the eldest, she is in charge of making the bread which is then delivered to other small shops and also sold to the employees of the Export Processing Zone. Blanca is seeking a loan by which she may obtain money needed to invest in the bakery, purchasing flour, sugar, salt, yeast and additional items in order to increase her production and likewise improve her sales. Blanca’s greatest wish is to be able to afford all her children’s needs, since she is a single mother. This is why she works day by day to get ahead and proviD. all the best to her children.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, salt, sugar and yeast.

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “Camino al Exito” actualmente se encuentra en el V ciclo y está conformado por personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la oficina central D. la Asociación Arariwa. 

Las actividades económicas D. los algunos D. los socios a las que se dedican son por ejemplo, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. helados, venta D. ropa, venta D. comida, venta D. mochilas escolares y venta D. golosinas. Otros socios brindan servicios D. cocina, llamadas local y nacionales, recepcionista D. u hotel turístico y  empleado D. una pollería. 

Claudia, tiene 54 años, es divorciada y tiene seis hijos D. las cuales todos ya son independientes.   

Claudia nos cuenta. - En mi banco comunal “Camino al Exito”  somos 12 integrantes y me eligieron a mí como representante del banco comunal para dar mi testimonio D. mi actividad económica. 

Su actividad económica principal D. la señora Claudia es la venta D. artesanía y librería D. forma ambulatoria, ella recorre la ciudad del Cusco a pie y se dirige a hoteles, restaurante, centros arqueológicos y paraderos turísticos en busca D. turistas para vender artesanías. Ella también venD. en la entrada y salida D. un colegio útiles escolares como por ejemplo lapiceros, borradores, cartucheras y  muchas cosas más. Ella empieza a vender útiles desD. las siete la mañana hasta la una D. tarD. aproximadamente. Ya son veinte años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Claudia es socia nueva en el banco comunal y su amiga Victoria le invito a participar en el banco comunal,  ella requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como lapiceros, reglas borradores, cartucheras y etc.
texts.en:
The Camino al Exito (Road to Success) community bank is now in its fifth round of funding. The members of the group are hard-working business people who just want a chance to get ahead in the world and create a better future for their children. The group meets every thirty days at the main Asociacion Arariwa office. Members operate a range of businesses: cosmetics sales; ice cream sales; clothing sales; food sales; sales of school backpacks; and candy sales. Other members proviD. various services: cooking; operating a phone call center; working as a receptionist at a tourist hotel; and working in a chicken processing plant. Claudia, 54, is divorced and has six children all of whom are now independent. She tells us, "My community bank, Camino al Exito, has 12 members and they chose me to proviD. an example of the businesses we operate". She works as a street vendor and her main source of income is from sales of crafts, pens, paper, etc. She works around Cusco, on foot, going to hotels, restaurants, archaelogical sites and tourist spots, looking for tourists who might want her craft products. She also works at local schools selling pencils, erasers, pen cartridges and a lot more. She works selling school supplies from seven in the morning to one or so in the afternoon. She has done this kind of work for twenty years and it's going well. Claudia is a new member of the community bank. Her friend, Victoria, invited her to join the group. She will use the loan to buy merchandise such as pens, rulers, erasers, pen cartridges, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Guinda

texts.en:
53-year-old Guinda B. is from the town of Talibon. She is married and has 4 children. She owns a farm where she plants rice crops. She sells her harvest at the market. She also grows hogs for fattening and sale. Guinda also loves to cook and uses her hobby as another source of income. She prepares and sells cooked food around her neighborhood. She says she wants to give the best for her family that's why she works this hard.

Guinda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Guinda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Guinda is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP that will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure, feed for the pigs, and ingredients for the food she makes for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Guinda from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure, feed for pigs, and ingredients for the food she makes for sale.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina A. is from the village of Gappal, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 39 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Divina owns & operates a general store where she sells food & daily use products. She has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Divina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Divina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
