ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & provide working capital

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria, madre de dos hijos, desde joven se ha dedicado a trabajar para apoyar a su familia, siendo su esposo conductor.
Ha trabajado en cocina de un pequeño negocio, pero también gracias a su tenacidad y empeño comienza  a vender ropa, cosméticos logrando adquirir buenas ganancias y captación de clientes
Han construido su casa de concreto aun falta poner el piso ya que es de tierra y que esperan hacer la mejora para estar en mejores condiciones de higiene.
A través del financiamiento ha logrado mantener el equilibrio de su negocio, tiene poco inventario y con este préstamo comprara: una docena de pantalones, docena de camisas, de varón, ropa interior, a si como domestico de productos Avon.
Doña Ana espera tener resultados positivos.
texts.en:
Ana Maria is the mother of two children. From a young age, she has worked to support her family. Her husband works as a driver.

Ana worked in the kitchen of a small business, but thanks to her tenacity, she started selling clothes and cosmetics. She generates a good income and is attracting customers. Ana built a concrete house, but it is currently lacking a floor. She hopes to have one installed in order to provide cleaner conditions.

By utilizing loans she has been able to keep her business in balance. Since she has very little inventory, Ana will use this loan to buy a dozen trousers, a dozen men’s shirts, undergarments, and Avon products. She hopes to have positive results.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dozen trousers, a dozen men’s shirts, undergarments, and Avon products

loans.name: Uk's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people located in Ta Reab Doun Sar village, Kandal province. Mrs. Uk N., age 49, is the leader of the group, having been selected by its members. Each member of this group loan will use their portion to support their different purposes.    
   
Mrs. Mrs. Uk N. earns a small income through her vegetable selling in the local market and is able to earn a small profit to support the family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more vegetables to sell. She is married to Mr. Chhit Sarim, who is 50 years old and works as a construction worker as well as helping with his wife's business. 

This couple has two children who are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy necessary things for the shop

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela B. is a hardworking mother. As a typical Filipino mother she used to stay in the house doing the usual household chores. But now that her children are grown, she wants to mingle with other people, develop her personality, take away her shyness and improve her income as well. She joined Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), a partner of Kiva in the Philippines, to fund her variety store and to join the group of ASHI members in her community. On her second loan, she is applying for PHP 9500. With the loan, she will buy grocery products so that she can meet the demands of her growing customer base and increase her profit. She is saving all her income from this variety store so that she can buy a motorcycle, which she needs to transport her products. She is hoping that Kiva lenders will support her in achieving her dreams for her family and continue to assist her financially until she becomes a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: To buy additional stock for her variety store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene E.'s main source of income comes from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. She is 50 years old, married and has six school-aged children. They are from the city of Cataggaman Viejo, Tuguegarao City. Irene has been in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. Irene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Irene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Irene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand the services provided. This will be her sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Nguon N., a 42-year-old resident of Kompong Chhnang Province, sells a few products such as soft drinks, food, and other plastic products. She typically makes around $2.5 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She has been married for many years to Brak Khorn, 42, a man highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. This couple has five children, two of whom are married while the other three are students and dependent on them.

Nguon wants her son to have an occupation as a motor-taxi driver; due to a lack of capital, she is requesting a loan from Kiva to buy a secondhand motorcycle for him to begin running a taxi service.

loans.use: To buy a secondhand motorcycle for her son to begin running a taxi service.

loans.name: Swalehe

texts.en:
Swalehe is a married man with six children, three of whom attend school while the other three are still too young to go to school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.
Swalehe operates a retail shop, selling wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil. His potential customers are neighbors and passers-by. Swalehe faces the major challenge of seasonality and high transport costs incurred while transporting goods from the market to his place of operation. He hopes to sells his goods wholesale in the future.
With this loan of 40,000 KES he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil. He decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking oil

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo en una zona rural D. la localidad D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un buen número D. aves D. corral como patos y pollos, los cuales cría en algunos ambientes dentro D. su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Esta actividad le permite ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Flora desea ampliar su negocio comprando más aves y alimento balanceado D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas durante esta temporada naviD.ña, que es cuando la demanda por sus animales aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Flora, age 55, is married and lives with her husband in a rural zone of the community of TambogranD., an agricultural district located in the Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

She has a large amount of poultry which she raises indoors. When they have reached a good level of development, she offers them for sale to the general public and to merchants who visit the area. This business allows her to help her husband, who is a farmer, with the economic support of their family.

Flora wishes to enlarge her business by purchasing more birds and balanced feed so that she can increase her sales during this Christmas season. That is when the demand for her animals increases, and that’s why she believes this is a good time to apply with Epydme Alternativa for a loan of 500 new soles.

loans.use: Purchase of animals in order to enlarge her business of raising and selling poultry.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es:
Cristina Marín habitante colonia Verdún en la Ciudad de Nueva Guinea, de 53 años de edad y con 26 años de laborar para el Ministerio de Educación como docente del colegio Alfonso Cortéz,  esta clienta ha demostrado excelente record crediticio en todos los créditos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado, y es una mujer luchadora y esmerada en su trabajo a la vez ha sacado  adelante a su familia aunque con algunas trancas que le pone la vida pero ahi va luchando para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  

Solicita su onceavo crédito para invertirlo en mejora de sus vivienda y tener mejores condiciones en la misma. Su mayor sueño en la vida es que sus hijas sigan estudiando para que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Cristina Marín is a resident of the Verdún suburb in the city of New Guinea, is 53 years old, and has 26 years experience working for the Ministry of Education as a teacher for the Alfonso Cortez college. This client has demonstrated an excellent loan record with all her loans that AFODENIC has granted her and she is a hard-working woman, careful in her work while getting her family ahead even though life has put obstacles in her path but is now fighting to improve her living conditions.

She is requesting her eleventh loan to invest it in improving her home and have better conditions for herself. Her greatest dream in life is that her daughters continue studying so that they can be good people.

loans.use: Home repairs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and one brother. He has been working as a private teacher since 2008 to earn income. With his business income, he is able to help his father with the family expenses. 

As is common among young Lebanese men, he has a job and is pursuing education at the same time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university fees. He is studying Business Administration and this is his second year. 

In the future, he is planning to start his career in a company and be able to help his parents with his income.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María de 47 años, es vendedora de productos Yanbal y productos naturales es madre soltera porque hace años murió su esposo y ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ha trabajado como vendedora informal de productos Yanbal como perfumes, cremas, desodorantes y productos naturales a base de noni. Trabaja con ayuda de uno de sus hijos repartiendo los productos desde muy temprano. 

Tiene muchas aspiración para seguir trabajando por eso quiere continuar vendiendo su mercadería con el préstamo quiere comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes etc. En el futuro quiere seguir manteniendo ese ritmo de ingresos.
texts.en:
María, age 47, is a vendor of Yanbal products and natural products. She is a single mother, because her husband passed away a few years ago, and she has had to take care of their children.

She lives in an urban zone called Orquideas. She works as an informal vendor of Yanbal products, such as perfumes, creams, deodorants and natural products made of noni fruit. One of her children helps her, and they start selling very early in the morning.

She has many goals for continuing to work, and so she wants to keep selling her merchandise. With this loan, she wants to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, etc. In the future, she wants to continue maintaining this rhythm of income.

loans.use: perfumes, creams, deodorants

loans.name: Zulaika

texts.en:
Zulaika N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kamuli in the Jinja region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Zulaika has a tailoring business, designing and making clothes. She has been engaged in this business for one year.
To help expand her business, Zulaika has requested a loan of 150,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more material for making clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Zulaika hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Zulaika is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her to be hardworking and showing her how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase more material for making clothes for resale

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Madame  Fati a 30 ans et mère  de  2 enfants. Elle  est mariée et habite quartier  Baguida.  Elle est revendeuse de fruits au marché de  Baguida.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand  marché de Lomé et compte dans cette activité  6 ans déjà. Elle sollicite un prêt  pour acheter  3 paniers d’ananas,  4 paniers de mangue et 2 paniers de banane.
texts.en: Ms. K. is 30 years old and the mother of two children.  She is married and lives in the Baguida district. She sells fruit at the  Baguida market. She has been in this business for 6 years and gets her supplies at the Lomé Grand Market. She is requesting a loan to buy 3 baskets of pineapples, 4 baskets of mangos and 2 baskets of bananas.

loans.use: To buy fruits

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
A  la vivienda del señor José M. le está haciendo falta la barda perimetral,  porque al no tenerla está haciendo que su casa no sea segura para su esposa e hijo. Por lo que está solicitando un crédito para pagarle a la persona que la construirá así como comprar el material para hacer dicha barda.
Debido a que el señor José y su esposa trabajan, pagar dicho crédito no será un problema porque la señora Blanca le ayudara con algunos de los gastos de la casa, y así el podrá utilizar sus ingresos como transfer para pagar dicho crédito,  porque los dos desea brindarle el mejor patrimonio a su hijo.
texts.en: Jose M.'s home is missing a perimeter fence.  Not having it is making the home unsafe for his wife and child.  This is why he is requesting a loan, in order to pay the person who will build it and to also purchase the materials for the fence.  Since Jose and his wife work, paying the loan will not be a problem because his wife Blanca will help with some of the household expenses.  This way he can utilize his earnings as a transfer towards the loan.  Both parents wish to offer the best patrimony to their child.

loans.use: Install a perimeter fence.

loans.name: Leovina

texts.es:
La Sra. Leovina, P. D. pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Moralinas”, del Distrito de Morales, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 44 años, es conviviente y es madre de 2 niñas.  Tiene estudios secundarios completos.
El espíritu luchador y las ganas de superación que siempre le han caracterizado le han valido para incursionar en el negocio de venta de comidas. Con su primer crédito de S/. 300.00 Nuevos Soles empezó el negocio de venta de carnes asadas en su misma casa, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes, llegando  a tener pensionistas y ampliando el negocio. Agrega también que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad y que se siente muy contenta con ella. Sus ventas las realiza  diariamente  a partir de las 11.30am.

Con este crédito  de S/ 2,000.00 Nuevos Soles,  comprará insumos como arroz en sacos, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus sopas y  pollos eviscerados para sus anticuchos, asimismo utensilios de cocina como cuchillos, platos, ollas y una mesa más, para seguir brindando un servicio de calidad.  

Leovina se siente muy tranquila y feliz, agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Leovina Pero D. is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Moralinas” which is in the District of Morales, Province and Department of San Martín. She is 44 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two daughters. Leovina completed her high school education.

A fighting spirit and the desire to succeed are characteristics that have always defined Leovina. These qualities helped her to start her business of selling food. With her first loan of 300 PEN, she was able to start selling roasted meats from her home. Over time she built a reputation among her customers, which include pensioners, and expanded her business. Leovina is doing very well in her business and feels happy with what she has done. Her sales begin every day at 11:30am.

With this loan of 2000 PEN, Leovina will buy supplies such as sacks of rice, eggs, Creole chickens for soups, butchered chickens for kebabs, as well as cooking utensils such as knives, plates, pots, and another table so that she can continue providing quality service.

Leoniva is pleased and feels at peace. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams of goals.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice, eggs, chickens, and cooking utensils.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Lucia is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Lucia makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling snacks and other delicacies like suman and bibingka. Lucia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional raw ingredients like sticky rice and sugar. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Lucia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ida

texts.es:
En la parroquia Crucita del cantón Portoviejo encontramos un lugar conocido como los arenales, aquí cada quince días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Generación. Este lugar es conocido por sus hermosas playas, por su gastronomía y por la calidez de su gente.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Ida B., tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos que son mayores de edad, soleros y que aun vive con ella. Su esposo se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Está en el en el Banco Comunal casi desde el inicio y le gusta porque en las reuniones se entretiene y aprende de las charlas educativas que imparte el asesor de crédito.

Tiene un local en su casa en el cual se dedica a la venta de mariscos, nos cuenta que en su negocio los clientes encuentran de todo ya que ella les ofrece: camarón, langostinos, cangrejos, pescado en muchas variedades, conchas, etc. Ella ofrece productos de muy buena calidad ya que esta es su garantía y es por esto que sus clientes la prefieren. Trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 14h00, nos cuenta que tiene su negocio ya por 20 años y que en las temporadas playeras es cuando más vende.

Este crédito es para comprar toda clase de mariscos como pescado, camarón, conchas, cangrejos, langostinos, etc. para darles a sus clientes lo mejor.
 
Su sueño es tener  casa propia ya  que vive en una casita  de sus padres.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Nueva Generación community bank meet in Crucita parish, in Portoviejo canton, in a place called Los Arenales.  This area is known for its beautiful beaches, its rich cuisine and the warmth of its people.

Here we meet 48 year-old Ida B. who is married and has two grown-up children.  Her children are single and still live with her.  Her husband sells seafood.  Ida has been a member of her community bank since it was founded and she likes it because she has fun at the meetings and learns from the educational talks given by her loan advisor.

Ida sells seafood from premises in her home.  She tells us that her customers find everything they need in her business since she offers them shrimp, prawns, crab, a wide variety of fish, shellfish, etc.  Ida sells very good quality products and this is her guarantee.  This is why her customers like to buy from her.  Ida works every day, from 7.00am to 2.00pm.  She tells us that she has had her business for 20 years and she makes most sales during the beach seasons.

Ida will use this loan to buy all kinds of seafood such as fish, shrimp, shellfish, crab, prawns, etc, so that she can provide her customers with the best.

Ida's dream is to own her own home as she currently lives in her parents' home.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, shellfish, crabs, prawns, etc.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa L. has been selling fresh fish in Abbina, near Elmina in Cape Coast, for 10 years. She buys the fish from the market, cleans them and prepares them for smoking. Her loan will be used to buy additional fresh fish to increase her business. She hopes to reinvest the new profit. In the photo are some of the smoked fish in a tray on a basket.

loans.use: to buy additional fresh fish to increase her business.

loans.name: Sandra Inés

texts.es: Sandra Inés D. cuarenta y dos años D. edad vive con su compañero D. vida y su hijo. Ella tiene una venta D. especies las cuales compra por mayor y después las empaca y las venD. por tiras. Sandra ya posee mucha clientela pues es un producto muy usado en los hogares para preparar comidas exquisitas, además las especies son D. mucha calidad a un buen precio; para Sandra no hay labor pequeña si se hace con entusiasmo y entrega y es así como se animo a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más especias como fideos, harina D. pan, orégano, pimienta, entre otros para no decepcionar al cliente y satisfacer sus necesidades. Sandra tiene la esperanza que su  trabajo le ayuD. a sacar adelante a su hogar y darle a su familia una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Sandra Inés is 42 years old and lives with her life partner and son.  She has a business selling spices.  She buys her spices wholesale, puts them in packets and then sells them in strips.  Sandra already has a lot of customers as people use spices a lot to make delicious meals.  In addition, her spices are very good quality and she sells them at a good price.  For Sandra, there is no job too difficult if it is done with enthusiasm and commitment.

Sandra requested a loan from INTEGRAL to buy more spices.  She will buy noodles, bread flour, oregano, pepper and other products so that she can keep her customers happy and meet their needs.  Sandra hopes that her work will help her to get her household ahead and proviD. her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy noodles, bread flour, oregano and pepper

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Bertha; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant, ella prepara desayunos, almuerzos y cenas, ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 9:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el local de restaurant. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mesas y productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Bertha belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Urubamba district, Urubamba province, Cusco department.

Bertha, age 31, has a life partner and one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business.  She makes breakfasts, lunches, and dinners.  She works from 5:00 a.m. until 9:00 p.m.  It is through this business that she gets her children ahead.

She wants to expand and improve her restaurant site.  She is requesting a loan to buy tables and products for cooking like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy tables and products for cooking like chicken, meat, and vegetables.

loans.name: Danilo Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Danilo, es un pequeño comerciante de frutas y verduras  de la zona de la concepción, durante los últimos tres años se le presentan problemas de alzas de productos, en ocasiones llega a dar las frutas  casi al costo para no perderlas,  don Danilo sus sueños es poder comprar una camioneta para vender ambúlate ya que actualmente lo hace pero en un pequeño carretón que es su herramienta de trabajo , el necesita que se le apoye para poder incrementar su negocio y obtener más ganancias para poder apoyar a su familia ya que tiene  dos que estudian su primaria . Agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atrávez de fondos Kiva.
texts.en:
Danilo has a small business selling fruits and vegetables in the Concepción area. For the past three years he has had trouble because of increasing prices and occasionally he has to sell his fruits almost at cost to ensure that they don't go bad. Danilo's dream is to be able to buy a van so that he can travel to make his sales. He does this currently, but he only has a wagon to transport his goods.

He needs support so that he can expand his business and increase his income so that he can support his family. He currently has two children who are in primary school. He is grateful for the support that Afodenic is giving him using Kiva funds.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Nomelia

texts.en:
Nomelia is married and is 45 years old. She has one adult aged child. She has a retail shop where she sells a variety of daily-use products. Nomelia had this business for five years.

Nomelia is requesting a loan of PHP4,000 to buy products like detergent soap, canned goods and spices that she can sell in their local community. In the future, Nomelia hopes that her business can grow to maintain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy products like detergent soap, canned goods and spices.

loans.name: Hardy

texts.en:
Hardy is 33 years old and married with two children, ages 5 and 7. He runs a general store in Lumley, a neighborhood in Freetown. He has one employee. Hardy has been in this business for 10 years and sells provisions, rice, soap and soft drinks in his store. He also earns income from a cinema business. He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation in provision items.

Hardy requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provision items like milk, soft drinks and soap. Hardy says that the extra income from this loan will help him increase his savings from the profit he will make. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks, soap and tinned milk.

loans.name: Jossa Mae

texts.en:
Jossa Mae is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 2 children. For the past year, she has had a retail shop where she sells vegetables like carrots. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy additional stocks of vegetables.

Jossa Mae is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of vegetables

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en: Ariunaa is 31 years old and lives with her husband and four children in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her younger two sons attend secondary school and the older one works as a guard. She manages a brick manufacturing business with the help of her family. She started her business in 2009 and gained much experience. She is planning to buy a brick-producing machine in order to expand her business operation. Her products are well known among her customers. People use the bricks to build houses and storage etc. She is a hardworking lady who says, "I am planning to buy construction materials with my earning in order to build a house next year." She is requesting a 3,300,000 MNT loan to purchase more bricks and materials for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more bricks and materials

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan trabaja como chofer propietario de un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros y es socio del sindicato de choferes Eduardo Avaroa. El crédito lo requiere para compra de llantas nuevas y un mantenimiento general del vehiculo. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is an independent driver and transports passengers with his own vehicle. He is a member of the Eduardo Avaroa taxi union. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy new tires and pay for general maintenance of his vehicle. He lives at the home of his parents in the District of Tembladerani in the city of La Paz. Juan is married and has two children.

This is the first time he has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy new tires and pay for general vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Ernita

texts.en:
Ernita is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Ernita has a shop that provides & sells wooden lamination of pictures & other certificates. She has had this business for 14 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to provide wooden lamination of pictures.
Ernita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ernita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to provide wooden lamination of pictures

loans.name: Maher

texts.en:
Maher is a 32-year-old married man with one child.

He has worked as a mechanic for 16 years. He started working early because he had to help his family to cover expenses.

Maher is a hard-working man. He seeks the best in everything. He always updates his machines and tools to keep his work professional. Most of his customers are friends, relatives and neighbors.

He is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, for the second time, in order to buy a new car lift, necessary for his business. He is a good standing borrower that Al Majmoua is proud to deal with, just as his customers are.

Maher hopes to expand his working place and to open new branch in the future.

loans.use: To buy a new car lift for his business.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
La Sra. Roció cuenta con 36 años de edad tiene tres hijos los cuales estudian la primaria el mayor que se llama Daniel está cursando 4º grado de primaria y Carlos esta en 2º grado y el más chico Erick esta en preescolar, ella es casada su esposo se llama Jaime se dedica al campo.


Ella se dedica al comercio vende dulces en la escuela primaria lo cual su préstamo le sirvió para surtir sus dulces, ya que dice  le ha ayudado en problemas económicos, invirtió su préstamo en compra más dulces.

A la Sra. Roció le gustaría que su negocio creciera un poco y no nada más vender dulces en la escuela si no también establecer un negocio en su casa, ella tiene ese proyecto y está seguro que lo hará pero más adelante.
texts.en:
Sra. Roció is 36 years old and has three children who are of school age. Her oldest child Daniel is in fourth grade, Carlos is in second grade, and little Erick is in preschool. She is married to Jaime, who is a farmer.

Sra. Rocío sells candy at an elementary school. This loan will be used to restock with more candy. She says that this has helped with her financial problems, so she will invest her loan in the purchase of more candy.

Sra. Rocío likes the fact that her business has grown a little bit. In addition to selling candy at school, she would also like to establish a business in her home. She has this project in mind and is confident that she will pursue it sometime later.

loans.use: to buy more candy.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 33-year-old married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 14 years old. Jocelyn sells mobile phone credit loads to the people in her community. She started this business 2 years ago. Jocelyn also raises pigs and grows rice on her land. She does her best to support her family.

Jocelyn plans to use this loan to buy pig feeds, fertilizers and more mobile phone credit loads to sell. She hopes for her loading business to grow.

loans.use: to buy pig feeds, fertilizers and more mobile phone credit loads to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 31 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past seven years, James has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells paint and does painting jobs in town. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more cans of paint and will help James to generate greater profits and provide for his family's medical needs. James hopes that in the future he will be able to transition into wholesale business. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to purchase more cans of paint.

loans.name: Melda

texts.en:
Melda is 22 years old. She has been in the farming business for the past one year with a monthly income of KES 15,000 which she uses to cater to her basic needs.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET LTD staff member. Melda will use the loan to buy farm manure and seedlings for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will venture into pig rearing. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and do farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy farm manure and seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Carlos Nelson

texts.es:
Carlos, vive con su familia, sus hijos de 15 y 18 años de edad, y su esposa, él trabaja como taxista, todos los días de 6:00am a 7:00pm, en su trabajo realiza viajes fuera de la ciudad, para tratar de ganar más clientes en el día.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la reparación del taxi, pagara mecánico y comprara los repuestos que sean necesarios, este préstamo le ayudara para hacer las reparaciones necesarias al taxi, manteniéndolo en buenas condiciones para brindar el servicio a los clientes, de una manera más segura.
La aspiración de Carlos es mejorar su vehículo, proveer ingresos para su familia  y apoyar a sus hijos para que estos se superen.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his family: his children who are 15 and 18 years old and his wife.  He works as a taxi driver every day from 6am until 7pm.  He sometimes does trips out of the city to acquire more customers during the day.

He is asking for a loan to repair the taxi, pay the mechanic and to buy whatever spare parts might be necessary.  This loan will help him do necessary repairs on the taxi keeping it in good condition to provide customer service in a safer way.

Carlos’ hope is to improve his vehicle, to provide family income and to support his children so that they will get ahead.

loans.use: to pay the mechanic to repair the taxi.

loans.name: Jose Ibrahan

texts.es:
Don Jose tiene una pulpería en su casa en donde es atendida por el y su esposa, tiene mas de 07 años de dedicarse al comercio, en donde vive es muy conocido por muchas personas, su amabilidad es especial y esto le ha ayudado a tener buena clientela, lo prefieren por ser amable al momento de atenderles y tambien por sus buenos precios, vive con su nuera y tres nietos, que estan estudiando, pero ellos no dependen de el, ya que su hijo les envía dinero de los ESTADOS UNIDOS para su manutención.
Don Jose es un buen cliente de prisma y comenzo de un grupo solidario, ya lleva tres créditos trabajando de forma individual y a demostrado fidelidad y puntualidad en sus pagos.
el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en su pulpería, quiere surtirla, la época esta mejorando y las ventas igual.
texts.en:
Jose has a grocery store in his home in which both he and his wife work.  He has been working in commerce for more than 7 years.  Jose is very well-known in his area by a lot of people.  His kindness is special and this has helped him to attract good customers.  His customers prefer to buy from him because he is kind when he serves them and also offers them good prices.  Jose lives with his daughter-in-law and three grandchildren who are in school.  However, they are not dependent on him as his son sends money from the United States to provide for them.  

Jose is a good client of Prisma.  He started off working as part of a community bank but has now had three individual loans.  He has shown himself to be loyal and punctual in making his repayments.  Jose will use his loan to invest in his grocery store.  He would like to stock his store as the season is improving and so are his sales.

loans.use: to buy groceries, soft drinks and dairy products

loans.name: Edwin Oliver

texts.es:
Edwin Oliver tiene 19 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con la abuelita en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

La VRC. SAN JOSE Se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El Rosario, perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

Edwin se dedica a la Agricultura hace 4 años a la siembra de cacao, maíz, arroz y a la cría de chanchos y gallinas.
Las compras lo realiza en Ventanas. Solicita el Crédito para aumentar más la productividad la simebra de maíz y arroz. El sueño es poder tener tierra para seguir cultivando.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema, en los tiempos libres le gusta parcticar el deporte.

Con LA AYUDA DEL CRÉDITO ANTERIOR HA LOGRADO INVERTIR EN LA AGRICULTURA para la siembra de maíz, arroz y fréjol, la situación económica ha mejorado 
"Está muy agradecido por la por la ayuda".
texts.en:
Edwin Oliver is 19 years old, single, and has no children. He lives with his grandmother in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

The San Jose Communal Bank is located in neighborhood of El Rosario, which is part of the canton of Ventanas. This Communal Bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Edwin has been farming for four years. He grows cacao, corn, rice, and also raises pigs and chickens. He purchases his supplies in Ventanas. Edwin is requesting a loan so that increase his corn and rice production. His dream is to have more land so that he can continue farming. At the moment, he is not facing any types of problems. In his free time, he enjoys practicing sports.

With the help of his previous loan, Edwin was able to invest in his farming activities of growing corn, rice, and beans. His financial situation has improved. He says, “I am very grateful for the help.”

loans.use: to buy farming supplies so that he can increase his corn and rice production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has four children. 

Elizabeth has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elizabeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Hind

texts.en:
Hind is a 41-year-old married woman from Irbid, Jordan, and is a mother of one child.
Hind has a beauty salon which started as a home-based salon. With hard work, she was able to expand her business into an established salon near her home.
Hind is now requesting a loan of 500 JOD to license the salon and purchase new equipment. She is looking to open a barber shop for her husband so that they can increase their income together and improve their family's living conditions.

loans.use: to license her salon and purchase new equipment.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a 35-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is a food vendor. Elvira makes "banana cue" (fried bananas on a stick), rice cakes and other local delicacies to sell to her community. Elvira works every day to help meet her family's needs.

Elvira has requested this loan to purchase bananas, cooking oil, sugar and flour. Elvira hopes to have a stable income to help sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, cooking oil, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines with her husband and seven children. She earns a living running a sari-sari (or variety) store where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has been in this business for 10 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Felecia joined HSPFI last year as a way to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Avaroa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AVAROA” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Senkata, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Lucia. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: Tejido de guantes de alpaca, tienda, tejido de chompa, venta de comida, venta de papa, taller de costura, tejido de mantas.

La señora Lucia  indica que este es el segundo ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de artefactos eléctricos que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su madre.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de artefactos eléctricos) que comprará de la ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia pues ella es casada  y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio.

En la fotografía solo salio el brazo de la señora Delia, poruqe no se ubico bien.
texts.en:
The Avaroa communal bank will start its second cycle with Pro Mujer as part of Centro Senkata.  It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors headed by Lucía.  The members of the communal bank carry out various businesses, among which we have: knitting alpaca gloves, store, knitting sweaters, food sales, potato sales, tailor shop, and weaving blankets.

Lucía indicates that this is the second cycle she has worked with Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of a promoter.  Currently she has a business selling electrical devices that she has been doing for years, having learned it from her mother.

The loan she will get now is to increase her capital with the purchase of electrical devices that she will buy in the city of Oruro and later sell in her sales stall.  This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as possible, because she is married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the consultancy.

In the photograph, only Delia's arm came out because she did not situate herself well.

loans.use: to buy devices.

loans.name: Héctor Manuel

texts.es: Héctor Manuel se dedica al oficio de la agricultura desde hace muchos  años atrás. Él vive en una zona rural donde la agricultura y la ganadería es la principal actividad,  Héctor se dedica a la  siembra de frijoles y maíz, los cuales comercializa en diferentes lugares. El bienestar y crecimiento de este negocio  es muy importante para Héctor, ya que es el que le permite sostener a su familia, razón por la que solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, con el deseo de contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en la compra de mayor cantidad de frijoles y maíz para sembrar, con esto Héctor espera sembrar muchas más semillas y poder percibir más ganancias que el año anterior y de este modo mejorar la calidad de vida que llevan.-

loans.use: Compra de maíz para sembrar y vender

loans.name: Jasuda

texts.en:
Jasuda, a 49 year old woman from the Jayanagar village in the Koraput district of Odisha, works for a daily wage in the agricultural farms. In order to maximize her efforts, she is running a small scale animal husbandry business too. The family of four earns a monthly household income of 8,000 INR. Half of the income being utilized as expenses, they end up saving 4,000 INR per month.

Jasuda has bigger dreams. She wants to get rid of financial dependency and wants to become secure. This will need a lot of savings and a lot of hard-work. Jasuda doesn't think twice to invest her best efforts. She wants to expand her animal husbandry business and increase her income. She seeks a loan of 35,000 INR to buy a buffalo, with which she expects to increase her monthly income 2,000 INR.

loans.use: to buy goat kids and chicks for rearing

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia was born in Victoria, Tamaulipas. She has been living in Monterrey for 20 years. She is divorced and she lives with one of her children that helps her to assist her store. Her small business is 15 years old and she has gone growing little by little since she began. She started with small quantities of merchandise until her business became a store that can cover all the necessities from her clients. She began her business for the necessity to support her children after getting divorced, and for that reason she wants to offer them an education and a better quality of life. On weekends Julia sells in her house tacos and hamburgers and people characterize her as a very responsible and hard-working woman.

Julia requests a loan of $475 USD to purchase merchandise and hopes this next winter season will increase her sales and her incomes will be better than the last year. She hopes you support her.

** This text has been translated from the following original business description.

Doña Julia nació en Ciudad Victoria Tamaulipas, pero tiene 20 años viviendo en Monterrey, es divorciada y vive con uno de sus hijos que le ayuda a atender su tienda, Su pequeño negocio tiene 15 años y ha ido creciendo poco a poco; comenzó con pequeñas cantidades de mercancía hasta convertirse en una tienda que puede cubrir las necesidades de todo el barrio; inicio esto por la necesidad de sostener a sus hijos después de divorciarse y por que quiere ofrecerles una educación y una mejor calidad de vida. Doña Julia los fines de semana vende en su casa tortas, tacos, hamburguesas, por lo que se caracteriza como una mujer muy responsable y trabajadora

Doña Julia solicita un crédito de $475 USD para comprar mercancía, ella espera que esta próxima temporada de invierno se incrementen sus ventas y sus ingresos mejoren.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique has been a farmer his entire life. He has been on this particular plot of land for the last 16 years. He has had 6 children, two of whom are still in school and live with him and his wife Vilma. On his farm, he also raises pigs and horses as additional sources of income. He plans to invest all of the loan money in his area of expertise, which is rice farming.

The Paypayales Communal Bank in Santa Lucia

Enrique is part of one of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program: the Paypayales Communal Bank. All bank members are part of a rice farmers' cooperative in Santa Lucia named Dios Con Nosotros (God is with us). They will use these microloans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. As members of a communal bank, they are all the guarantors for each other's loans. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Dios con Nosotros Cooperative are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many microfinance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about the commnity of Santa Lucia, compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The region is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area, as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with the rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them harvest their crop. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not have access to formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also often lack skills and knowledge of how to commercialize their product and get fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical microentrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them to repay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Grow rice on his lands

loans.name: Rosario Isabel

texts.en:
Rosario is a 43-year-old married mother of two children, ages 18 and 23. To help her husband with the household expenses and their children’s education, as well as providing sufficient time to care for the family, Rosario, for three years now, has sold natural products. She started this business because these very products, which were recommended for her use, produced great results. Thus, she began offering these natural products to friends and family members. Thankful to the quality and affects of these products, little by little she gained more clients, and now carries out many requests.

The love for her family and the desire to see her children succeed professionally has motivated Rosario to continue the growth of her business. She asks for a loan of 475 dollars to utilize in the purchase of merchandise to be able to offer to a greater number of clients. She intends to pay back her loan within 4-8 months. This family sincerely appreciates your collaboration in the development of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Rosario tiene 43 años de edad, es casada y madre de dos hijas de 18 y 23 años. Para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y de la escuela de sus hijas, y además tener el tiempo suficiente para no descuidar a su familia, desde hace tres años Rosario se dedica a la venta de productos naturistas, inició porque le recomendaron este tipo de productos para su uso personal y al obtener buenos resultados comenzó a ofrecerlos a amigos y familiares, gracias a la calidad y efectos que sus productos ofrecen, poco a poco fue ganando más clientes y ahora surte grandes pedidos.

El amor hacia su familia y el deseo de ver a sus hijas en exitosas profesionistas han motivado a Rosario a continuar creciendo con su negocio, ahora solicita un crédito por $ 475 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer a un mayor número de clientes, ella ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio, esta familia agradece sinceramente tu colaboración.

loans.use: To purchase goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his scrap selling business

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Ever since she was very young Rosa María has had an immense passion for dressmaking. She learned the trade at a young age, and set up her small shop in her home after having her first baby, who now works with her. Her quality of work, kindness and knowledge of the craft has made her one of the most wanted and requested seamstresses. She decided to repair one of her sowing machines and give it to her eldest daughter so that she could learn this trade alongside her mother. Demand for her dressmaking, especially on the higher end, has increased, and for this reason Rosa María wishes to acquire a semi-industrial sewing machine and another standard sewing machine to easily satisfy her clients' requests. For this, Rosa María is requesting a loan of $325, which she plans to repay within six months, with the goal of starting a small business of high-end dressmaking with the help of her daughter. Rosa María is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Rosa María, desde muy niña posee un inmenso amor por la confección de prendas. Gracias a esta vocación desde muy joven; luego de tener su primer bebé inicio el acondicionamiento de un pequeño taller en las instalaciones de su hogar. Su calidez, amabilidad y conocimiento la han convertido en una de las más queridas y solicitadas.Hace poco y observando las inconveniencias por las que atravesaba la familia de su hija mayor decidió reparar una de sus máquinas y regalársela para que también desarrolle esta actividad junto a ella. La demanda de más y mejor confección de prendas se ha incrementado y por esta razón el deseo de Rosa María es adquirir una remalladora semi industrial y una máquina de coser para satisfacer sin dificultad la solicitud de sus clientas. Debido a ello es que solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses con el propósito de iniciar una mini empresa de alta costura con ayuda de su hija en las instalaciones de su hogar.Rosa María, aprecia y agradece tu apoyo.

loans.use: Purchase a semi-industrial sewing machine and a standard one to realize the dream of having a small business of high-end dressmaking in her city.

loans.name: Teresa Da Conceicao

texts.pt:
Teresa is a single mother of one child. She works for a private company. She wishes to invest the loan in her clothing retail business. She lives with her son who currently goes to a day care, but once he is old enough he will be enrolled in a public school.

Translated from Portuguese by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Teresa e solteira mas tem 1 filho pequeno. Ela trabalha numa Empresa Privada. Ela quer usar o dinheiro para investir no seu negocio de venda de roupa. Teresa vive sozinha com o seu filho. Ela apenas vai a uma creche. Mas logo que tiver idade sera matriculado numa escola Publica.

loans.use: Teresa wants to use the money to purchase more clothing for her retail business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en: Justina A. is a trader who deals in fishing net. She is married with three children. Her husband is also a trader. Justina works very hard. She receives her supply from a company in Accra.  The demand for nets and threads from Justina is great but her capital is limited.  She is asking for a loan of US $ 1,200 to enable her buy more fishing nets and more thread for repairing fishing nets to meet customer demand.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets and more thread for repairing fishing nets

loans.name: Sarah's Group

texts.en: Sarah is married with eight children. She has a poultry business. She also sells chicken feed. She wants to use the extra profits to build a house and buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To begin another business so as to support the family.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Continue diversifying his inventory

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. Kong S., 37, is a housewife who stays at home cooking food and looking after the children. Her husband supplements the household income by working as a motor-taxi driver, earning on average around $3 a day of profit. This couple has two children, one of who works in Phnom Penh as a garment worker. They would like to request a loan from Kiva to fix their motorbike which is the family's main source of income. Part of the loan amount will also help to purchase wood to strengthen their house. In the future, when they retire, they plan to open a small business breeding pigs, chicken, duck and so on.

loans.use: She will use this loan to fix a motorbike and purchase wood to strengthen her house.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en:
Mrs. Chhem C. S. is a 40-year-old policewoman who supplements her income by selling beef tripe, earning about $5 per day. Her husband, Puon Ly, earns $5 per day as a taxi driver. They live with their three children in Baray Toch Village, Kampong Thom Province.

Mrs. S. requests a $500 loan to expand her beef tripe business. With the extra income, she hopes to further her children’s studies as well as improve her family’s financial stability. In the photo, the woman with black shirt is Mrs. Chhem C. S..

loans.use: To expand her beef tripe business

loans.name: Yolanda Del Rio Group

texts.es:
In the Villa Adela zone of El Alto is located a community center which carries the same name. The association of women, “Yolanda of the River,” belongs to this community center and has 16 members. It is a very friendly group of women, who have grown to be very tightly knit over the time they have worked with Pro-Mujer and received loans.

The group members work in several different industries. One woman owns a small hair salon (a trade she learned from her mother), another sells food. The majority of the women however, produce clothing. They sew blouses, pants, skirts, jerseys, etc. The women sew all these items on their own, and learned to do so in the training facilities of Pro-Mujer.

The women are requesting this loan in order to purchase fabric. With additional fabric the women will be able to expand their businesses and obtain individual shops in order to sell their goods in a more formal manner.

Translate from Spanish by Casey Unrein, Kiva volunteer.

En la zona de villa Adela, se encuentra ubicado el centro focal delmismo nombre, a este pertenece la asociación “Yolanda del río” cuenta con16 socias. Un grupo muy simpático y particular ya que además de trabajar juntas con el sistema de créditos que pro-mujer les sofrece, llegaron a formar una muy linda amistad entre ellas. Las actividades que realiza la asociación “Yolanda del río” son de todo tipo alguna de ellas tiene un pequeño salón de peinados, negocio que aprendió de su madre, venta de comida, pero la mayoría se dedica a la confección de ropa como ser: blusas, pantalones polleras, buzos deportivos y otros, estos artilcuos son confeccionados por ellas mismas ya que ellas aprendieron el oficio de la confeccion en los talleres de capacitacion que Pro-Mujer ofrece. Afirman que necesitan mayor capital para la compra de telas, asi poder expandir su negocio y adquirir puestos propios para ofrecer sus productos de manera más formal.

loans.use: Purchase of additional fabric in order to expand their businesses and obtain individual shops in order to sell their goods in a more formal manner.

loans.name: Kor Toeur Group

texts.en:
Four people in Samrith Chey Village have formed a business group with Mrs. Kor T. as the group leader. She is a subsistence farmer and a fish seller. Her husband, Mr. Nol Long, is a fisherman. Mrs. Kor T. has two children, both of whom attend the local school.

Mr. Nol Long's business now faces problems because he does not have enough money to buy fishing nets. Thus, Mrs. Kor T. has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose.

loans.use: To buy more fishing nets

loans.name: Pring

texts.en:
Mr. Pring S., 47, is married with five children and works as a construction foreman, making on average around $3 per day. His wife works selling fish at Phsar Prek Pnov market near her town. She purchases fish wholesale from fisherman at a river dock and then resells them for a profit. Some of the fish are sold fresh and some are dried before being sold. She can make about $4 each day of net income.

Now Mr. Pring S. would like to change his business from working as a construction foreman to driving a moto-taxi to transport passengers from place to place in his town. Because construction work is irregular and the income he makes is inconsistent and barely enough to support his household, he would like to request a loan from Kiva to purchase a motor-bike with a trailer attached to transport passengers in his town. He feels sure the trailer business will go well and earn his family a lot of money.

His wife is pictured because Mr. Pring S. is not available.

CREDIT MFI is an independent Cambodian faith-based organization. It aims to empower the economically active poor and small entrepreneurs by providing inclusive financial services.

loans.use: To purchase a moto-taxi with trailer attached

loans.name: Jhonatan Vincenth

texts.es:
Jhonatan lives in the street of “Eduardo Abaroa” at Obispo Indaburo, in the city of La Paz. He is single and lives with his parents.

He works for a company that installs gas cylinders at houses located in the city of El Alto.

This is the first loan he requests to Impro and the loan evaluation that was realized qualifies him to receive the loan. Jhonatan will use the loan to buy welding tools in order to improve his work.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Almendares Leistner, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhonatan vive en la calle Eduardo Abaroa, zona Obispo Indaburo en la ciudad de La Paz. Es soltero y continúa viviendo en casa de sus padres.

Su ocupación laboral es ser empleado en una compañía de instalación de gas domiciliario en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinará para la compra de un equipo de soldadura, indispensable herramienta para poder mejorar su desempeño en el trabajo.

Es su primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: To buy welding tools in order to improve his work

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 32 years old. She is married with 3 children, aged between 18 and 8. She has been an artist and porridge seller since 2000. Every day she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $20 from her sales.

Mwajuma now requests a loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Viv Ansanm Group

texts.en: The group "Viv ansanm" is a group of 10 people from Haiti. Haiti is one of the poorest countries in the world, and a place where the majority of its people are unemployed. This hardworking group is trying to find a way out of their extreme poverty, and start to better their lives. Lutherking is the representative of this group and an important part its overall success. She is a very hardworking mother of two young children, and is looking to start a small business of selling fish. She feels like this is her way to improve life for her and her family. Her dream is to have a thriving business and to help her family live comfortably. On behalf of the group, and Esperanza International----we thank you for your support!!

loans.use: Fish Vendor

loans.name: Akou

texts.fr: Akou D. est une revendeuse de poissons très connue dans son quartier qui prend toujours son affaire au sérieux ; Elle habite à Kpalimé une ville située au sud-ouest du Togo et souhaite par ce  crédit augmenter son fond de roulement pouvant lui permettre d’acheter en gros et faire face à la demande de sa clientèle afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice
texts.en:
Akou D. is a well-known retailer of fish in her district who always takes her work seriously. She lives in Kpalimé, a city located in the southwest of Togo, and wishes to use this loan to increase her working capital. This would enable her to buy in bulk and to address the demands of her customers in order to realize more profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish for retail sale

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es: Esteban tiene 49 años de edad, se ha quedado viudo hace 4 años, de esa relación tuvo 5 hijos, de los cuales está viviendo con el segundo de ellos. Estaban es agricultor, única actividad que ha desarrollado toda su vida, le gusta cultivar alverjas, papas, habas, etc., pero lo que nunca deja de sembrar es papa, y ahora el mercado le ha favorecido en el costo, lo que le ha  permitido recuperar su inversión, en cambio, no ha sembrado mucha alverja, por la falta de dinero. Aparte de esto, tiene ganado, y personas quienes los cuidan, él solamente los revisa esporádicamente. Lo más difícil en su actividad es el elevado costo de los fertilizantes, porque siembra en sus chacras tanto de regadío (sistema de riego) y temporales (según las lluvias), por ello no se abastece con el dinero suficiente para comprar sus fertilizantes. El es un nuevo cliente de MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará abono de granjas que por bolsa le cuesta S/.200, invertirá un aproximado de S/.1.000.
texts.en:
Esteban is a 49-year-old man who has been a widower for 4 years. He has 5 children, the second of whom lives with him. Esteban is a farmer, as he has been his whole life. He likes to grow peas, potatoes, broad beans, etc., but what he never stops growing are potatoes. The potato stock is up right now, which has allowed him to recoup his investment. On the other hand, he has not been growing very many peas due to a lack of funds. Aside from that, he also has cattle that other people look after. He only occasionally checks on his cattle. The most difficult aspect about his work is the high cost of fertilizers because he grows crops on both irrigated land and seasonal plots (according to the rain), which is why he does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. He is a new MFP member. With the money being requested, he will purchase fertilizer at 200.00 PEN a bag. He will invest approximately 1,000.00 PEN.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer for his crop fields

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: El Sr. Abraham tiene 40 años de edad, habitante del barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, casado,  su esposa le tiene tres hijos de 2, 10 y 15 años de edad. Los planes para con su familia es mejorar su nivel de vida, ofrecerle seguridad y una mayor comodidad mediante un préstamo para construir completamente su casa,  con la solicitud de préstamo va  a comprar  materiales de construcción  como: cementos, hierros, bloques que se requieren para terminar de hacer su casa ya que solo tiene el arranque de piedra con hierro, su techo es de zinc y parte forrado con plástico, este préstamo va hacer de gran benefició y lograra cumplir esas metas. Don Abraham se desempeña como vendedor de especies independiente desde hace seis años, inicio su pequeño negocio con fondos propios y ahora desea la ampliación de su negocio con nuevos productos y nuevas rutas de distribución. Agracias a los prestamos de Afodenic lograra ofrecerle a su familia una mayor comodidad y seguridad.
texts.en:
Señor Abraham is 40 years old and lives in a neighborhood called Villa Reconciliación in Managua, the capital of Nicaragua. He is married and he and his wife have three children who are 2, 10 and 15 years old. His goal for his family is to improve their quality of life, provide security, and increase their comfort by means of a loan to completely rebuild their house. With this loan request he is going to buy construction materials like cement blocks and iron that are needed to finish the construction of his house, which is currently only made of stone with iron, and his roof is corrugated iron and partly covered with plastic. This loan will be a huge benefit and will help accomplish his goals. Don Abraham has held a position as a vendor for six years, starting his own small business with his own funds, and now he wants to grow his business with new products and new distribution routes. Thanks to the loans from Afodenic, a partner of Kiva, he will be able to provide his family increased comfort and security.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para terminar de hace su casa

loans.name: Hoang Thi

texts.vi: Chị Hoàng Thị Hồng, năm nay 42 tuổi, chị có 2 con đều đang đi học. Hiện nay, nguồn thu chính của gia đình chị là từ buôn bán kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị 3.500.000đ/tháng. Vòng vay tới chị Hồng muốn vay 9.000.000 để đầu tư buôn bán kinh doanh hàng tạp hóa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hoàng Thị Hồng, 42 years old, has two children who attend school. Currently, the main source of income for her family is their grocery store, from which they earn about 3,500,000 VND (204 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, Mrs. Hồng hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (525 USD) to invest in buying inventory for her grocery shop.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grocery shop

loans.name: Qatiba

texts.en:
Qatiba K. is a very hard-working woman. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 9 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This way she can pay for the education of her two children who have high hopes for the future. She raises calves and later sells them according to her clients' demand at the markets. She prepares them ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country.

Since Qatiba aspires to a great future, she decided to expand her business with the sole purpose of improving her family's living conditions and helping pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Juana Berta

texts.es:
la Sra. M. tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tuvo 3 hijos de los cuales 1 de ellos se encuentra en USA y a veces le ayuda enviandole dinero para el sosten del hogar, una hija se encuentra estudiando su cuarto año en la Universidad Nacional Autonoma de Honduras ubicada en Tegucigalpa y la otra se estudia en el cologio y en sus ratos libres acompaña a su madre a vender productos en el mercado.
la Sra. M. Propuso como meta tener su propio negocio desde hace varios años ya que anteriormente trabajaba vendiendo ropa de otras personas era empleada de una tienda de ropa y graicas a Dios ha logrado poner su propio negocio.
su mayor sueño es que sus hijos se graduen de la universidad para que se puedan defender solos en esta vida, tambien ella quiere que su negocio sea bien grande para tener mayores ganancias y asi tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Ms. M. is 48 years old. She is single and has 3 kids. Of the three, one lives in the USA and helps her sometimes by sending her money so that she can support herself and her children at home. One daughter is studying in her fourth year at The National Autonomous University of Honduras, located in Tegucigalpa, and the other child studies at a private school and in her free time she accompanies her mother to sell products in the market. Ms. M. made it a goal to start her own business and after many years of working for someone else selling clothes in a store, thank God, she has been able to start her own business. Her biggest dream is for her kids to graduate from the university and to be able to be on their own and successful. She also dreams of her business growing, so that she can increase her income and have a better life. (Translated by Ashlee of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by Kendra Gaete, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, sandals, shirts, blouses, underwear, bras, skirts

loans.name: Eklou Kodjo

texts.fr: Monsieur A. eklou kodjo est un célibataire qui travaille dur pour subvenir à ses propres besoins, pour y arriver il a commencé par exercer depuis 2007 le commerce de portables et des accessoires de portables, il exerce son commerce dans une cabine  dans un quartier périphériques de Lomé appelé N’KAFU, il est le seul à exercer cette activité dans cette zone ce qui lui permet de réaliser beaucoup de recette, il s’approvisionne à DEKON où le commerce de portables est très animé. Son stock s’épuise, il demande donc à WAGES un crédit pour rehausser son stock.
texts.en:
Mr. Eklou Kodjo A. is single and works hard to provide for himself. To make ends meet he began a business in 2007 selling mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. He has a stall in a neighborhood on the outskirts of Lomé called N’Kafu. He is the only person running such a business in the area, which means sales are good. He gets his supplies from Dékon, which does a brisk business in mobile phones. As his inventory is running low, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to boost his stock.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and accessories

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 55 year old man who lives in the Bekaa with his wife and their seven children. Husein has been working as an agriculturalist and as a taxi driver since 1999. Husein requested a loan of 1,500 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work and do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Husein has requested a loan.

Husien is special because he is an active man who does his best to improve his family’s income. Husein decided on starting his businesses because he wants the best for his family as well as to answer his family’s need. In the future, he plans on improving his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work and do some maintenance work on his taxi

loans.name: Faapaia

texts.en: Faapaia P., 25, is married and has 3 children.  She has 4 years of experience in the furniture shop business. She sells to the village community & to the general public 3 days per week. She has had 6 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Samoan Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Faapaia’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase lumber, clear vanish , painting , plywood, nails and a hammer for furniture business.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery es madre de 2 pequeños a quienes trata de brindarles las mejores condiciones de vida, lo cual es más fácil junto a su esposo, quien es la persona que más apoyo le brinda desde que se casaron. A pesar de vivir en una casa alquilada, no pierden las esperanzas de terminar la construcción de su casa para pronto mudarse. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, negocio que aprendió a realizar desde soltera gracias a amistades quienes la motivaron a ser parte de las consultoras de belleza, ya que las ganancias son muy buenas, y si se distribuyen adecuadamente los productos se pueden aprovechar las ofertas de compras para luego venderlas a precio normal. Trabajar y dedicarse a su hogar era una tarea, que en un inicio, no podía realizar, pero con el tiempo fue acostumbrándose a sus diversos roles y gracias al apoyo de su pareja, las obligaciones han disminuido, pues ambos se turnan en cumplir sus deberes en casa. Ahora ambos tienen pensado abrir un bazar en su vivienda con la finalidad de mejorar su estado económico y brindarles a sus hijos lo necesario para sus estudios superiores. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP para Mery, y junto a sus compañeras de grupo aprendió a  asumir muchos retos y responsabilidades, pues todas son muy cumplidas y ordenadas en sus  pagos a la institución. Con los 2000 soles que solicita comprará más productos de belleza al por mayor para luego venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Mery is the mother of two young ones who she aims to provide with the best living conditions. This has become easier alongside her husband, who has provided her with constant support since they were married. Despite living in a rented house, they have not given up their dream of finishing the construction of and moving into their own home. For 6 years Mery has sold cosmetics, a business that she learned in her single days thanks to friends who encouraged her to become a beauty consultant due to its good income.
