If they sold enough products properly they could take advantage of purchasing offers to later resell the goods at normal price. Working and homemaking at once was a task that Mery couldn't initially accomplish, but over time she became accustomed to her different roles. Thanks to her husband's support her obligations have lessened since they take turns in finishing household chores. Both are currently thinking of opening a bazaar in their home with the goal of improving their financial status and providing their children with the necessary money for their college studies. This is Mery's eighth loan with MFP; alongside her loan group colleagues she learned to assume many challenges and responsibilities and all of them are very timely and orderly with their loan payments. With this 2000-sole loan she will buy more wholesale beauty products to sell at a higher price.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale merchandise to increase sales

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth has owned a small general store in the Kola neighborhood of Morogoro for six months. She belongs to the Waridi loan group (group code 2045/07). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $40. Every day she works at her business for 16 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more wheat flour, soap, rice, and other items to add her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Janeth is 32 years old, married, and has six children, ages 14, 12, 10, 8, and 6 years, and one just 6 months old. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, soap, rice, and other items.

loans.name: Blanca Obdulia

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92756&_tpos=6&_tpg=1
Blanca es socia del Bancomunal Mujeres Progresando.
Blanca empezó vendiendo abarrotes pero no había mucho movimiento y fracaso decidió vender  plátanos, ha ido creciendo hoy en día vende fruta de primera calidad. 
Blanca necesita 2400 soles, para la compra de frutas de la estación y golosinas.
Desde que está en Finca, gracias a los préstamos pudo invertir y salir de las deudas que tenia.  
El sueño de Blanca es surgir y avanzar hasta completar sus sueños, que sus hijos puedan estudiar.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=92756&_tpos=6&_tpg=1 Blanca is a member of the communal bank “Mujeres Progresando.” She started out selling groceries but wasn't selling much and went out of business. She then decided to sell plantains and is growing this business. Today she sells high quality fruit. Blanca needs a loan of 2,400 soles to buy fruits that are in season and sweets. Since Blanca has been with Finca, she has been able to invest and get out of debt. Her dream is to forge ahead and keep advancing until she reaches her all of her dreams and sees her children go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: compra de frutas de la estación y golosinas

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La señora Miriam vive  en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos en la calle Manuel Ergueta de la zona de san pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene un automóvil con el cual trabaja el esposo todos los días como transporte publico; con esta actividad  mantienen a su familia.

El crédito que solicita es para salud ya que Miriam se encuentra muy delicada , además cabe recalcar que por trabajar independiente no cuenta con seguro medico y los costos de consulta y medicamentos son muy caros.

El esposo, don Robin Gorostiaga, fue cliente de Impro y parte de Kiva y su historial de pagos fue muy bueno.
texts.en:
Miriam lives in her own house with her husband and children on Manuel Ergueta street in the San Pedro area of La Paz. She has an automobile that the husband uses every day to transport others like public transportation. This is how they support their family. The loan that she is requesting is for health reasons since Miriam has become weak. Also, since they work independently, they cannot count on medical insurance and the medical expenses are very high. The husband, Robin Gorostiaga, was a previous client of Impro, which is part of Kiva, and his history of loan repayments was very good.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses and medicine for Miriam

loans.name: Magreth

texts.en:
Magreth is a member of the Singokele borrower group in Kola, Morogoro. She is a 31-year-old woman, married, and the mother of 2 children. Her children are ages 13 and 10. She also cares for 1 other dependent.

Magreth started her own clothing business selling clothes 5 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 70,000 Tanzania schillings.

This is Magreth’s first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Magreth hopes to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua is 38 years old and is married with four children. She has two boys and two girls who are currently in school.

Akua is a trader who deals with assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. In addition, she has also attached the sale of used-clothing to her existing business and, since then, she has recorded lots of progress. 

Akua mostly sells through hawking: that is, house to house selling. She has been trading for seven years now. She has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her when she mounts a stand to trade. She treks to Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods.

Recently, Akua has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more supplies of the products she sells, like cooking utensils, used clothing, etc., which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers.

With the loan Akua believes she will be more resourced to make lots of profits which she could use to rent a store to reduce the frequent walking on the street to sell. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To increase her stock of inventory like cooking utensils and used-clothing

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Leyla del Socorro G. M. de 43 años de edad, trabaja en la elaboración y venta de pantalones de vestir (Estos son pantalones de tela suave), tanto para uniformes de colegio como para uniformes de trabajos entre otros.

En algunas ocasiones los clientes le proporcionan la tela, pero la mayor parte del tiempo ella la compra y la incluye en el costo de venta.

Es por esto que Leyla necesita un capital propio para poder dar abasto a sus clientes. Aspira poder llegar a poner una tienda de ropa que ella misma confeccione.

Leyla ha trabajado en grupos solidarios en ADIM y este es su primer ciclo grupal. Se siente muy orgulloso de haber ganado éste merito.

loans.use: Compra de telas para la elaboracion de pantalones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock up his store

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora P. is from Catadman, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old, married with one school-aged child. She is one of micro entrepreneur of PMPC who engaged in barbecue business. Her costumers are her neighbors and passers by. She has been in this business for 3 years and earns a net income of 3,000 PHP a month. 

In February 2006, she joined Paglaum to gain access in financial services and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. At her six cycles, she is now requesting a new loan amounting to 10,000.00 PHP which will be used to buy more ingredients and more meat needed for her business. She used the profit generated from the business to send her one child to school and finish her college degree.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more meat for her barbecue business

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 36 years old and married with three children. She sells sarongs of various colors and shapes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dembagnouman est composé de sept femmes dont une veuve et six  mariées dans des ménages polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans, 4 enfants et habitent dans le quartier Djaka (Kirango) de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage, d’amitié et de voisinage. Elles ont comme  activités génératrices de revenus l’achat vente du poisson et sa transformation. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire ses clients le groupe Dembagnouman a décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son 5ème  prêt solidaire après avoir bien remboursé les quatre prêts précédents.
Ce nouveau prêt  sera utilisé pour acheter, 72 paniers de poisson frais et 100 barres  de glace (fournies par les transporteurs venant de Bamako). Elles s’approvisionnent  en poissons sur place au bord du fleuve Niger dont une bonne partie est séchée soit sur du gravier, ou sur de la paille ou sur des « seccos ». Le poisson frais est vendu sur place à Kirango et à Diamarabougou Markala ou  conservé dans de la glace pour être vendu à Ségou (au marché château) et à Bamako. Le poisson séché est conservé en partie jusqu’à la décrue et à l’hivernage où elles gagnent plus d’argent et le reste est vendu à Dougabougou, Siribala, N., Shango, Boussin et à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou. Le poisson fumé est essentiellement vendu à Ségou. Les  ventes se font généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
 Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice  moyen mensuel de 75.500 FCFA qui servira à satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux et à participer aux évènements sociaux (baptême, mariage et décès). 
Leur ambition est  d’acheter des animaux afin de construire dans l’avenir pour  leurs enfants car une maison paternelle appartient à tous et n’est propriété de personne.
texts.en:
The seven members of Dembagnouman Group (one widowed and six married women), on average, are 40 years old and have four children. They live in polygamous families in the neighborhood of Djaka (Kirango) in Markala, fourth administrative region of Mali. The group members know each other through links of family, marriage, friendship and neighborhood. They make a living from buying, processing and selling fish. Eager to better serve its customers, the Dembagnouman Group has decided to join the credit program offered by SoroYiriwaso. This is the Group's fifth solidarity loan, after having repaid the previous four loans on schedule.

This new loan will be used to buy 72 baskets of fresh fish and 100 ice bars, provided by carriers coming from Bamako. They get their fish supply on the banks of River Niger, then they dry part of it on gravel, on straw or on "seccos". The fresh fish will be sold on location in Kirango and in Diamarabougou Markala, or kept refrigerated in ice and sold at the Castle Market in Ségou and in Bamako. The dried fish will partly be stockpiled until the water level of the river drops in winter and they can sell it at a higher price, and partly be sold in Dougabougou, Siribala, N., Shango and Boussin, as well as at the weekly market in Ségou. They also sell smoked fish, mainly in Ségou. Most of their sales are for cash to a clientele made up of women and men.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 75,500 CFA francs which they will spend on small household expenses and use to take part in social events (baptisms, weddings and funerals). Their ambition is to buy livestock so as to build houses for their children in future, because their father's house belongs to them all and nobody has the ownership of it.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Rotsie

texts.en:
Rotsie C. lives in the village of Balulang, Cagayan De Oro City. Rotsie is 25 years old, married, and has 2 small children. Rotsie owns & operates a business selling vegetables among other things which she has been doing for the past three years. She earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rotsie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rotsie is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Rotsie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Business Expansion

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Benkola Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkola sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 41 ans et 2 enfants. Avec leur mari et enfants elles vivent  dans des grandes familles traditionnelles et  résident dans le quartier de Fana coura, de la ville de Fana, sous préfecture de Fana Région de KOULIKORO, République du Mali. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de parentés. Elles exercent le commerce d’articles divers depuis maintenant  quelques années.  
Ces femmes collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pérenniser leurs activités lucratives.  Elles sont à leur onzième prêt de groupe et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce prêt elles comptent acheter, des fruits et légumes et une grande quantité d’habillements et de chaussures. Les fruits et légumes sont achetés en gros avec les transporteurs venant de Lomé en partance pour Bamako et quant aux habillements, ils sont achetés à Bamako (capitale du Mali). 
Tous les produits sont  revendus sur place au marché de Fana à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.  
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice moyen de 40 000F CFA par mois. Les bénéfices sont d’une part réinvestis dans l’activité et d’autre part dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkola group are married women with an average age of 41 and on average 2 children. They live with their husband and children in large traditional families and reside in the neighborhood of Fana Coura, in the town of Fana, sub-prefecture of Fana, Region of Koulikoro, Republic of Mali.

They know each other through their neighborhood and kinship. For the last few years they have been selling various items.

These women work in collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to continue their moneymaking activity. This is their eleventh group loan; all the previous loans have been fully reimbursed.

With this loan they wish to buy fruits and vegetables and a large quantity of clothing and socks. The fruits and vegetables are bought wholesale from the fret carriers coming from Lomé and leaving for Bamako. The clothing is bought in Bamako, the capital of Mali.

All the items are sold on the market place in Fana to customers made up of women and men.

They are planning for each one to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA. The profits are in part reinvested in the activity and the other part goes to the family’s daily expenses.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various articles

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en: Mazen is a 35-year-old single man. He has been working as a tailor since 2002 and has 15 years of experience in this field. Today, Mazen is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy an additional sewing machine to be able to make more products because his business has developed remarkably and he needs to meet the requirements of his clients and to make a good income.

loans.use: To buy an additional sewing machine

loans.name: Metabel

texts.en: Metabel A. O. is thirty-nine years old, married, and has a four-year-old child. Her husband is a driver and they hope to purchase a Nissan matatu (minibus) some day. Her business is located at Aga Khan, an open air market in Kisumu, where she sells second-hand shoes. She has been doing this for the last three years and the major challenge has been so many people engaging in this kind of business and weather problems making it hard for her stock to move as fast as she would like. She is using her loan to add stock and she sees herself opening a boutique in future. She is tolerant, hardworking, creative and ambitious.

loans.use: Buying second-hand shoes

loans.name: Mailyn

texts.en:
Mailyn D. L. P. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Mailyn is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Mailyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. Her main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting cassava to sell. Mailyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $38 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mailyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Mailyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Build one room of family home

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony S. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and cooking oil in the market and is requesting a loan to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell. Anthony is 40 years old and married to a doctor. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Buy more jerrycans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeurn K. is a tailor who owns her own sewing machines. She is fifty-four and a widow with six children. Five of them are students who help with her business when they are not studying, and the other one is married and lives independently. To help with the family's daily expenses, Soeurn's oldest child is employed as a boat driver for tourists.

In order to make her business ever more successful, Soeurn will be using her loan to purchase more sewing supplies. Any remaining money from the loan will be used to decorate her house.

loans.use: To purchase more material for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Kalsoom Akhtar's Group

texts.en:
Razia and Safia each want a loan to buy seasonal fruit for their fruit-selling business. Riaz wants a loan to buy wheat for her wheat-selling business. 

Kalsoom akhtar is a 38-year-old woman. She has a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 25 years. She is the group leader of the afore-mentioned ladies. They all live in a city called Lahore, famous in Pakistan for its historical places and its Punjabi foods. 

Her husband's name is M. N. and he has a shoe-selling business. He sells specifically men's shoes in the market. He has been in this business for the past 15 years. Kalsoom has given birth to nine children: seven sons and two daughters. Her eldest son is eighteen years old and runs a cosmetics-selling business. The others are enrolled in school and are getting an education.

As you can see, they have a big family to care for so Kalsoom also offers her services as a seamstress. She sews clothes for her neighbors and earns income. She has been in this profession for the past 10 years. Her neighbors give her orders because of her good stitching. She is applying for a loan to buy cosmetics to expand her son’s cosmetics-selling business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Joel

texts.es: Joel tiene 30 años, es un hombre perseverante que no le teme a las adversidades, sólo ve hacía adelante. Está casado con Elizabeth de 28 años y ambos tienen 3 hijos, quienes viven juntos en su casa propia. Es así que la necesidad de brindarle comodidades a su familia, hacen que Joel, en compañía de  su esposa, se dedique a la siembra de papa, arveja y gladiolos sobre sus terrenos propios, además el tener un puesto en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, en donde vende toda su producción desde hace 7 años, le genera ingresos adicionales. De manera particular, le gusta sacar leche de las vacas, propiedad de sus padres, que lo realiza con el fin de ayudarles en la venta de quesos. Estos oficios, le permiten cubrir las necesidades de sus seres queridos, e incluso adquirir bienes como un terreno de dos hectáreas que compró recientemente, en donde piensa sembrar gladiolos. Por lo que espera las ganancias, producto de su cosecha para  comprarse una casa en la ciudad e instalar su tienda de comestibles, además de situar la producción de verduras en su actual puesto. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, y manifiesta que continuará trabajando en su grupo  comunal con el mismo empeño como cuando empezó en el primer día. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 8 sacos de fertilizantes, dos bolsas de arveja y 5 botellas de insecticidas.
texts.en:
Joel is 30 years old, and a persevering man who is not afraid of adversity - he only looks forward. He is married to 28 year old Elizabeth, and they have 3 children. They all live together in their own house. The need to offer their family good living conditions motivates Joel and his wife to work hard at growing potatoes, peas, and gladioli on their own land. Joel also has a stall in the major city market where he has been selling his products for 7 years, which earns him additional income. He also takes milk from his parents cows in order to help them with selling cheese. These trades allow him to provide all the basics that his loved ones need, and even to recently purchase two hectares of land where he is thinking of growing gladioli. He hopes that the income from his harvest will enable him to buy a house in the city and set-up a store, as well as having his vegetables at his current market stall. This is his fifth loan with MFP, and he states that he will continue to work with this community group with the same commitment as he had when he began. With the loan that he is requesting, he will buy 8 sacks of fertilizer, two bags of peas, and 5 bottles of insecticide.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed peas, fertilizer, and insecticide.

loans.name: Mrs. Sok Yoeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Y. is a village bank president who has been selected by the other members of the group loan; they live in Thmey village in Kandal province. The eleven members will all use their portion of the loan for different purposes.

Mrs. Sok Y. sells coffee in her village to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Sok Y. decided to apply for a loan to buy more coffee. She is a widow so she is supporting two children by herself: one is enrolled in a local school, the other is only five years old.

loans.use: To buy more coffee

loans.name: Kam

texts.en: Mrs. Kam S. is a villager in Kantuot Thum Village in Takeo Province. She is 36 years old. She and her husband, Mr. Hen Nget, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they grow rice to support their family. They try to work hard, but they earn less income because they have a career. So, to improve their family's living conditions, Mrs. Kam S. is asking for a loan to buy a cart and a horse to start a new business. She has four children. Three of the children are enrolled in the local public school. The youngest one is only one year old. Her husband appears in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a cart and a horse for a horse driver

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua O. O., 32, is married but has no children yet.  His thriving tailoring business, called the Nyaimbo Shop, makes clothes for women and  is located near a residential area known as Manyatta in Kisumu,  In business for two years now, Joshua says his only major challenge is the distance he has to walk to get the materials needed for making the clothing. He will be using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy an additional sewing machine and a table so as to grow his business. Hardworking and polite, Joshua hopes to expand his business and provide employment to the local people. He also hopes to acquire rental houses to add to his income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and table.

loans.name: Sorn's Group

texts.en:
Fifteen people who live in Toul Doun Kam village in Kandal province selected Mrs. Sorn C. as the village bank president. Each member will use their portion of the loan for different purposes that improve their standard of living.

Mrs. Sorn C. is 40 years old and is a pig breeder while her husband, Mr. Srorng Noun, is an ice cream seller. With both these businesses they are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to help her pig business Mrs. Sorn C. is asking for a loan to buy piglets and pig food for breeding.

The couple has five children; four attend the local school and the youngest is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es:
La ciudad de Rayanniyoc se encuentra media hora de la ciudad del Cusco y a una hora de la ciudad del Urubamba. Los pobladores de la ciudad de Rayanniyoc se dedican a la agricultura y a la ganadería. 

La señora Paula tiene 54 años y es soltera. 

Su actividad económica principal vender verduras en los mercados de Casparo y Vino Canchón y su actividad económica complementaria es confeccionar chompas, chalinas, guantes, frazadas y bolsas 

Paula pertenece al banco comunal “Villa Rayanniyoc” de la Asociación Arariwa. Ya son varios años que participa en el banco comunal y le va muy bien porque es una persona responsable y puntual con sus pagos. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar más semillas, abono, cereales y lana de alpaca.  

Paula se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The town of Rayanniyoc is located half an hour from Cusco and an hour from Urubamba. The population of Rayanniyoc earn their living through farming and cattle rearing. Paul is 54 years old and single. Most of her income comes from selling vegetables at markets in Casparo and Vino Canchón, and she supplements this income by making jumpers, scarves, gloves, blankets and bags. Paula belongs to the “Villa Rayanniyoc” communal bank, a part of the Arariwa Association. She has been involved in the communal bank for several years and it is going very well because she is a responsible person who makes her payments on time. She requires the loan to buy more seeds, fertiliser, cereals and alpaca wool. Paula is very grateful for the opportunity offered in this way and is committed to repaying the loan within the required timescale.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more seeds, fertiliser, cereals and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en: Kem S., 35, grows rice and lives in Takeo province. She is married with two young children, who are still living at home, and her husband is a recycler. She typically makes about USD 1 each day and would like a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a new business. In order to increase her family profits, she is asking for USD 500 to purchase a moto-taxi for her husband.

loans.use: To purchase a moto-taxi.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino A. is from the village of Manticao, Misamis Oriental. He is 52 years old. Faustino is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Faustino owns & operates a mini-restaurant serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Faustino has been engaged in his business for years and earns approximately 10,0000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Faustino joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Faustino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant. Faustino is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Faustino from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Melia Teresa

texts.es:
Melia es una mujer, con mucho deseo de superación, es por eso trabaja con mucho entusiasmo, ha formado su pequeño negocio la venta de nacatamales y venta de tortillas siendo ya ochos años en su negocio. En donde ha crecido y logrado las mejoras de su casa.
Que ha venido construyendo con préstamos que la institución ha financiado.
Para ella ha sido difícil, pero no imposible con la ayuda de su esposo que es albañil lo han logrado ya que no gastan en mano de obra.
Con este préstamo seguirá en la terminación de su casa que ha sido el objetivo como madre de familia para dar un techo digno a sus hijos.
Lo que a través de Afodenic ha sido más fácil por el apoyo en su construcción. Lo que esta contenta.
texts.en:
Melia is a woman who has the drive to succeed, which is why she works with great enthusiasm. Eight years ago, she started a business selling Nicaraguan tamales and tortillas. As a result of the growth of her business, she was able to make improvements to her home. She was able to pursue construction projects with the help of loans from AFODENIC. The projects have been difficult if not impossible. However, since her husband works as a stonemason, she does not have to pay for labor.

With this loan, she plans to finish the construction so that she can provide her children with a decent home. Melia is pleased because the support provided by AFODENIC has made the construction process a little bit easier.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to finish the construction of her house

loans.name: Uong's Group

texts.en: Four members make up this group loan, and they live in Damnak village in Takeo province. Mr. Uong S. is the group leader, was born in 1943, and was selected by the other members who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. He is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family, and he is also a healer. Since his businesses are doing well, he wants to expand. So, to improve those businesses, Mr. Uong S. is applying for a loan to buy more medicine and also to buy fertilizer. He is a widower with two children, one of whom is a security guard, and the other is a farmer.

loans.use: To buy more medicine.

loans.name: Zakhir

texts.ru:
Zakhir M. 32 qoda. On ne jenat. On imeyet 2 sester kotoriye mladshe neqo poetomu on rabotaya pomoqayet semye.
Uje 8 let kak Zakir zanimayetsya etim biznessom rimonta i stroitelstva damov. Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca kotoriy s molodix let toje rabotal masterom no seychas on uje boleyet i ne v silax rabotat.

Zakir seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit instrumenti dlya razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Zakhir M. is 32 years old and single. He has two younger sisters, and therefore he works to help his family. Zakhir has been working in is construction and renovation business for eight years. He started this business with his father, who also worked in construction from a young age. However, now his father is ill and no longer has the strength to work. Zakhir Now needs 2000 AZN to buy tools to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying tools

loans.name: Tuleujan

texts.en:
Tuleujan A. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in Bayan-Ulgiy Province in western Mongolia. His wife is currently unemployed and stays home watching their youngest daughter, while the other two children attend a local primary school.

In his town, Tuleujan currently operates a transportation business which he began in 1995 by transporting and delivering a variety of loads using his own truck. During the summer months, he uses his small car as a taxi, transporting people between two sub provinces, while in winter months he transports and sells firewood and coal in the local market. As well, Tuleujan transports loads between Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city and Tashkent, a city in China. Over the years, he has built a stable and successful operation and gained much experience as a driver. His truck can carry up to 13 tons of coal at one time, earning him a net profit of between 5000 and 1000 MNT per ton of coal. His profits have enabled him to build a new house with three rooms.

A very honest and hardworking man, Tuleujan says, "I want to save money for my children's future education." He is now requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to repair the small car he uses as a taxi and to purchase more coal from the countryside and four new wheels for his vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase more coal

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda T. is from the village of San Jose. She is 33 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Criselda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. Criselda has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per cropping.
In 2007, Criselda joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Criselda is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be her tenth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Paulo

texts.pt:
Paulo B. nasceu em Chamanculo um dos bairros periféricos da cidade capital na década 70, pai de 2 filhos, um deles vai a escola. Fez 10ª classe e não continuou devido as dificuldades financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família.

Nunca mudou de cidade, actualmente trabalha no Ministério da defesa como Musico instrumentista e tem um rendimento mensal fixo que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta bancária.

Foi através do seu serviço que soube da existência da Hluvuku e Ja solicitou 4 empréstimos aplicados na compra do terreno e materiais de construção para construir a sua moradia, o que melhorou a sua vida pelo que terá a sua própria casa onde vivera condignamente com a sua família.

Com o actual empréstimo e primeiro no Kiva no valor de 11.000.00mt pretende comprar materiais de construção (cimento, portas e areia) para continuar com a obra da sua casa.

O seu sonho futuro e de concluir a sua obra mobilar a sua casa e viver condignamente com a sua família e para tal, vai recorrer a mais empréstimos da Hluvuku/Kiva.
texts.en:
Paulo B. was born in Chamanculo in the perifery of Maputo, in the 1970s. He is the father of two children, one of whom is in school. His studies were interrupted in the 10th Grade due to financial difficulties. He lives with his family in a house they own.

He currently works as an instrumentalist musician for the Defense Ministry, a job that provides a regular income that he uses to pay for household expenses and save some money in the bank.

Paulo heard about Hluvuku at work. His four previous loans were used to buy the land for his house and construction material to start building it. He will use this current loan (the first one with Kiva), to buy construction material (cement, doors and sand) to continue building his house. These loans allow him to work toward providing better living conditions for his family.

He plans to apply for more Hluvuku/Kiva loans in the future, to finish building and to furnish his home, so that he and his family can live with dignity.

loans.use: to buy construction material (cement, sand, doors)

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

She has operated a retail shop for over three years, selling to her neighbors and people who pass by her store. A major challenge Mwanasiti faces is the seasonality of her business. She hopes to sell wholesale products in the future. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase two sacks of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and washing soaps. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and washing soaps.

loans.name: Au

texts.en: Mrs. Au N., 32, is a single mother living in the province of Kompong Tom. Mrs. Au N. makes her living by selling fish at the busy local market, and earns an average profit of $3.80 per day. She sells fish that she buys from her wholesale supplier and other fisherman. Mrs. Au N. is a humble mother who has three children. Two of them are single and the other one is married. All of her children are working in different careers, and they always share their income with their mother in order to support the family’s expenses. Mrs. Au N. would like a loan in order to purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business. She will rent out this land to farmers for a fee.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land in good condition for a farming business

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz de 39 años de edad es casada, tiene 2 hijos, ambos estudiando la secundaria y primaria, labora para el MINED en la Escuela 17 de Julio desempeñandose como docente, con 16 años de servicio. 

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito con el objetivo de hacer las divisiones de los cuartos de sus hijos, repellando y embaldosandolo, pues ambos desean tener su propio espacio,  y de esta manera tratar de brindar mejores condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is 39 years old, married, and has two children who are in primary and secondary school.  She works for the Ministry of Education in the 17th of July school.  She has been a teacher for 16 years.

She is asking for her 8th loan in order to build a wall in her children's room with plaster and tiles.  They both want to have their own space, and she can try to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Build a dividing wall in her children's room

loans.name: Gladis Narcisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Gladis Narcisa; ella tiene 44 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza y también vende productos naturales,ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes lugares como instituciones y al publico en general,la socia quiere tener una tienda para que pueda vender los productos de belleza y productos naturales . La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza y productos naturales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Gladis Narcisa. She is 44, married and has 5 children. She alternates her daily activities with her beauty products sales business, and she also sells natural products. She sells independently, bringing her products to various locations such as businesses, and to the general public. She wants to have a store to sell her beauty products and natural products. She is requesting this loan to purchase beauty products and natural products. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan to purchase beauty products and natural products.

loans.name: C6222 Dususuruke Group

texts.en:
Theopiste is 30 years old and is married with two children who are between the ages of 3 and 6 years old. She also takes care of two dependents from her family.

Her business is to sell a variety of clothes; her business is famous as well as organized. She describes herself as a hardworking woman in her daily activities. Her business is open from 6am until 5pm every day except Saturday.

Theopiste has now requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of growing her business through purchasing more bales of clothes. This purchase will allow her to serve more customers from the community which will help her to earn more money.

The profits she expects to earn will be one of the ways she will develop her business and will provide all the basic needs of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is a married woman who lives in Hinigaran in the province of Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a carinderia (a small eatery) and a pig fattening business. Her husband Benito S., age 63, works as a laborer to earn his living. They have three children who are 18 to 27 years old.

Nora joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past twenty loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Nora has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 23,000 PHP helped her to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 PHP, thus uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her twenty-first loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use to purchase raw materials. She plans to continue to save up for the future and for her children's education. Nora is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than 1 USD a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married and has a grown daughter. Mariya is a market entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk. She sells women’s footwear in the central marketplace of her home town. Mariya offers a nice selection of merchandise at affordable prices. She has been working in this sphere of trade for 12 years. Her monthly income amounts to 6,000 Grivnyas. 

Mariya’s business is the main source of income for her family. This time she is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas. She is planning to use the loan to purchase assorted spring merchandise, e.g. 80 pairs of spring shoes. One of Mariya’s personal goals is to remodel her newly purchased apartment to be able to move in it. She is hoping to be able to save up and make that happen as soon as possible.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal merchandise to sell

loans.name: Donald Enrique

texts.es:
El Sr. Donald de 26 años de edad, vive con su esposa quien se dedica a los queahceres del hogar y al cuido de una niña de un añito de edad que tienen en conjunto, es una familia muy unidad; Donald es medico General, atiende actualmente en un Centro de salud ubicado en Mazapa, Tecolostote, es una persona responsable y muy dedicado.   

Solicita su primer credito con el apoyo de Kiva para terminar de construir su casa de habitacion, pues pretende ponerle techo y piso que aun le falta.  

Su sueño es poder ver realizada su Vivienda, darles un techo digno a su familia y mantenerse siempre en union Familiar.
texts.en:
Mr. Donald is 26 years old and lives with is wife who is a homemaker and takes care of their one-year old daughter.  They are a very close family.  Donald is a general doctor and practices in a health center in Mazapa, Tecolostote.  He is a responsible, dedicated person.

He is requesting his first loan with Kiva's support to finish building his house.  He plans to add roofing and flooring which it still does not have.

His dream is to see his house finished in order to provide a dignified home for his family so they can always stay together.

loans.use: To add roofing and flooring to his house

loans.name: Hector Rosendo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr: Hector; El socio tiene 48 años de edad, el socio  es Casado; el socio tiene 2 hijos de 20 y 18 años de edad; el socio es docente de profesión, el socio trabaja en el colegio La Merced de Cusco y en la Universidad Nacional del Cusco; el socio enseña las carreras de lingüística y comunicación; el socio se encuentra actualmente estudiando un post grado,  el socio desea el crédito para pagar los estudios de sus hijos, el socio y su esposa pertenecen al mismo grupo de Choquequirao, el socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en los estudios de sus hijos.

El socio se encuentra satisfecho con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hector is a member of the community lender “CHOQUEQUIRAO”; an agency located in Huanchac, Cusco.

Hector is 48, married and has two children aged 20 and 18.  He is a teacher, working in the La Merced School of Cusco and in the National University campus in Cusco, where he teaches linguistics and communications.  Hector is currently completing his post graduate degree, and requests a loan in order to pay for his children's studies.  Both he and his wife are members of the Choquequirao communal lending group.  Hector is very pleased to be granted a loan and is committed to prompt repayment of the funds according to the established timeframe.

loans.use: To cover educational expenses for children

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence U. is from the village of Kilon-ac, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Florence is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies, like banana and sweet potato (or camote) cues, in the local community. She also sells snack foods. Florence has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Florence joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Florence is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients like sweet bananas, sugars and barbecue sticks. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like sweet bananas, sugars and barbecue sticks

loans.name: Winda

texts.en:
Winda is 33 years old and is married with 1 child.  She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 24,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stock such as canned goods and noodles.

Winda has previously borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF. She has been running the sari-sari store for 10 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Winda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for a sari-sari store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her dressmaking business

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Анакулова Зулфия жительница Вахдатского района. Ей 29 лет. Она замужем. У нее среднее образование. Она занимается торговлей на рынке. В основном она продает женскую и мужскую одежду. Этим видом деятельности занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для покупки женского и мужского нижнего белья.
texts.en: Zulfiya A. lives in Vahdat. She is 29 years old and married. She has a secondary education. She works trading in the market. Primarily she sells women’s and men's wear. She has been doing this work for two years.  She is taking out a loan to buy women’s and men's underwear.

loans.use: to buy women’s and men's underwear

loans.name: Marcos Ramiro

texts.es:
Marcos Ramiro tiene 52 años, es casado vive  con la esposa y con los hijos  en  el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar tiene uno  hijo de 16 años.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  COOPERATIVA Patrón San Miguel se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Pailaloma a 60 minutos de la oficina pertenece al Cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla de 13 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas de cultivos de maíz, papas y trigo.

Marcos se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, papas y trigo, los productos los compra en  Chillanes y en San Pablo cada fin de mes y los vende en la feria de los domingos en Chillanes.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos para los cultivos además de fertilizantes y abonos.  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades y aumentar la producción. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es educar al hijo y comprar terrenos.

Le gusta hacer deporte y festejar el carnaval.
texts.en:
Marcos Ramiro is 52 years old, married, and lives with his wife and child in the canton of Chillanes in Bolivar Province. He has a 16-year-old son.

The members of the Communal Bank “Cooperativa Patrón San Miguel” (St. Michael’s Cooperative) meet in the neighborhood of Pailaloma, which is located 60 minutes away from the Cooperativa San Jose office in the canton of Chillanes. This Communal Bank has 13 members who engage in farm activities that involve growing corn, potatoes, and wheat.

Marcos is a farmer who grows corn, potatoes, and wheat. His supplies are purchased in Chillanes and San Pablo at the end of each month. He sells his goods at the fair every Sunday in Chillanes.

Marcos is requesting a loan to buy supplies for his crops, such as fertilizers and compost. The support from this loan will help him financially to access what he needs to increase production. Among the challenges he faces are pests, diseases, and changes in weather. His dreams are to provide his son with an education and to buy more land.

He enjoys playing sports and celebrating the Carnival festivities.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and compost.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.es:
Adriano tiene 59 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijos en casa propia, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande - Piura.  La actividad que desarrollan es la agricultura, ganadería y artesanía.

Adriano desde hace algunos años se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado vacuno, su corral se encuentra en la parte externa de su casa, los alimenta con comida balanceada y pastos naturales para que tengan una buena producción de leche, la que ofrece a los mismos pobladores de la zona o la vende en el mercado de Tambogrande. Cuenta con clientela fija por la buena calidad de leche que comercializa, con sus ingresos solventa las obligaciones familiares.  

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más alimentos balanceados para que se incremente la producción de leche de su ganado y así podrá ofrecerla a un mejor precio para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 

Adriano es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable cuyo único deseo es que su negocio crezca para que sus hijos tengan mejores oportunidades de estudio.
texts.en:
Adriano, 59, and his wife and children live in a house they own in Tambogrande-Piura.  The local people make their living farming, raising livestock and making and selling handicrafts.

Adriano has operated a livestock business for many years, raising and selling cattle.  He keeps the cattle in a corral behind his house.  The cattle eat a balanced diet, including grass, something that contributes to the quality of the milk they produce.  He sells the milk locally and at the market in Tambogrande.  He has a regular set of customers who value the quality of the milk he sells.  The income from the business goes to supporting his family.

Adriano is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new soles loan that he will use to buy cattle feed, a supply of which he needs to ensure increased milk production.  The extra income will help him to improve the lives of his family.  

Adriano is a responsible, hard-working man whose only wish is to grow his busienss so that he can ensure that his children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock business.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en: Sambo, 52 years old, is a farmer. Her husband is a goldsmith. Their income is $3 per day. They have 4 children, 28, 25, 20, and 18 years old. Three of their children are soldiers. Every month, Sambo has to spend $50 on food, $5 on electricity, $5 on, $20 on transportation, and $20 on other expenses. She would like to request a loan of $600 to buy a hand tractor for plowing the other farmer’s farmland to earn some more income. When she can save some money, she wants to build a place to feed the chickens at home. She also wants send her children to school to get a specific skill so that they able to support themselves.

loans.use: To buy a hand tractor

loans.name: Bendicta

texts.es: La señora Benedicta es empleada domestica y trabaja con una familia en la zona de Achumani de la ciudad de La Paz. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de material de construcción ya que realizara el acabado en obra fina de las gradas de su vivienda. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona 16 de febrero de la ciudad de El Alto, es madre soltera y está a cargo de sus cuatro hijos. Para solventar sus gastos, ella ha alquilado un cuarto de su casa a una persona y recibe un ingreso mensual extra por dicho concepto.
texts.en:
Benedicta is a domestic employee who works for a family in Achumani district, in the city of La Paz.  She needs a loan to buy building supplies in order to finish off some work to her house steps. 

Benedicta lives in her own home, which is located in 16 de Febrero district, in the city of El Alto.  She is a single mother and has four children in her care.  In order to cover her expenses, she rents out a room in her home to a tenant and receives additional monthly income this way.

loans.use: to buy building supplies so that she can finish off some work to her house steps

loans.name: Makvala

texts.en:
Makvala lives in village Akhalsopeli, East Georgia. She is 52 years old. Makvala is married and lives with her husband, Nikoloz. 

Makvala works as a chief cook at the local kindergarten. Along with her main job, she is actively involved in her family's agricultural business. They have three milk cows and get approximately 30 liters of milk per day. Part of the milk is used for yogurt production. Makvala sells yogurt and milk in Tbilisi grocery stores. The family also owns a plot of land where maize is grown. Almost all harvested corn is used in the dairy farm for feeding the cows. 

Makvala has requested credit for purchase of fertilizers for the cornfield. After fertilizing, the family expects a better harvest; part of the harvest will be sold at the local market, increasing the total income of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her cornfield

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is married with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Gina is 44 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a food business in the Philippines. Gina has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Gina has been in this business for one year. In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Bendicion De Dios Group

texts.es: La señora Juana tiene 41 años, pertenece al banco comunal Bendición De Dios Ella es una mujer trabajadora y muy activa ella tiene su negocio que es la venta de recargas, desde hace 21 años dice que emprendió ese negocio para estar más al pendiente de sus hijos. Ella está pidiendo un crédito para comprar recargas y aumentar la demanda de sus clientes. A pesar de las dificultades que atraviesa como es que le amputaron una pierna ha sabido sobresalir con esta dificultad. Los otros nueve integrantes se llaman Maria Petrona, Maria Isolina, Ana Francisca, Abrahan, Maura Del Socorro, Anita Magali Geronima Nicolasa ellos invertirán su crédito que les están otorgando en diferentes negocios.
texts.en:
Sra. Juana is 41 years old and a member of the Communal Bank “Bendición de Dios” (Blessing of God). She is an active and hardworking woman who has a business selling rechargeable phone credits. Juana says that she started this business 21 years ago because she was more aware of the needs of her children. She is requesting a loan to buy rechargeable credits because of the increased demand from her customers. Juana has been able to succeed despite the difficulties she has faced, including the amputation of a leg.

The other members are Maria Petrona, Maria Isolina, Ana Francisca, Abrahan, Maura Del Socorro, Anita Magali, and Geronima Nicolasa. They will invest their loans in different businesses.

loans.use: to buy rechargeable phone credits.

loans.name: Koy

texts.en:
Koy is 46 years old. He is a married man living in Kompong Speu Province, Cambodia. Presently, he is a farmer. He has generated income from his farming business for many years with his wife. He grows rice crops in the land his grandparents own. From this business, he earns about $2 each day. He and his wife have four children. To assist his income, three children of his are working hard as garment and sewing factory workers in Phnom Penh city, where they earn a suitable salary per month. His other children are in school. 

Due to the rainy season and the lack of capital, he is requesting a loan in order to grow his farming business. He will use this loan to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials for supporting his farming business. He hopes that this loan will create more income in his family to widen their house. And on the other hand, he will send his children to study at a high level, as others.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products like shoes, clothes, trousers, and caps in bulk.

loans.name: 9 De Septiembre (Santa Ana) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal 9 De Septiembre.

Este es un grupo de personas que decidieron unirse y formar este Grupo De Crédito, que les va a servir  de mucho ya que con los créditos ellos van mejorar sus pequeños negocios, se dedican a diversas actividades tales como comercio en general,   servicios entre otras actividades.

Aquí conocimos a Diana tiene 26 años  de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella estudia Gestión Empresarial en la Universidad Estatal Del Sur en Manabí.
 
Nuestra amiga es una chica muy inteligente y trabajadora que a mas de dedicarse a sus  estudios también se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, bisutería y productos de temporada, ella siempre busca la forma de ganarse el sustento diario para ayudarse en sus estudios, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en la universidad a sus compañeras, trabaja todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene un año que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido  muy bien, nos cuenta que esta es la base para seguir sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la rapidez con que le dieron el crédito. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the Santa Ana area, which is well-known for its lovely countryside and the beautiful freshwater spas which are much visited by tourists, the "9 de Septiembre" Communal Bank meets every two weeks.

This is a group of women who decided to join together and form this Credit Group, which has been of great use to them as they have been able to improve their small businesses with the loans.  They earn their livings in various ways, such as general retail and services among other things.

Here we met Diana, aged 26.  She is single, and lives with her parents.  She is studying Business Management at the Universidad Estatal Del Sur in Manabí.

Our friend is a very intelligent and hard-working girl, who in addition to focusing on her studies, also works selling clothes, shoes, costume jewelry and seasonal products.  She is always looking for ways to earn money on a daily basis to help with her studies.  She sells door-to-door, and also sells to her friends at the University.  She works everyday, and provides credit to her customers which she collects on every two weeks.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil whenever she needs it.  She has been doing this work for a year now, and it has been going very well for her.  She tells us that this is the foundation for her to be able to continue with her studies.

This loan will be used to purchase more merchandise, such as trousers, blouses, T-shirts, and children's clothing.  This is her first lending cycle with the Communal Bank, and she likes the Bank for the speed with which they are able to give loans.

Her dreams are to finish her studies, and to become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 43 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her 3 children. Gloria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store. Gloria has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soft-drinks and other groceries. 

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store.

loans.name: Roth

texts.en:
Roth (in the photo) and his wife, Sreybourch, have been married for more than ten years and have two children who are in school--one son and one daughter. They live in a village outside Phnom Penh. 

Roth is a rice farmer and he also was hired by a relative to sell groceries when he is not at the farm. His wife is a garment worker.  He is asking for another loan of $400 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain his rice farm.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa is the optimistic and thrifty 36-year-old mother of two school-age children. Despite the many problems and difficulties she has encountered in life, she is determined to improve her family's life. For the last 15 years, she has earned a living as a farmer, planting and harvesting corn and vegetables. She hopes to have a good harvest in the coming year, and is applying for a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm.

loans.name: El Buen Samaritano 3, 4 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Benita is one of the members of the “El Buen Samaritano 3, 4 & 5” (The Good Samaritan). They are micro entrepreneurs who sell clothing, assorted merchandise, shoes, crafts, etc. They sell mainly in a community located in the north of Santo Domingo; this is the area where the poorest community and neighborhood in the city of Santo Domingo are located.

Benita makes her home in a simple structure with her long term partner and their two children. She tells us that her most favorite things to do are to work and study.

Benita has been working in her beauty salon for about six years, which she started after working in one and learning all the techniques. She saved enough money to buy some tools like a hairdryer, brushes, and hair products. Now her little business is set with more tools and clients. She is ready to receive her second loan with Esperanza Internacional, after successfully paying back her previous one. She will use this new loan to invest by purchasing hair and cosmetic products. 

Benita will use the profits to save. Her future plans are to have her business in a local area, to have her own house, and to educate her children. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es: Gloria Isabel tiene 41 años, su actividad es la venta de mercadería en general. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora sus ganas de salir adelante le han ayuda con este negocio. Ella inicio por la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar. El motivo del crédito que realiza es para la compra de calzados, perfumes, cremas, tratamientos, ropa interior, reloj y sabanas. Sueña con poder seguir adelante con este medio de vida.
texts.en: Gloria Isabel is 41 years old.  She sells general merchandise. She is a very enterprising person and her desire to get ahead has helped her with this business. She started it because she needed to meet her household expenses. The purpose of this loan is to buy footwear, perfume, creams, treatments, underwear, watches and sheets.

loans.use: to buy footwear, perfrume, creams, treatments, underwear, watches and bedsheets.

loans.name: Valentín

texts.es:
El señor Valentín tiene 61 años de edad, es casado con tres hijos, pero ellos ya están casados.

Él se dedica a prestar sus servicios como albañil, ya tiene 25 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, fueron unos familiares quienes le enseñaron. Además en los meses de abril a octubre, que es la época en la que se siembra, él cultiva maíz y hace dos siembras al año en cada una hace 3500 metros cuadrados de maíz.

Valentín solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar 5 bolsas de cemento, media camionada de arena, 500 tejas de cemento y pago de mano de obra de los empleados. Con esta inversión él podrá repellar las paredes y cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que tiene varios años de haberla construido y por no contar con el dinero suficiente no había podido realizar esas mejoras, y las necesita hacer ya que en invierno su casa se moja, porque el techo no sirve. Al realizar esas mejorar su casa no se mojara y dudara más con el repello en las paredes. En el futuro Valentín desea construir unas habitaciones más, ya que le gustaría que sus hijos se fueran a vivir con él junto con sus esposas y sus nietos.
texts.en:
Valentin, 61, is married and has 3 grown children who are also all married. He has worked for 25 years as a mason, a trade that he learned from a family member. From April to October, the planting season, he also cultivates corn. He makes two plantings per year, each time planting 3500 square meters of corn. 

Valentin asks Fundacion Campo for a loan to buy 5 bags of cement, half a truckload of sand, 500 cement tiles and to pay laborers wages. With this investment he will be able to plaster the walls and change the roof on his home, since it was built several years ago. He doesn't have enough money to be able to make the improvements, which are necessary because in winter his house gets wet because the roof is inadequate. Once he has made the repairs, the water won't get in the house and the plaster on the walls will last longer. In the future, Valentin wants to add on some more rooms because he would like his children to bring their families to live with him.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of cement, half a truckload of sand, 500 cement tiles and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Mehri

texts.ru: Мехри женщина 52 лет, замужем мать четверых детей. Уже несколько лет занимается завозом и продажей материей. В бизнесе ей помогает её дочь. Мехри кроме своего бизнеса занимается шитьём женских платьев, поэтому вместо нее на месте деятельности часто сидит её старшая дочь. Сейчас уже стало достаточно холодно, поэтому большой спрос на зимние, теплые виды тканей. На получаемый кредит она планирует съездить за зимним ассортиментом материй. У неё свои постоянные клиенты, поэтому постоянно кипит торговля.
texts.en: Mehri is a 52 year-old married woman and a mother of four children.  She has been involved in delivering and selling fabrics for several years.  Her daughter helps her with the business.  Besides this business, Mehri is also involved in sewing women's dresses, which is the reason why her oldest daughter often sits at the retail outlet.  It has gotten quite cold now, causing a high demand for winter, warm types of fabrics.  Mehri wants to use this loan to bring in a winter selection of fabrics.  She has regular customers, and hence, her sales volume is always high.

loans.use: to purchase a winter selection of fabrics

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin, aged 37, is married to Regina and they are blessed with three children aged between 6 and 15 years. He is in the quarrying business and has been in this business for four years. The business earns him a monthly income of 10,000 KES.
This is Benjamin's second loan with Kiva partner KADET. He repaid his previous loan successfully. He will use this loan to buy mining tools and use part of it to buy groceries for his wife's grocery business. Benjamin hopes to start a construction company in the future.

loans.use: to buy mining tools.

loans.name: Shargiyya

texts.en:
Shargiyya is a widow with 3 children from Sumgayit, Azerbaijan. When her husband died in 2003, she realized that they had to start their life without the family bread-winner. It was really hard times for Shargiyya who, as the majority of real Azerbaijani women do, dedicated herself to family and had never worked before. So, the burden of supporting her three children fell on her delicate female shoulders.

Since 2003 she runs a tea-house business. Tea-houses are very popular in her motherland. They are the places where common people often meet with their friends and relatives, relax and have rest over a traditional cup of refreshing Azerbaijani tea.

Now, Shargiyya needs to buy wares for her tea house as the number of her customers constantly increases. She plans to buy tea-pots, cups, glasses and saucers and therefore she has applied for a loan of 500 USD. She is sure that her good business skills will be very helpful to her in repaying the loan back.

loans.use: To buy wares for tea-house

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is married and has four children who are going to school. He started his business in 2001 with borrowed capital and has since managed his business successfully.

Given the loan, he wants to buy sewing machines to enable his business to serve many clients a day as opposed to now.

He has plans of accumulating profits to open a tailoring school.

loans.use: Purchase sewing machines

loans.name: Lacin

texts.en: Lacin N. is a native of the Aghsu region of Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He started selling fruits and vegetables over 10 years ago. Lacin is currently selling his goods at the local bazaar in Aghsu. He is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a wider variety of fruits and vegetables during the summer season.

loans.use: To expand his current selection of goods

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos owns a car that he uses to work as a radio taxi operator during the week (Monday-Sunday). He resides in the zone of Alto Obrajes in the city of La Paz. He has a daughtrer who is independent.

It is the second time that he applies for a loan. His credit history with our institution qualifies him as client 1, meaning that he has paid in good faith his previous commitment. The amount he asks wil be invested in buying new tires, fixing the motor, and general maintenance of his car.

His credit history and work experience in the transportation service enables him to apply for this loan. The loan in return will give him the income needed to cover this commitment.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

Juan Carlos tiene una movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi de lunes a domingo. Su domicilio se encuentran ubicado en la zona de Alto Obrajes de la ciudad de La Paz. Tiene una hija que es independiente.

Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito. Su historial en nuestra institución lo califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de llantas, arreglo de motor y mantenimiento en general de su movilidad.

Sus antecedentes crediticios y trabajo le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en el servicio de transporte, el cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use: Maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en: Lili is 35 and married with 2 children. Her husband's income every fortnight is not sufficient to support their family. Lili has decided to do something herself about this situation. She has joined SPBD with the intention of getting financial assistance so as to better be able to supply her family's needs in future. She's very appreciative of  the support; she's planning to start up a take-away fast food stall in her town area.

loans.use: To start up a small business

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente V. is 35 years old living in Paraguay with his wife, Derlina. They do not have children and are currently focused on their business. Derlina and Vicente make a variety of breads, which they sell to various businesses in their neighborhood. 
For Vicente deciding to work as a baker was a natural progression. When he was a child Vicente lived in Argentina where he worked in a bakery. It was there that he learned how to make bread. He worked in this bakery for 10 years. Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit Vicente was finally able to open his own bakery. Today, his clientele is growing dramatically. He sells his bread to individual clients, as well as grocery stores, diners, bars and restaurants. 
With the credit he has solicited, Mr. V. will buy the ingredients need to make his bread. These items include: flour, butter, yeast and oil. He hopes by obtaining additional stock he will be able to increase his production and his income.

loans.use: TO PURHCASE FLOUR, YEAST, BUTTER AND OIL FOR HIS BAKERY

loans.name: Victor E.

texts.es:
