Client History: Victor has a vehicle that serves as a radio taxi for the APOLO company. His wife is a businesswoman. Their home is located in the village of Armonia. The business offices of the radio taxi are located in the village of Copacabana outside of the city of La Paz.

This is the second time that he has requested a loan. The amount requested will be used for the purchase of tires and the complete maintenance of his vehicle. His job allows him access to this loan, as he already has experience as a driver. Driving the taxi generates sufficient income to cover the loan and his personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kim Baker, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: Victor tiene una movilidad que trabaja como radio taxi de la empresa APOLO; su esposa es comerciante. Su domicilio se encuentran ubicado en la zona de villa Armonia; las oficinas de la empresa de radio taxi están ubicadas en la zona de Villa Copacabana de la ciudad de La Paz. Es segunda vez que solicita un crédito. El monto solicitado será destinado la compra de llantas y el mantenimiento completo de su vehiculo. Su trabajo le permite acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia como chofer. Esta actividad genera ingresos suficientes para cubrir el préstamo y para sus necesidades personales.

loans.use: Purchase of tires and maintenance of his taxi.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en:
Mrs. Beauty Osarekhoe is 33 years old, married with two children, and lives in Benin City. There, she deals with the sales of drinks and gift Items.

She is soliciting the loan amount of $1200 to buy more drinks and gift items for sale. She started this business in 2003 and has been a dedicated LAPO client.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and gift items to sell

loans.name: Mukaram

texts.en: Mukaram K. was born in 1961 in Asht, Tajikistan. She is divorced and has 4 children. Mrs Mukaram K.  has her own business in  livestock raising and selling and milk products making. It is the family business. She has the appropriate skills in livestock (she is experienced in the business for 10 years) which is why she has a large flock. In spite the fact that it is a very hard business she manages the livestock successfully. Now Mrs K.  requests the loan of $1200 to complete the building of a barn for her cows and bulls.

loans.use: To complete the construction of a barn for her cows and bulls.

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mr. Sophal H. (pictured with his wife) and his wife, Sreytouch SIN, married in 1996. They have two children: one son and one daughter, both of whom are studying in primary school.

Mr. Sophal is a taxi driver in Phnom Penh City. His wife stays at home taking care of their children. The family lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sophal is requesting a loan for the first time in the amount of $1000 for repairing his house.

loans.use: repairing their house

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven V., age 39, is a mother of one school-age child and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh city. They have lived here for around 20 years. She runs a business renting rooms to the garment workers; she also a staff at a factory and makes about $4 a day of profit.

Her husband, Mr. Ouk Bunthoeun, 41, is a government official with a salary $150 per month. She is hopeful to borrow some money to purchase wood to install in her house. (Husband is pictured because Mrs. Ven V. is not available)

loans.use: To purchase wood to install in her house (repairing)

loans.name: Consolatha's Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Consolatha is 27 years old and is married woman with 2 children, ages 11 and 7 years old. Consolatha sales clothes and soap, she started in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes (khanga) and soap for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Magreth, Rehema and Yusta, who have businesses dealing in general store,clothes & charcoal sales,and marker materials sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes (khanga) and soap fpr her business.

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.en:
Zamirahon B. lives in the high mountain Asht region of Tajikistan where she raises and sells livestock. She also works on a collective farm. Mrs. B. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008, and she is a serious entrepreneur. Her husband went to the Russian Federation to take a well-paying job, so now Mrs. B. is raising her child on her own.

Mrs. B. is applying to KIVA for a business support loan of $775.00 US to build a cowshed.

loans.use: To build a cowshed

loans.name: Yawovi

texts.fr:
Mr. Yawovi A. was born on December 8, 1983 in Tové-Agbéssia in the Kloto prefecture. He is married and has two children. He is an electrician by trade, but since 2003 he has been involved in the buying and selling of cereals and canned tomatoes. This has provided him with a good source of income because some of his clients are restaurant owners who always buy from him and pay him three days after he purchases his goods. Now his client base is expanding and he wants to keep up with demand, so he has requested this loan to buy 15 boxes of tomatoes and two sacks of corn.

Translated from French by Manuel Carreiro, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Yawovi est né le 08 décembre 1983 à Tové-Agbéssia dans la préfecture de Kloto. Il est marié et père de deux enfants. Il est électronicien de profession mais depuis l’année 2003, il s’est lancé dans le commerce de céréales et de tomates en boîte. Ce commerce lui procure de bons revenus car il a des clients qui sont des restauratrices qui achètent et payent chaque trois jours qui suivent l’achat. Aujourd’hui sa clientèle s’élargit et il désire la satisfaire ce qui l’amène à solliciter ce prêt pour acheter 15 cartons de tomates et deux sacs de maïs.

loans.use: Purchase of 15 boxes of tomatoes

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es:
Adelina is 30 years old and lives with her husband and 4 children, having a stable family life makes her very happy.

She dedicates her time to growing plantains and yucca, hard work that she performs with her husband on their small farm located away from their home. They have been farming for 20 years. Farming takes up most of her day, for this reason she organizes her time so as not to neglect her children. They also help on the farm in the afternoons; their company makes this activity very pleasant for her. However, she is worried about the price increase of the fertilizers and other products that help to get good yield from her soil. Adelina’s goal is for her children to become professionals, this is the reason for her earnest work.

The proceeds from the loan that she is currently requesting will go toward the purchase pf plantings of plantains, yucca and beans which will increase her production and make it more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Adelina tiene 30 años vivir con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, lo que le alegra mucho, por tener una familia estable.

Se dedica al cultivo de plátano y yuca, que con mucho esfuerzo produce en compañía de su esposo en sus chacras, que están alejadas de su casa, viene realizando esta actividad hace 20 años. La agricultura le toma gran parte del día, por ello, se organiza de manera adecuada para no descuidar a sus hijos, quienes también le ayudan en las tardes con sus chacra, lo que hace de su actividad algo placentero y agradable, por la compañía de sus hijos. Sin embargo, le preocupa el alza de precio de los abonos y los demás productos que ayudan a una buena producción de los terrenos. La meta de Adelina es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales, por ellos trabaja con ahínco.

El préstamo que pide hoy será invertido en la compra de plantaciones de plátano, yuca y frijoles para aumentar sus productos y hacerlos más rentables.

loans.use: Purchase of plantings of plantains, yucca and beans to increase her production.

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Sin S., 64, is married and lives with her husband. Living in Kampong Cham province, she and her husband, Kang Pech, 64, are rice farmers and are able to make around $1 of profit per day. 

This couple has three children, one is a goldsmith and two are garment workers. As the goldsmith's business is growing, Mrs. Sin would like a loan from Kiva to purchase more goldsmithing tools for her son.
(Mr. Kang Pech is pictured because his wife was not available.)

loans.use: To purchase more goldsmithing tools for her son.

loans.name: Esmeralda De Ancco Group

texts.en:
At approximately 2,100 meters in the department of Huancavelica, in the province of Churcampa in the community of Anco you can find the community bank of Esmeralda D. Anco. The community of Anco is the thoroughfare between Ayacucho and Huancayo. There is also a large market for fruits in this area. 

Francisca R. R. lives in Anco and is part of the community bank Esmeralda D. Anco. She lives there with her husband and two children who are in school, ages 10 and 5. Francisca runs her own small grocery store where she began her business with a few things but since then it has developed and grown. She has been a member of FINCA Perú for one year and since then she has been able to build savings from the business at her grocery store. With the money she receives from the loans she invests into her business for continued growth. She has a goal of leaving Anco and finding a different place to make a bigger business. She is saving to buy land in Huancayo. 

Martha Y. F. also lives in Anco, she lives with her husband and her 4 children who are in school, and are 15, 12, 10, 8 years old. Martha runs her own hostel and her husband has a store where he sells items such as windows and mirrors. With her past loans her husband was able to open his window shop. She will use this loan to invest in her hostel. She dreams that with the income she and her husband receive from their jobs she will be able to keep her children in school so they can eventually have professional jobs. She is saving her money to have spending money now and just in case she needs it in the future for a surprise incident.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es:
La señora Amanda pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres D. Éxito, el cual está ubicado en el Jr. Aguaytia Mz. O Lt. 13 Urbanización el Triunfo, distrito D. Manantay, provincia D. Coronel Portillo, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 51 años D. edad, es madre D. 3 hijos mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo se dedica al manejo D. una motokar.

Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.300 deciD. invertir en la venta D. ropa. Tiene 8 años trabajando con el Banco Comunal.

En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño taller D. costura, cosiendo diferentes prendas D. vestir, actividad que le brinda ganancias para pagar su préstamo con puntualidad.

Con este préstamo D. S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 5 meses comprará 1 maquina D. coser, 5 kilos D. tela algodón, 8 metros D. blondas, 2 docenas D. cierre, etc. 

Gracias al apoyo D. Manuela Ramos su negocio se ha ampliado y la estabilidad económica D. su familia ha mejorado.
texts.en:
Amanda belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres D. Éxito” (Successful Women), which is located at Jr. Aguaytia Mz. O Lt. 13 in the Triunfo neighborhood, Manantay district, Coronel Portillo province, Ucayali department. She is 51 years old, mother to 3 grown children, married, and her husband drives a motorcar. With the first loan that she received from Manuela Ramos for S/.300 she decided to invest in selling clothing She has worked with the Communal Bank for 8 years. Today she has a small seamstress shop, sewing different articles of clothing, an activity that provides her earnings to pay her loan with punctuality. With this loan for S/.3,000, which will be repaid in 5 months, she will buy 1 sewing machine, 5 kilos of cotton fabric, 8 meters of silk lace, 2 dozen zippers, etc. Thanks to the support of Manuela Ramos her business has expanded and her family’s economic stability has improved.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine, cotton fabric, lace, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Julian

texts.es:
Juilian C.  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno cuya producción de leche comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además, trabaja como encargado de  aserradero en la venta de madera en una zona periférica de la ciudad de El Alto
 
Vive en la comunidad Chuñochununi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Esta casado, su esposa le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su pequeña de 6 meses. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera, asi incrementará su producción de leche, por lo tanto, sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Juilian C. works raising cows whose milk he sells to PIL Andina (an industrial milk plant). In addition, he works in a sawmill selling wood in a surrounding area of the city of El Alto. He lives in the community of Chuñochununi in the province of Los Andes in the La Paz department located three hours from the city of La Paz. He is married and his wife helps him with the cows as well as taking care of her 6 month old daughter. The loan will used to purchase a milk cow which will increase his milk production and therefore his income. This is his first loan with Impro, but an evaluation performed qualifies him for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. Se dedica a realizar bellos y artísticos objetos artesanales, adquirió de sus padres esta habilidad de transformar simples objetos en artesanías muy cotizadas en el ámbito turístico, ella elabora desde llaveros, aretes, hasta objetos en barro que  reflejan las costumbres de su tierra y todo lo que fabrica lo vende al por mayor a las principales tiendas artesanales de su medio, de esta manera, por más de 20 años, ha sido un sostén importante en su hogar, lo que la anima a seguir adelante, ya que  todavía sigue apoyando a la última de sus hijas en sus estudios superiores. Carmen tiene ese el gran sueño de que sus productos sean  calificados para exportar a otros países, para lo cual se viene capacitando. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ella demostró ser responsable en sus pagos. Carmen invertirá esta vez en la compra de los materiales que utiliza para elaborar sus artesanías, como calabazas, pinturas y arcilla.
texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old. She lives with her husband and children. She sells beautiful handicraft items. She learned the skill of transforming simple objects into valuable pieces of art from her parents, items that are very popular among the tourists. She makes different items from key chains, to clay objects that reflect the customs of her people. She manufactures wholesale items to sell to large handicraft shops. She has been an important support for her family for more than 20 years, which encourages her to go on, as she still has to support her last daughter with her higher education. Carmen’s dream is to obtain a certificate to export her products to other countries and for that reason she’s doing training on this matter. This is the third time she requests for a loan from MFP, and all this time she has proven to be responsible with her payments. Carmen will invest on the purchase of more material to use in her handicraft items, such as vases, paint and clay.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for her handicrafts

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen P. is married and has three children. His wife sells eggs. He has attended junior high school. 

Stephen sells electrical gadgets and parts at Eshaman Junction in Elmina, which he has done since 2002. Stephen uses his income to pay rent, utility bills and other financial expenses for his family.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more electrical items to meet the increased demand from his costumers. The profits from the business will be saved towards acquiring a piece of land for the building a family house.  Having a family house allows Stephen to stop paying rent and provide a comfortable shelter for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more electrical items to sell

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en:
Kwame A. is married and has 4 dependents. He has received schooling through primary education. Kwame makes and sells palm oil at Dosi near Cape Coast, which he has done for about 9 years. His wife is a farmer. Kwame uses his income to pay for the children's school fees, rent, utility bills and other financial expenses.

Kwame will use the loan as additional capital to enable him to expand the purchase of palm fruit for the production of the palm oil to meet the increase in demand by his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Kwame plans to reinvest for the expansion of his trade in palm oil.

loans.use: additional capital to enable him to expand the purchase of palm fruit
